headlines: Andhra CM inducts 14 new ministers into Cabinet in massive reshuffle
text: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has reconstituted his Cabinet and inducted 14 new ministers. He has retained 11 ministers, including Deputy CM K Narayanaswamy, Women and Child Welfare Minister Taneti Vanita and Social Welfare Minister Pinipe Viswarupu. The revamped Cabinet will see 68% representation from Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and Backward Classes.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Students clash in JNU over non-veg food, Ram Navami pooja; some injured
text: Some students in Delhi's JNU sustained injuries following a clash between members of ABVP and the Left-wing over the consumption of non-vegetarian food and the conduct of Ram Navami pooja. ABVP allegedly tried to stop non-veg from being cooked in Kaveri hostel mess. As per ABVP, however, Left-wing students tried to disrupt Ram Navami pooja. Police have been called in.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Congress leader questions Smriti Irani on rising petrol, LPG prices in flight
text: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress, questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing prices of petrol and LPG. Irani initially said that D'Souza was "blocking the way", and when the minister was asked about "stoves without gas", she said, "please don't lie". Recently, petrol prices were hiked 14 times in 16 days.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Not scared of any ban: Cong leader who questioned Irani on petrol prices in flight
text: Netta D'Souza, the Acting President of All India Mahila Congress who questioned Union Minister Smriti Irani on a flight about increasing petrol and LPG prices, tweeted, "Not scared of any ban. I'll keep showing Mirror of Truth to Modi Govt & its Ministers!" D'Souza was responding to a Twitter user who said she could be handed a six-month flight ban.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: ED questions Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge in National Herald case
text: Enforcement Directorate on Monday questioned Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge in connection with a money laundering probe linked to the National Herald case. BJP's Subramanian Swamy had in a Delhi court filed a complaint against Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, their companies and associated persons. Leaders Motilal Vora and Oscar Fernandes were also named.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Don't try to break homes: Prakash Raj on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
text: Actor-politician Prakash Raj on Friday tweeted, "Don't try to break homes, Mr Home Minister. We dare you #stopHindiImposition. We love our diversity, we love our mother tongue, we love our identities." His tweet comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Why administer booster dose only through pvt hospitals: Congress
text: Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi has criticised the BJP-led Centre for not allowing government hospitals to administer COVID-19 vaccine booster dose. "Why administer this booster dose only through private hospitals and have no option of getting it through government hospitals. Does it make sense?," asked Singhvi. He further accused this policy of being "discriminatory" towards poor people.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: CPI MP urges PM to provide free COVID-19 vaccine booster doses
text: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to PM Narendra Modi urging him to provide COVID-19 vaccine booster doses for free at public healthcare institutions. Criticising Centre's move to allow only private vaccination centres to administer paid booster shots to adults above 18 years, Viswam said that the privatisation of the vaccination drive is ill-planned and disastrous.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: TN Assembly passes resolution against CUET, BJP walks out
text: The Tamil Nadu Assembly adopted a resolution urging the Centre to withdraw the proposal to conduct Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission in central varsities. The resolution was supported by all the parties including the main opposition AIADMK. However, BJP staged a walkout. The resolution claimed that CUET "will sideline the diverse school education systems across the country".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP to fight Himachal elections under CM Thakur's leadership: Nadda
text: BJP President JP Nadda has said that the party will contest this year's Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections under CM Jai Ram Thakur's leadership. "He (Thakur) will not be replaced and the BJP will contest the Assembly elections under his leadership," Nadda said. "10-15% BJP MLAs did not get tickets in UP...and it is likely to happen here too," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Punjab Congress' Twitter account gets hacked, location changed to 'Metaverse'
text: Punjab Congress' official Twitter account was hacked on Monday as their timeline was spammed with random users being tagged. The location of the account was also changed from 'Chandigarh' to 'Metaverse'. Recently, some of the prominent Twitter accounts including the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister's Office and the University Grants Commission were hacked for a while by the miscreants.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly: Telangana CM
text: Amid the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said, "Is growing paddy Telangana farmers' fault?" "I warn PM Modi that you can't mess with farmers. Indian history is a testament that wherever farmers cried, government loses power. Nobody is permanent...When in power, don't treat farmers unfairly," Rao added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Qutub Minar was built after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples: VHP
text: Vishva Hindu Parishad Spokesman Vinod Bansal on Sunday said Qutub Minar was built "with materials obtained after demolishing 27 Hindu-Jain temples". "Qutub Minar was actually 'Vishnu Stambh'...The superimposed structure was built just to tease the Hindu community," Bansal added. He also demanded that the 27 demolished temples be rebuilt and Hindus be allowed to offer prayers there.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Maha BJP chief asks Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials
text: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil asked Congress to prove its Hindutva credentials by announcing that it welcomes the abrogation of Article 370. He was addressing a press conference after campaigning for BJP candidate for Kolhapur North Assembly bypoll. "If they want to preserve Hindutva in Kolhapur, then Congress should announce that it welcomes the removal of Article 370," Patil said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP doesn't have patent for Hindutva: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said BJP doesn't hold the "patent for Hindutva" and that Shiv Sena has always been committed to bhagva (saffron) and Hindutva. "I wonder had Lord Ram not been born, what issue the BJP would have raised in politics. Since BJP is bereft of issues, it is talking about religion and [spreading] hatred," Thackeray said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Opposition is weak, BJP hammering it through probe agencies: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut has accused the BJP-led Centre of "hammering the opposition through central investigative agencies" which already is "weak". "Despite this, the opposition is not ready to surrender," Raut said. "The weak opposition is being hammered...and our HM (Amit) Shah says, they want to see a strong opposition! This joke is interesting," added Raut.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Sitaram Yechury re-elected as CPI(M) General Secretary for 3rd term
text: Sitaram Yechury was re-elected as General Secretary of CPI(M) for a third consecutive term at party's 23rd congress meet in Kerala's Kannur on Sunday. A 17-member politburo and 85-member central committee was also inducted at meet. Yechury, who was first elected to the post in 2015, had succeeded senior party leader Prakash Karat, who held the post for 10 years.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: SP not working for Muslims, alleges party's Lok Sabha MP Barq
text: Samajwadi Party MP Shafiqur Rahman Barq has accused his own party of not "working for Muslims". "I am not satisfied with the working, the entire Samajwadi is not working for Muslims," the Lok Sabha MP said after he voted for the UP Legislative Council elections on Saturday. He also accused the Yogi Adityanath-led government of not "doing justice with Muslims".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Nitish Kumar will be CM till NDA govt exists in Bihar: JD(U) leader
text: Nitish Kumar will hold the post of Chief Minister of Bihar till the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) government remains in the state, Janata Dal (U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said on Sunday. He added that BJP was not pressurising Kumar to leave the post. "There is no dispute within JD(U) for the Chief Minister post in Bihar," Kushwaha said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: NC will welcome those who want to strengthen pluralistic J&K: Farooq
text: National Conference (NC) chief Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday that party will welcome those who want to strengthen the idea of a united, democratic and pluralistic Jammu and Kashmir. Abdullah added that NC's vision is to protect the social, cultural and political interests of people from all regions and religions. He made the remarks at a party event in Jammu.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP gave freedom to UP's private schools to raise fees: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Sunday said BJP-led Uttar Pradesh government has given the state's private schools the freedom to increase their fees. "Within 10 days of government formation...[Punjab] CM Bhagwant Mann issued an order saying private schools cannot increase their fees," Sisodia said. Delhi's private schools have been stopped from arbitrarily increasing fees since 2015, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Unfortunate that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files': Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said it is "unfortunate" that people in power promoted 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "An individual made a movie (The Kashmir Files) showing atrocities on Hindus," Pawar added. "It depicted that in Kashmir, the Hindu Pandits were minorities and they were driven out during VP Singh-led government which was supported by BJP," Pawar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Macron to face Marine Le Pen in presidential election in France
text: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to face candidate Marine Le Pen in the presidential election runoff scheduled to be held on April 24. They emerged as the top two candidates after the first round of voting for the presidential election. Notably, Le Pen has called for banning hijab in public and halal butchers.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Gujarat's education system is crumbling, says Arvind Kejriwal
text: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that the people in Gujarat have begun to question the "crumbling education" system in the state being ruled by BJP for the last 27 years. Kejriwal promised that his party will provide just as "good education" to the students there as it is available in Delhi if voted to power in the upcoming polls.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP govt in UP has failed on all fronts: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday said that the Uttar Pradesh government has failed on all fronts and the BJP is insensitive towards the problems of the youth. Yadav further said that BJP wants to rule the state by making people feel afraid, "which is highly condemnable in a democracy," adding that BJP has defamed UP.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong neither Indian nor national, only brother-sister party: Nadda
text: While addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Sunday said that Congress is neither Indian nor national, but only a brother-sister party. He further said, "Apart from BJP, there is no political party in the country that runs without promoting familism, many opposition parties have become regional parties only."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Important to fight together as BJP trying to weaken Opp'n: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Sunday said the Opposition must "fight together...[as BJP-RSS] are trying to see to it that only one party remains". Reacting to BSP chief Mayawati's comments that Congress should worry about itself, Kharge said, "Congress has always been with people." He asserted that Congress had indeed invited Mayawati to lead the anti-BJP alliance in Uttar Pradesh.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AR Rahman's tweet on 'Goddess Tamil' goes viral after Amit Shah's Hindi remark
text: An illustration of 'Thamizhanangu' (Goddess Tamil) shared by AR Rahman has gone viral on Twitter. Rahman also included a line written by modern Tamil poet Bharathidasan which read, "Beloved Tamil is the root of our existence." This comes after Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cong burns effigies of Amitabh, Akshay Kumar for not protesting fuel price hikes
text: Madhya Pradesh Congress burnt the effigies of Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar for allegedly being selective in their criticism of fuel price hikes and inflation. "In 2012, these actors used to tweet against fuel price hikes and inflation...At that time, an LPG cylinder used to cost ₹300-400, while petrol and diesel was around ₹60/litre," said Congress MLA PC Sharma.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: 110 arrested for protesting outside Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house
text: A total of 110 persons have been arrested in connection with the protest outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai house on Friday. The employees of MSRTC protested, claiming he didn't do anything for their demand of merging the corporation with the state government. On Friday evening, 103 were arrested on charges of rioting, unlawful assembly, assault and criminal conspiracy.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Country didn't only love me, but it also hit me with shoes: Rahul
text: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Saturday commented that India not only gave him love but also hit him with shoes. "I thought why is this happening? And got the answer that the country wants to teach me...The country is telling me that you should learn, understand," he said. He made the comments at the launch of a book.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Senior police officer removed over protest outside Pawar's Mumbai home
text: Mumbai Police Joint Commissioner (Law & Order) Vishwas Nangre Patil on Saturday removed DCP (Zone II), Yogesh Kumar, from his post in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside the house of NCP chief Sharad Pawar in Mumbai. Neelotpal, DCP (Detection) of Mumbai Police Crime Branch, has been given the post. Kumar was removed for failing to discharge duties.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Distributing freebies policy decision of parties, can't intervene: EC tells SC
text: The Election Commission (EC) informed the Supreme Court that distributing freebies is a policy decision of a political party and that it doesn't have the power to intervene. "Whether such decisions are financially viable or have an adverse effect, has to be decided by voters," the EC added. Such an action would be an overreach of its powers, it claimed.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Language chauvinism will boomerang: KTR on Amit Shah's Hindi remark
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Sunday criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah's remark that people of different states should communicate with each other in Hindi and not English. Rao said, "Language chauvinism/hegemony will boomerang." He asked, "Why don't we let people of our great nation decide what to eat, what to wear, who to pray to...what language to speak!"
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Goa CM Pramod Sawant expands his Cabinet by inducting 3 more ministers
text: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Saturday expanded his Cabinet by inducting three more MLAs as ministers. BJP MLAs Nilkanth Halarnkar and Subhash Phaldesai and Maharashtrawadi Gomantak Party (MGP) MLA Sudin Madhav Dhavalikar took oath in the presence of CM Sawant. Goa Governor PS Sreedharan Pillai administered the oath of office to the three new ministers.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: TMC leader says, 'We can blow up area in 10 mins'; Malviya shares video
text: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Saturday shared a video wherein a TMC leader purportedly said, "Don't worry we have so much stock of bombs and guns that we can blow up the whole area in 10 minutes." He claimed the comments were made by TMC's Deputy Pradhan Sakir Ahmad. "West Bengal under Mamata Banerjee is waiting to explode," Malviya wrote.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Cong should worry about itself: Mayawati on Rahul's UP alliance offer comment
text: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BSP chief Mayawati didn't respond to the party's alliance offer in Uttar Pradesh during elections, Mayawati said the Congress needs to worry about itself first. "The Congress must think 100 times before making such comments. They've been unable to win against the BJP, but they just keep taking these potshots," she added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Mumbai Police records Sanjay Raut's statement in phone tapping case
text: The Mumbai Police on Saturday recorded the statement on senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut at the office of the party's mouthpiece Saamna. Raut is one of the two politicians whose phones were allegedly tapped illegally by the Maharashtra Intelligence Department when IPS officer Rashmi Shukla was its chief. The recording lasted for nearly one hour, a police officer said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Efforts to unite Opp'n parties have not materialised yet: RJD
text: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha on Saturday said that the efforts to unite the Opposition have not materialised yet. "Opposition parties have to clear their vision for unemployment, inflation, and a better economy, only then opposition unity is possible," he added. Earlier, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi had said discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against the PM and RSS.
author: Shailesh

headlines: AAP lost deposits in UP, it'll lose in Himachal also: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said that the BJP will retain power in Himachal Pradesh by winning the upcoming state Assembly elections. Further speaking about Aam Aadmi Party, Thakur said, "AAP has lost deposits in Uttar Pradesh and it will lose in Himachal Pradesh also." Notably, AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari joined BJP on Friday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Amrinder Singh Brar appointed as Congress’ Punjab chief
text: Three-time MLA Amrinder Singh Brar, also known as Raja Warring, was appointed as the Congress' new Punjab chief by party President Sonia Gandhi on Saturday. Warring served as the Transport Minister in the previous state government. Meanwhile, Pratap Singh Bajwa was appointed as the leader of legislature party, while Raj Kumar as its deputy leader.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: All institutions in hands of RSS, we have to protect them: Rahul
text: During a book launch event in Delhi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday alleged that all institutions in India are in the hands of the RSS. He said, "We've to protect the Constitution...To save the Constitution, we've to protect our institutions...But all the institutions are in...hands of RSS." Earlier, Rahul had said that Opposition parties must unite to fight BJP.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We can also take action against Kejriwal in BJP-ruled states: Singh
text: After Punjab Police booked BJP leader Naveen Jindal, the party's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has said that BJP can also file FIRs against AAP leaders but the party doesn't believe in "low-level politics". "We've BJP governments in more than half of the states...we can take action against [Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal] there," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Kejriwal ignored and insulted us: Anup Kesari after joining BJP
text: Former Himachal Pradesh AAP chief Anup Kesari criticised Arvind Kejriwal and accused him of "being ignorant" against AAP Himachal unit leaders during a roadshow in Mandi constituency. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state party workers when he came for a rally. In the hill state, AAP workers considered this ignorance as an insult and quit the party for self-respect," Kesari said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Was born in centre of power but I don't have interest in it: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday said that he was born in the "centre of power", but he "honestly" doesn't have an interest in it. He claimed that there're politicians who think about attaining power throughout the day, then sleep and repeat the cycle, while he tries to understand the country instead. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: AAP was about to remove Anup Kesari on allegation of dirty acts against women: Sisodia
text: A day after AAP chief in Himachal Pradesh Anup Kesari joined BJP, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said that the party was about to remove him on the allegation of dirty acts against women. "The place of such people is in BJP only," Sisodia added. "The top leadership of the BJP is scared of AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal," Sisodia tweeted.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: We sent message to Mayawati for alliance, offered CM post: Rahul
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that amid the Uttar Pradesh elections, his party had sent a message to BSP chief Mayawati for an alliance and offered her the CM post, but she didn't respond. He also claimed that she didn't fight for "Dalit voices" because of CBI, ED and Pegasus. Gandhi was speaking at a book launch event.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Nothing to worry: K'taka CM after Pai seeks PM's help over B'luru roads
text: Reacting to Information Technology industry veteran TV Mohandas Pai's remarks on Bengaluru's roads, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said there is no such reason to worry. Bommai also assured that there will be large-scale road repair works in the city in the coming days. Notably, Pai had tweeted, "[Bengaluru's] roads are bad and traffic sucks...[PM Narendra Modi, please intervene and help]."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: MNS plays 'Hanuman Chalisa' outside Shiv Sena’s Mumbai office; 2 detained
text: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) played 'Hanuman Chalisa' on a loudspeaker outside Shiv Sena's headquarter in Mumbai on the occasion of Ram Navami on Sunday. The Mumbai Police stopped the 'Hanuman Chalisa' and detained MNS leader Yashwant Killedar and a taxi driver. This comes after MNS chief Raj Thackeray called for the removal of loudspeakers from mosques.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Dissolve Petroleum Ministry with immediate effect: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre over hike in fuel price and said that Central government is "robbing the people". "If no government regulations...can control this reckless hike in fuel prices, and if everything is up to the market then what is the use of Petroleum Ministry? These ministries should be shut down with immediate effect," he tweeted.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Jharkhand to hold three-tier panchayat polls from May 14 to 27
text: The three-tier panchayat polls in Jharkhand will be held from May 14 to May 27 in four phases, the State Election Commission (SEC) announced. Notably, 9,470 seats will be added to the open category as the polls will be held without any reservations for OBCs. The reservations for the seats have been removed in compliance with a Supreme Court order.
author: Shailesh

headlines: We're planning such that foreigners will seek jobs in Punjab: Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday called for the stop of the "brain drain" from the state, saying, "We're planning in such...way that foreigners will come here for jobs." Following this, Congress MLA Sukhpal Khaira criticised the remark, saying, "Hope foreigners approach...but...we've to set our house in order." Mann claimed that ₹15 lakh was lost per person going abroad.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP's personal agenda is to prioritise Hindi over other languages: HD Kumaraswamy
text: Janata Dal (Secular) leader HD Kumaraswamy has criticised Home Minister Amit Shah over his statement that Hindi should be an alternative to English. Kumaraswamy also accused the BJP-led Centre of imposing their "personal agendas" on citizens. "Central government...(is) actually trying to forcibly run their personal agendas. But they won't succeed. People will teach them a lesson," he said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP's Kirron Kher meets SP's Jaya Bachchan in Parliament, shares pic
text: BJP MP from Chandigarh Kirron Kher on Thursday met Rajya Sabha MP from Samajwadi Party Jaya Bachchan in the Parliament. Sharing the picture on social media, Kher wrote, "Wonderful to meet Jaya after so long in Parliament." The Budget Session of the Parliament ended today, a day ahead of the schedule. It had started on January 31.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, 2 others join BJP
text: Anup Kesari, president of Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Himachal Pradesh unit, along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Unna chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state AAP workers when he came for a rally...they considered this ignorance...quit for self-respect," Kesari said. "Only Kejriwal...Bhagwant Mann participated in the roadshow," Singh said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: MSRTC employees protest outside Pawar's Mumbai house, throw shoes
text: Over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), who are seeking the corporation's merger with government, protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday. Some hurled shoes at his house. The workers blamed Pawar for not resolving their issues. "Some 120 MSRTC employees have died by suicide...These are not suicides, but murders," an employee said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: How much did Congress earn and spend in FY21 as compared to FY20?
text: The income of Indian National Congress declined by over 58% in financial year 2020-21, down from ₹682.2 crore in the previous fiscal to ₹285.7 crore, according to its audit report submitted to Election Commission. The party's expenditure dipped from ₹998.15 crore in the previous fiscal year to ₹209 crore in FY 2021. Congress' income in FY19 stood at ₹918 crore.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Karnataka minister Eshwarappa, BJP corporator booked for hate speech
text: Karnataka Police has lodged an FIR against state minister KS Eshwarappa and BJP corporator Channabasappa on charges of making provocative statements following the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Shivamogga. The complainant, who is a local resident, claimed that because of Eshwarappa's communal incitement and statements of provocation, Shivamogga witnessed violence after Harsha's murder.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory: Sanjay Raut
text: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday alleged that BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory. "A presentation...has been made to the MHA...This has been going on for the last two months and I am saying this with full responsibility," he said, adding that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is also aware of this development.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Tharoor clarifies after pic with Supriya Sule goes viral, says 'she was speaking softly'
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has issued a clarification after a picture of him chatting with Supriya Sule during Farooq Abdullah's speech in Parliament went viral. "She was asking me a policy question because she was about to speak next. She was speaking softly so as not to disturb Farooq Sahib, so I leaned over to hear her," he tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: It seems there's Taliban rule in Rajasthan: Poonia on Karauli violence
text: Rajasthan BJP president Satish Poonia on Friday said, "The way CM Ashok Gehlot is doing the politics of appeasement in Rajasthan, it seems that there is Taliban rule in the state." He claimed the human rights of people are being violated in Rajasthan. The BJP leader further demanded a judicial investigation into clashes that broke out in Karauli last week.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 4th pillar of democracy dismantled: Rahul on journalists stripped in MP
text: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Madhya Pradesh government after photos of journalists forced to strip to their undergarments at a police station in Sidhi went viral on social media. "The fourth pillar of democracy ‍was dismantled in the lockup! Either sit in the lap of the government and sing their praises or go to jail," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Hatred is being spread & country is being divided: Rahul Gandhi
text: After meeting Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Sharad Yadav, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that hatred is being spread and the country is being divided. Rahul said, "I agree with what he (Sharad Yadav) said today that the country is in a very bad situation." "India was one nation earlier, [BJP] has created different nations within the nation now," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Punjab govt failed to maintain law and order, regulate sand prices: Sidhu
text: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said that the state government is "failing" to maintain law and order situation and regulate the sand prices in Punjab. "Only announcements are being made...no notification regarding any announcement has been issued so far. The price of electricity is also likely to increase from the next month," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Parties against RSS, PM Modi should come together: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that discussions were on to unite Opposition parties against PM Narendra Modi, RSS and what should be the framework of it. "The BJP thinks that by spreading hatred or by beating up people, economy can be improved," Gandhi added. "We have to bring people together. Our tradition of brotherhood must be restored," Gandhi further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP trying to take India in direction of a crisis similar to Sri Lanka: Gehlot
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the BJP-led Centre is trying to take India in the direction of an economic crisis similar to Sri Lanka. "In Sri Lanka, people do not have food because there too the attention was diverted in the name of nationalism...The Modi government is trying to take India in the same direction," Gehlot said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No restrictions imposed on news media in Jammu & Kashmir: Centre
text: Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Anurag Thakur, has said that the Centre has not imposed any restrictions on news media in Jammu & Kashmir.  "Home Ministry has informed that there have been no instances of any harassment to the media persons by the authorities since 2017," Thakur said while responding to a question in Rajya Sabha on Thursday.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Against the Constitution: TMC MP on Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark
text: TMC MP Saugata Roy criticised Amit Shah's remark that "people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English" and said that imposing Hindi in non-Hindi speaking states is "against" the Constitution. "If BJP forcibly wants to impose Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states then it will be protested and resisted. Even Nehru said that Hindi won't be imposed," Roy added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: It's no secret that I am Sharad Pawar's man: Sena MP Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that it is no secret that he is NCP chief Sharad Pawar's man. "While I've been in the Sena, my relations with Pawar are close...BJP is upset because of this," he added. This comes after Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of Raut in connection with a land scam case.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Earlier I could meet only 70% population, now I can meet 100%: Supriyo
text: TMC candidate for the Ballygunge Assembly by-poll, Babul Supriyo, has said that when he was in BJP, he could meet only "70% of the population" but now he is "free to meet 100%". "A communal stamp was imposed over my image. But it's not true," he said. Notably, West Bengal Imams Association has opposed Supriyo's candidature and called him "communal".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Hindus reject it: Tharoor on mahant's rape threat to Muslim women
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to the video of a Hindu mahant threatening to publicly rape Muslim women, saying, "The vast majority of Hindus reject and disown such elements." He added that as a Hindu, he can tell his Muslim friends that "thugs" like this don't represent Hindus just like an Islamic State extremist doesn't represent them.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: We will never let Hindi be our national language: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said that as a Kannadiga, he took "strong offence" to Union Minister Amit Shah urging people to talk in Hindi. He added, "Hindi isn't our national language and we will never let it...be." Earlier, Shah said that people in different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Sisodia to visit Gujarat schools to 'inspect' BJP's work in education sector
text: Delhi Education Minister Manish Sisodia said that he will be visiting Gujarat on Monday for an "inspection" of the state's government schools to know about BJP's work in the sector for the past 27 years. This comes after Gujarat Minister Jitu Vaghani said that those who are unhappy with Gujarat's education system should move to other states or countries.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Cong denied permission to hold protest in Guj, police cites 'anti-govt slogans'
text: Congress was denied permission by police to hold a protest against "rising prices" and "unemployment" at Bahumali Bhavan Chowk in Gujarat's Rajkot. DCP Praveen Kumar cited the spread of COVID-19 and the possibility of raising anti-government slogans as the reasons for denying permission. Meanwhile, Congress alleged that the police is "acting as a tool in the hands of the BJP".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Doubt if states will be able to pay salaries: Mamata Banerjee
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee once again criticised Centre's economic policies and said, "Country's economic situation is getting bad to worse, I doubt if states will be able to pay salaries in coming days." "The rise in fuel prices is affecting the lives of people. I request Centre to control fuel prices and temporarily stop collecting toll tax," she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Impose Article 356, we will win by bigger margin: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee
text: TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee claimed that his party will come back to power by winning 250 seats if Centre imposes Article 356 in Bengal. This statement comes after opposition parties have been calling for imposition of Article 356 in West Bengal after the Birbhum incident. "Many more leaders want to leave BJP and join our party," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: End of BJP in K'taka, says ex-PM Deve Gowda amid loudspeaker issue
text: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said that implementing the policy of banning the use of loudspeakers by religious sites will be an "end of BJP" in Karnataka. His comments came after the Bengaluru Police issued notices to 301 mosques, temples, churches, restaurants and other establishments to use their loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Himachal ministers, MLAs will now pay tax as 5-decade-old practice ends
text: The Himachal Pradesh cabinet has now decided to end the five-decade-old practice of the state bearing the income tax amount on salaries and allowances paid to its ministers and legislators. This decision comes after the Himachal Pradesh High Court sought response from the state government on a PIL challenging the provisions of Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly allowing such exemptions.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rahul runs Cong round-the-clock, should be made party chief: Sharad Yadav
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Sharad Yadav backed Rahul Gandhi's name for the post of Congress President and said that he runs the party "round the clock".  "I think he should be made the party president. Only then can something big be done," Yadav said. Rahul Gandhi met Yadav today, weeks after he merged his LJD party with RJD.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Around 87,000 family cards issued to sex workers in TN: State minsiter
text: The State Minister for Food and Civil Supplies R Sakkarapani has said that 86,986 Smart Family (Ration) Cards have been issued to sex workers across Tamil Nadu. He also said that the Tamil Nadu Government has provided 2,429 family cards to transgenders till March 21, 2022. Notably, the state government has deleted 1,98,264 bogus ration cards, he said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Entire Andhra Pradesh cabinet resigns as CM Jagan prepares new cabinet
text: As Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy is preparing a new cabinet, all 24 cabinet ministers resigned on Thursday after completing their final cabinet meeting. The ministers sent their resignations to Reddy at the state secretariat. Notably, the YSRCP chief had planned to reshuffle his cabinet in December 2021, but it was postponed due to the coronavirus pandemic.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Omar Abdullah questioned by ED in J&K Bank scam case
text: ED on Thursday questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in connection with the J&K money laundering case in Delhi. Criticising the move, his party JKNC said, "Even though this exercise is political in nature he will cooperate as there is no wrongdoing on his part." It added that Abdullah didn't seek a postponement despite this being the month of Ramzan.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Manipur minister meets girl, who attended school with sister in lap
text: Manipur minister Thongam Biswajit Singh on Wednesday met Meiningsinliu Pamei, the 10-year-old girl who attended school while her two-year-old sister sat in her lap. Pamei's picture had gone viral earlier. "We have decided to assist her education through a boarding school and promised her parents that I will be looking after all her expenses till she graduates," Singh tweeted.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Pic of Tharoor & Supriya Sule chatting during a speech in LS goes viral; sparks memes
text: Video and picture of Congress MP Shashi Tharoor and NCP MP Supriya Sule chatting during former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah's speech in the Lok Sabha have gone viral on social media. "Shashi Tharoor teaching us that work life balance is important," a twitter user wrote with the picture. "That admiring look," wrote another.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh, daughter Chitra join AAP
text: Former Haryana Congress leader Nirmal Singh Mohra and his daughter Chitra Sarwara on Thursday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in presence of Arvind Kejriwal. "This will definitely strengthen the party," AAP leader Sushil Gupta tweeted. Singh was a two-time minister in the Haryana government and a four-time MLA from the Naggal Assembly constituency. Notably, Singh had founded Haryana Democratic Front.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Rajya Sabha misses 100% productivity in Budget Session by just 10 minutes
text: The Rajya Sabha clocked 99.80% productivity during the Budget Session that concluded on Thursday, PTI reported on Thursday quoting officials. It added that the Rajya Sabha missed the 100% landmark just by 10 minutes. This is the Upper House's third-best productive session in the last 14 sessions since the Monsoon Session (243rd Session) of 2017, the Rajya Sabha officials said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CBI makes first arrests in Birbhum violence case, nabs 4 from Mumbai
text: Days after at least nine people were killed in West Bengal's Birbhum, the CBI on Thursday arrested four people in Mumbai in connection with the case. These are the first arrests made by the CBI since it took over the case last month. Miscreants had allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village on March 21.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SP MLA's petrol pump razed with bulldozers in UP, video surfaces
text: A petrol pump owned by SP MLA Shazil Islam Ansari was razed with bulldozers by district officials after claiming that it was built without necessary permission in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. A video of the incident has surfaced online. This comes days after a purported video clip showed Ansari making provocative remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: 'Goondagardi' not good for country: Kejriwal on BJP after attack
text: Criticising BJP for the attack on his house, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that "goondagardi is not good for the country". "The protesters were people from the BJP. They came to my house and climbed the walls. My elderly parents were there. We weren't there at home," he further added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Voters don’t accept Babul Supriyo: CPM candidate on Bengal bypolls
text: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly bypolls, CPM's candidate from Ballygunge constituency, Saira Shah Halim, said on Wednesday that people aren't willing to vote for Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Babul Supriyo. Halim, who is also actor Naseeruddin Shah's niece, added that Supriyo is seen as "anti-minority" and isn't accepted by 'Bangali Bhadralok' (Bengali intellectuals). Supriyo resigned from BJP in 2021.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday said Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies like the Enforcement Directorate and Narcotics Control Bureau. "Those who've announced a war against us and Maharashtra, I want to tell them that we're ready...A time will come when you will have to bow down on your knees before us," Raut added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CPI(M) facing most challenging times since formation in 1964: Party report
text: Communist Party of India (Marxist) is facing its most challenging times since its formation in 1964, CPI(M) organisational report said. "The strong bases of West Bengal and Tripura are under severe attack...there has been an erosion in the party's mass...influence," it added. "CPI(M), as well as Left, have to fight against the consolidated RSS-BJP regime," the report stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Central government must take price rise seriously: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Thursday said central government must take the issue of price rise seriously. "People were already reeling under the stress of high inflation, unemployment and poverty when they were hit by...rise in prices of petrol, diesel, cooking gas and other essential items," she tweeted. Notably, fuel prices were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: No election symbol allotted by EC will be deemed national symbol: Rijiju
text: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju told Rajya Sabha on Thursday that no election symbol allotted by Election Commission (EC) will be deemed as religious or national one. Rijiju's reply came after he was asked whether symbols like national bird etc, can be used by political parties. He added that government has no proposal to disallow use of national symbols by parties.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Mob lynchings happen if we wear skull caps, carry beard: Muslim body
text: Amid ongoing debate around Azaan and halal meat, Haji Mohammed Salees of Sunni Ulema Council said, "There's a problem if we wear skull caps, carry a beard, or wear a hijab, mob lynchings are happening. They have an eye on what we eat as well." He added Azaan gets completed in 2-3 minutes but there is problem with that too.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Congress workers protest against fuel price hike in J&K's Srinagar
text: Congress workers on Thursday staged a protest against the fuel price hike in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. "We have organised such protests across the country," a Congress worker said. "They (BJP-led Centre) decreased the prices before polls and increased soon after polls got over. Poor is the worst affected," the Congress worker added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP fears defeat in Himachal, wants Anurag Thakur as CM face: Sisodia
text: Ahead of Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed on Thursday that BJP wants to make Union Minister Anurag Thakur its chief ministerial face. Sisodia alleged that BJP fears defeat in state and is wary of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal's "popularity". CM Jairam Thakur has done nothing for the state's residents, Sisodia added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: MNS' Pune chief removed after his different view on loudspeakers' removal
text: The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has removed Vasant More as the party's Pune chief, days after he took a different stand on party chief Raj Thackeray's directive on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques. Thackeray has now appointed Sainath Babar as the party's Pune chief. More said that he was not asked or informed to resign from the post.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Criminal Procedure Bill violates dignity: P Chidambaram
text: Congress MP P Chidambaram has termed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022, as "unconstitutional". "It (the Bill) violates liberty, privacy and dignity of people. The Bill was not referred to a select committee," Chidambaram said on Wednesday while speaking in the Rajya Sabha during the second part of the Budget Session of Parliament.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Centre's real strength is its 'weapons of mass distraction': Tharoor on fuel price
text: Soon after LS passed a Bill on Weapons of Mass Destruction, Congress' Shashi Tharoor said, Centre's real strength is its "weapons of mass distraction". "Aided and abetted by complicit media, pointless controversies over halal, hijab and azaan have driven away focus from price rise," he tweeted. "It's clear that GOI doesn't want to discuss prices at any price!" he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Opposition front not 'enough' to take on BJP: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday said that the formation of an Opposition front "would not be enough to take on the BJP". People have realised BJP's methods of winning elections, which they do by diverting attention from the main issues but do nothing for the masses after forming the government, he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Development revenue runs out: Pawar on AAP's free electricity scheme
text: While speaking on the Aam Aadmi Party-led Delhi government's free electricity and water scheme, Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said that people like freebies but political parties must think about long-term development. Pawar further said that development revenue runs out in providing water and electricity for free to people. He also urged the Centre to reduce tax on fuel.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We condemn Al-Qaeda, K'taka HM's statements on hijab row: Congress
text: Congress General Secretary Ajay Maken on Thursday said the party condemns the statement of Al-Qaeda on the hijab row. "It's a banned terrorist organisation that has no business commenting on internal affairs of India," Maken said. He added that Congress also condemns the statement by Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra as both he and Al-Qaeda are polarising the country's atmosphere.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Amit Shah should be last person to talk about law & order: TMC leader
text: Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his remarks on the law and order situation in West Bengal, adding that he should be the last person to talk about it. "We are very well aware of his track record as a Minister in Gujarat and in the Union government," he said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Everyone should comply with K'taka HC's order on loudspeakers: Kharge
text: Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge said on Thursday that all communities must abide by Karnataka High Court's (HC) order to curb use of loudspeakers in religious institutions. He, however, added that such issues shouldn't be brought up for polarisation purposes. Kharge's comment comes after Karnataka government said it wants to implement HC's order on regulating sound volume of loudspeakers in mosques.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Akhilesh, SP sympathise with terrorists: Maurya on Gorakhnath temple attack
text: A day after Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggeration in the Gorakhnath temple attack case, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Akhilesh Ji and SP have always been linked to terrorists." "I condemn his attempts to boost morale of terrorists," he added. "Our security personnel caught him by risking their lives...his statement is cheap and deplorable," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: We're getting morning gift in form of fuel price hike: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury while commenting on the increased fuel prices in the country, said, "Everyday we're getting a morning gift in form of a fuel price hike." Chowdhury further said that the government is citing the Russia-Ukraine crisis as an excuse for price hike. Notably, prices of petrol and diesel were hiked for the 14th time on Wednesday.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Delhi isn't Gotham City: TMC on ban on meat shops during Navratri
text: Trinamool Congress national spokesperson Saket Gokhale has written a letter to the Municipal Commissioner of South Delhi and demanded an immediate circular announcing that the ban on meat shops during Navratri is illegal. "Delhi isn't Gotham City," Gokhale said, referring to a fictional city in Batman comic books. He added that the Mayor has no executive powers to shut shops.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Cong gets eviction notice over bungalow occupied by Sonia's secretary
text: The Directorate of Estates, which comes under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, has sent an eviction notice to Congress regarding the bungalow situated at C-II/109 Chanakyapuri, New Delhi. The property was given to Congress but allegedly its interim chief Sonia Gandhi's secretary Vincent George has been residing there. Notably, the pending rent of the property is ₹3.08 crore.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Anil Deshmukh sent to CBI custody till April 11 in extortion case
text: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh was sent to CBI custody till April 11 in connection with an alleged extortion case. The agency took Deshmukh into its custody from Arthur Road jail earlier today and presented him before a court. Seeking his custody for 10 days, CBI claimed he's trying to evade questioning and that's why he's citing health reasons.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Parliament saw healthy discussion on Ukraine, grateful to MPs: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday said the Parliament witnessed a healthy discussion on the Ukraine situation and India's repatriation initiative 'Operation Ganga' in the last few days. He thanked MPs for enriching the discussion with their views. "The rich level of debate and constructive points illustrate how there is bipartisanship when it comes to matters of foreign policy," he tweeted.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Fire breaks out at Congress' headquarters in New Delhi
text: A fire broke out at Congress party headquarters in New Delhi's Akbar Road on Wednesday around 7 pm. "There was an electric fault in ACs due to which the fire occurred. It has been doused completely," an official from the Connaught Place Fire Station said. The caretaker and guards had alerted the fire department and police about the incident.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Parliament passes Bill that seeks to collect biometrics of convicts
text: Parliament passed Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill that seeks to allow investigating agencies to collect physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes. Union Minister Amit Shah said, "I want to assure this isn't going to violate anyone's privacy." Political detainees' biometrics won't be collected if they are detained during participation in protest, he added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: TMC leader summoned by CBI over cattle smuggling, goes to hospital
text: TMC leader Anubrata Mondal, who was summoned by the CBI on Wednesday in connection to a cattle smuggling case, went to a state-run hospital in Kolkata. He told CBI he meant to appear before it but suddenly started suffering from shortness of breath, lightheadedness and cold sweat. He sought to dispense himself for appearing at CBI office for four weeks.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Comparing B'luru with Hyd is an utter joke: K'taka CM on KTR's remarks
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao's attempt to compare Bengaluru with Hyderabad is an "utter joke". CM Bommai said, "[People] from across the world are coming to Bengaluru. The highest startups...highest unicorns are in Bengaluru." This comes after Rao tweeted asking a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur to shift to Hyderabad for better facilities.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Sharad Pawar meets PM Modi, discusses ED's action against Raut
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday met PM Narendra Modi at the latter's office in the Parliament. Reports claimed both politicians talked for nearly 20 minutes. Pawar said he discussed ED's action against Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut with PM Modi. "If a central agency takes a step like this, then they've to take responsibility for it," he added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: 'Kashmir Files' will do work of awakening future generation: Gadkari
text: Union Minister and BJP leader Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the Vivek Agnihotri directorial 'The Kashmir Files' will do the work of awakening the future generation. Gadkari said, "Agnihotri did a good job in rightly portraying...plight of Kashmiri Pandits which will do...job of awakening the coming generations." "History is important for the present to create a better future," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: After Delhi, Punjab, it’s Himachal’s turn to see a revolution: Kejriwal
text: After Delhi and Punjab, it’s Himachal Pradesh’s turn to bring in a revolution, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Wednesday. Kejriwal and Punjab CM  Bhagwant Mann led a roadshow in Himachal’s Mandi ahead of state Assembly polls. "We don't know how to do politics but we certainly know how to build schools and hospitals and eradicate corruption," Kejriwal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Haryana Education Minister should be sacked: Surjewala on paper leak
text: After reports that five question papers of the Haryana Board's Class 10 and 12 were leaked, Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala demanded the removal of Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Surjewala criticised the Haryana government, saying that Khattar-Chautala government is responsible for "ruining" the education system in the state and making students dependent on the "copying mafia".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Pay heed to accused's mental condition: Akhilesh on Gorakhnath temple attack
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused BJP of exaggerating the Gorakhnath Temple attack case and asked the authorities to pay heed to accused's mental condition while probing the matter. "His (accused) father said he has a psychiatric problem, dealing with bipolar issue, I feel we need to pay heed to that as well...BJP is a party that exaggerates," Yadav said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Haryana govt reciting tables of 35 & 80 while hiking fuel rates: Hooda
text: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Wednesday said, "It seems as if the government is reading the table of 35 and 80 with petroleum products". He added, "Petrol and diesel in Haryana were cheaper than the neighbouring states under the erstwhile Congress government." Fuel in Haryana is now more expensive than its neighbours after multiple hikes, Hooda added.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP should live up to its Constitution: Tharoor on party's foundation day
text: Congress' Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter on Wednesday to address the BJP on its 42nd foundation day. Sharing a picture of the first page of BJP's Constitution, he tweeted, "Happy birthday BJP! You turn 42 today. Isn't it time to start living up to your own Constitution?" Tharoor added that BJP doesn't adhere to anything written on the page.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: All secular forces need to come together to defeat BJP: Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Wednesday urged all the secular and democratic forces to come together to defeat BJP. "All secular forces should come together to dump the party driven by the Hindutva ideology," Yechury added. "It (BJP) has to be isolated and defeated. It is undermining all the constitutional bodies and selling off PSUs one by one," Yechury stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No takers for KCR’s third front idea: Telangana BJP chief
text: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay has said that CM K Chandrashekar Rao's idea of a third front in national politics will not be accepted by other parties. "There are no takers for KCR's third front idea. He has no credibility among the other parties and nobody believes him," he said. Sanjay added that Rao treats his political adversaries with contempt.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Govt's decisions will take India into situation like Sri Lanka: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday criticised the privatisation of public sector units and said that the decisions of the Indian government might take the country into a "Sri Lanka-like situation". "The inflation is continuously increasing across the country and the government is selling the public sector enterprises," Kharge added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab: Kejriwal in Himachal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann held a roadshow in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi on Wednesday ahead of state Assembly polls. Kejriwal said, "We have ended corruption in just 20 days in Punjab since Bhagwant Mann became the chief minister." He added, "Now it is time to uproot corruption from Himachal Pradesh."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Recite Ram Katha, Hanuman Chalisa: MP Congress to office bearers
text: Madhya Pradesh Congress has asked its office-bearers in the state to organise events to recite Ram Katha and Hanuman Chalisa at the district level on Ram Navmi and Hanuman Jayanti. Congress' state chief Kamal Nath will also hold a special puja on Hanuman Jayanti in Chhindwara. Ram Navmi is being celebrated on April 10 and Hanuman Jayanti on April 16.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Nadda participates in 'Shobha Yatra' in Delhi on BJP's 42nd foundation day
text: BJP National President JP Nadda participated in BJP’s 'Shobha Yatra' on the occasion of the party’s 42nd foundation day, in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Wednesday. Nadda hoisted the party flag at the party headquarters in the national capital on the occasion. He also garlanded the statues of Dr Syama Prasad Mookerjee and Pandit Deendayal Upadhyaya.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Balasaheb, your Hindu son banning singing of Hanuman Chalisa: MNS Poster
text: Amid loudspeaker controversy, a poster has been put up by the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena outside the Shiv Sena Bhawan in Mumbai. "Balasaheb, look, your son...Uddhav...being a Hindu is banning singing of Hanuman Chalisa. Loudspeakers installed by Hindus are being removed. Your Thackeray style and heritage in true sense are only being followed by Rajsaheb Thackeray," poster read.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: No tie-up with BJP in Maharashtra: Sharad Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Wednesday said there'll be no tie-up between his party and BJP. Criticising the alleged misuse of central investigative agencies, Pawar said Maharashtra's Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government is strong and stable and will return to power in the next Assembly elections. There'll be no change in the MVA Cabinet from NCP's side, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: NDMC revokes order to let fasting Muslims leave office early during Ramzan
text: A day after passing an order to allow Muslim employees observing fast during Ramzan to leave their offices early at 4:30 pm, the Welfare Department of the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) withdrew it. Notably, NDMC Vice-Chairman and BJP leader Satish Upadhyay had opposed the relaxation, which was supposed to be applicable from April 3 to May 2.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP world's largest party, earned faith of crores of people: BJP leader
text: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi on Wednesday said, "BJP is not just country's but world's largest party. It has earned the faith of crores of people, presented them with a different ideology." He further added, "It should now focus on bringing solutions to problems arising out of present-day needs." BJP celebrated its 42nd Foundation Day on April 6.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Cong helping BJP create false narrative of lawlessness in WB: TMC
text: TMC spokesperson Kunal Ghosh on Wednesday said Congress is helping BJP in creating a "false narrative" about alleged lawlessness in West Bengal and in maligning the state government. On the unnatural death of Congress councillor Tapan Kundu's murder's eyewitness, Ghosh said, "The way TMC and the state police are being blamed for it is unacceptable. We condemn it."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rajya Sabha passes bill to unify 3 municipal corporations of Delhi
text: The Rajya Sabha on Tuesday passed the  Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, through a voice note. The bill seeks to unify three municipal corporations of Delhi. The bill was tabled in Rajya Sabha by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who claimed the AAP government in Delhi gave step-motherly treatment to north, south and east Delhi municipal corporations.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: They threw father's photo, wore slippers on beds: Chirag on eviction
text: LJP leader Chirag Paswan has claimed that officials who came to evict him from 12, Janpath bungalow threw his father Ram Vilas Paswan's photo. "They walked on the photos with slippers on...they wore slippers all over the beds," he claimed. "This...humiliation for someone you gave the Padma Bhushan," he added. He claimed he was ready to leave by March 20.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: MLC who vacated seat for UP CM in 2017 expelled from BJP for 6 yrs
text: BJP expelled its sitting MLC Yashwant Singh for six years on Monday, saying that he has been campaigning for his son for Azamgarh-Mau local body authority seat against BJP's candidate. Singh, who was an SP MLC in 2017, had vacated his seat for Yogi Adityanath after he was announced as UP CM. Singh claimed he isn't campaigning for his son.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Am I Vijay Mallya or Nirav or Ambani, Adani: Raut mocks ED for attaching his property
text: After ED attached Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's properties in a ₹1,034-crore land scam case, he mocked the agency, saying, "Understand the meaning of property. Am I Vijay Mallya, am I Mehul Choksi?" "Am I Nirav Modi or Ambani, Adani? I live in a small house. I don't have a single acre of land in my native place," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India stands firm on its interests when the world is divided into 2 factions: PM Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi while addressing the 42nd foundation day of BJP on Wednesday said, "Today, there is an India in front of the world which stands firm for its interests, without any fear or pressure." He added, "When the entire world is divided into two rival factions, India is being viewed as a nation that can firmly speak about humanity."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: PM took charge as protector of all Indians: Scindia on 'Operation Ganga'
text: Praising 'Operation Ganga', Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday that PM Narendra Modi had taken charge as protector of all Indians amid Ukraine crisis. "[I]...received a call at 11:30 pm [and was summoned]...to Delhi, to be sent to Romania [to oversee mission]," he added. Centre had launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate Indians from Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Not an inch of India's land ceded since Modi became PM: Rijiju
text: Not an inch of land has been ceded since Narendra Modi became Prime Minister, Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Everyone knows that our claimed territory under the control of China and Pakistan dates back to earlier times. I don't want to take anyone's name," Rijiju further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Haryana a tenant in Chandigarh, should get own capital: Ex-min Dalal
text: Terming the ongoing dispute between Haryana and Punjab governments over capital Chandigarh as 'ghisa pita' (stale), former Haryana minister Karan Dalal on Monday said the issue is being used to mislead public. He added, Haryana should think of creating a new capital. "For...last 55 years, Haryana...occupied Chandigarh as a tenant...now it's time to think about...independent capital," Dalal said.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: 'This is what 80-20 meant': AAP leader on BJP amid rise in fuel prices
text: Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh on Tuesday said that BJP's '80-20' remark meant that it would increase petrol and diesel prices by 80 paise each for 20 consecutive days. "During the entire election in Uttar Pradesh, the BJP kept saying that we are contesting on 80-20," he said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath made the remark in January.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Seems CPI(M) forced Naseeruddin to record video appeal for niece: Babul
text: After actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a video appealing to people to vote for his niece and CPI(M) candidate Saira Shah Halim in bypoll to Bengal's Ballygunge seat, TMC leader Babul Supriyo said it seemed that he was forced to record the video. "We all love and respect Naseeruddin Shah...but sadly he looks very gloomy in this video," Supriyo tweeted.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Sonia Gandhi meets Congress MLAs from Maharashtra in Delhi
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday met with a delegation of around 22 party MLAs from Maharashtra at her residence in Delhi. The MLAs reportedly expressed concern over lack of coordination within the Congress legislature party. "The meeting held with Sonia Gandhi was based on present political situation of Maharashtra and how to strengthen the party," said MLA Vikas Thakre.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP's Kirit Somaiya siphoned off ₹58 cr raised to save INS Vikrant: Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut accused BJP leader Kirit Somaiya of allegedly siphoning off ₹58 crore that was crowd-funded to save INS Vikrant. "Somaiya had offered to help out with the fund-raisers and said the amount collected would be handed over to Maharashtra Governor. The Raj Bhavan (in an RTI reply) has stated that no such money was received," Raut said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM Modi criticises dynasty politics on BJP’s 42nd foundation day
text: Addressing party workers on BJP's 42nd foundation day, PM Narendra Modi criticised dynasty politics saying it harmed the country a lot in past decades. "Two kinds of politics are going on - one of love for family, other of love for nation," said Modi. "These [dynastic] parties didn't let the youth progress and always betrayed them," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Meat shops should be closed across country during Navratri: BJP MP
text: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma welcomed the South Delhi Mayor's direction for closure of meat shops during Navratri. He said the other two municipal corporations should also follow it and such shops should be closed across India during the festival. "Whether it's Muslim community or others, they should respect it which is what our culture says," Verma added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Worked hard for BJP, had aspiration for promotion: Babul Supriyo
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo revealed on Tuesday that he had previously "retired hurt from politics" as his "aspirations for promotion" in BJP didn't work out. "I felt that PM Modi...didn't have regard for knowledge...I worked hard for BJP since 2014," he added. Supriyo will contest as TMC's candidate for West Bengal Assembly by-polls from the Ballygunge seat.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I feel betrayed: Chirag Paswan on eviction from Delhi bungalow
text: Lok Janshakti Party leader Chirag Paswan has said he felt "betrayed" and "humiliated" by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. He said, "I don't feel bad about losing...house" adding that he objects to the way in which it was done. "[We'd] never think of claiming [the house]," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: It is a time to give chance to AAP in Himachal Pradesh: Jain
text: AAP leader Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said that people are tired of BJP and Congress, adding that "now it's time to give a chance to the AAP" in Himachal Pradesh. Jain said, "AAP is dedicated to public welfare, while other political leaders are busy ensuring their personal welfare." AAP will contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Suppose it's ok to ban non-Muslims from eating in public during Ramzan: Omar
text: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has expressed his views amid the ongoing meat-ban debate. "During Ramzan we don't eat between sunrise & sunset...I suppose it's OK if we ban every non-Muslim resident or tourist from eating in public, especially in the Muslim dominated areas. If majoritarianism is right for South Delhi, it has to be right for J&K," he wrote.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Tired of working; helping poor, needy without any recognition: Faisal
text: Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son, Faisal Patel took to Twitter to say that he is "Tired of working and helping the poor and needy without any recognition". "Keeping my options open could mean I am thinking of quitting public life forever," he wrote on Twitter, while also tagging the official Twitter handle of the Indian National Congress.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Constitution allows me to eat meat when I like: TMC's Mahua Moitra
text: TMC MP Mahua Moitra said she lives in South Delhi and the Constitution allows her to eat meat when she likes and the shopkeeper the freedom to run his trade. Her statement came after the South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor, Mukkesh Suryaan, issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: PM Modi-led govt gave new definition of governance in last 8 yrs: Hardeep Puri
text: PM Narendra Modi-led government has given a new definition of governance in the last eight years, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said on the occasion of BJP’s 42nd foundation day on Wednesday. "I would like to give you an example of UP. We received success there because development was done there rapidly and with all sincerity," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Uddhav has joined queue of pseudo seculars: Fadnavis on row over loudspeakers
text: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis criticised Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray, saying that he has joined the queue of "pseudo seculars". "He doesn't take action on loudspeakers (at mosques) even after HC order but when 'Hanuman Chalisa' is played on loudspeakers, it's seized," Fadnavis added. Reacting to Sena's corruption claim against Kirit Somaiya, he said, "They have not provided any evidence."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP fulfilling aspirations of poor: Amit Shah on party's 42nd Foundation Day
text: BJP leader Amit Shah on Wednesday extended greetings to party workers on BJP's 42nd Foundation Day. "Under leadership of Narendra Modiji...BJP has become a means of fulfilling the aspirations of crores of poor, farmers, downtrodden and women of the country deprived for seven decades," he tweeted. He further said that BJP's journey has been about national service, upliftment and reconstruction.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AIADMK workers protest against property tax hike by Tamil Nadu govt
text: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) workers, including party coordinator O Panneerselvam on Tuesday, protested in Chennai against the hike in property tax announced by the Tamil Nadu government. The protestors demanded that the DMK-led state government roll back the tax increase. Notably, the state government on Sunday proposed a hike of up to 150% in the property tax.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Party that censored Kishore's songs is crying for democracy: Shah on Cong
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, criticised the Congress saying, "The party which imposed the Emergency...censored Kishore Kumar's songs is crying for democracy today?" Shah was speaking on the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022. "Those who forget history, become history. I can see it in the House before me," Shah added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: WB's state would've been worse had it been a country: WB BJP chief
text: West Bengal BJP president Dr Sukanta Kumar Majumdar on Tuesday said that the state's condition would've been worse than Sri Lanka had it been a separate country. "Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee should take care of her state. Sri Lanka is ruined; its total debt was ₹6 lakh crore and West Bengal's debt is ₹5.62 lakh crore," he further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Haryana CM moves resolution on Chandigarh issue, Sutlej-Yamuna canal
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday moved a resolution in the state Assembly noting with concern the Punjab Assembly's recent move on the transfer of the joint capital of Chandigarh. Khattar's resolution also urged the central government to take steps to construct the Sutlej Yamuna Link (SYL) Canal. He accused Punjab of enacting legislations to deny Haryana's rightful claims.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Sanjay Raut's properties attached by ED in ₹1,000 cr land scam case
text: The Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in connection to the ₹1,034 crore Patra Chawl land scam case. A plot owned by Raut in Alibaug and another flat of his in Mumbai's Dadar were attached. Raut, who is a close aide of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, tweeted, "Asatyamev wins."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Who were the top corporate donors to national parties in 2019-20 as per ADR?
text: Prudent Electoral Trust was the top donor to two national parties - BJP and INC - in FY 2019-20, according to a report by NGO ADR on Monday. The Trust donated 38 times in a single year to the two parties each, amounting to a total of ₹247.75 crore. Janakalyan Electoral Trust was the second-largest corporate donor, followed by ITC.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Delhi govt's step-motherly behaviour hinders working of 3 MCDs: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that the Delhi government's "step-motherly behaviour" hinders the efficient working of all three municipal corporations. "If state governments behave in a step-motherly fashion with civic bodies, neither Panchayati Raj nor urban local bodies will be successful," Shah added. He was speaking in Rajya Sabha on the Bill to merge the civic bodies.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: AIADMK worker, 4 others surrender over DMK worker's murder in TN
text: Five people, including an AIADMK worker, on Monday surrendered before a court in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpet after a DMK worker was killed at a bus stand in broad daylight in Chennai a day before. The accused AIADMK worker and the deceased were reportedly fighting over a spot at the bus stop where the latter had put up a water stall.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Water cannons used on AAP water tariff hike protesters in Chandigarh
text: The police on Tuesday used water cannons to disperse a protest against the increase in water tariff in Chandigarh by AAP workers. The party tweeted a video of the incident and accused the BJP of making things costlier after "fraudulently" getting a Mayor of the BJP party. The protesters had been moving towards the Union Territory's Municipal Corporation office.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: 250 leaders and workers from AAP, Cong join BJP in Gujarat's Vadodara
text: Around 250 leaders and workers from AAP and Congress in Gujarat's Vadodara joined BJP on Monday. AAP leader Satish Makwana and Congress leader Jayshree Gohil were among those who joined BJP, an official release by the party stated. They joined BJP "considering the public service done by the party under PM Modi's leadership", BJP's state General Secretary Pradipsinh Vaghela said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Won't get scared even if I'm shot: Raut as ED attaches his properties
text: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said he won't get scared even if he is shot or sent to jail. His reaction came after ED attached properties linked to him in connection to an alleged ₹1,034-crore land scam case. He claimed he doesn't even own one acre of land in Alibaug and purchased properties with his hard-earned money.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: TN Cong leader, who said Rahul & Priyanka should step aside, sacked
text: Tamil Nadu Congress spokesperson Americai V Narayanan, who said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi should step aside to save Congress, has been sacked, reports said on Tuesday. "I love Rahul Gandhi but unfortunately, he has not delivered," he said. He also urged Congress to bring back former leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Jagan Mohan Reddy, Sharad Pawar and K Chandrashekar Rao.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Nagaland's 1st woman Rajya Sabha MP takes oath in traditional attire, jewellery
text: S Phangnon Konyak, the President of BJP Nagaland Mahila Morcha, took oath in the Rajya Sabha wearing her traditional Naga clothes and jewellery on Monday. She is the first woman from the state to get a berth in Parliament's Upper House. The 44-year-old leader was elected unopposed as the Rajya Sabha member from Nagaland on March 31.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Tired of waiting, keeping options open: Son of Cong's Ahmed Patel
