text: Late Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son Faisal Patel, in an apparent reference to the party leadership, on Tuesday said he was tired of waiting around. "No encouragement from...top brass. Keeping my options open," he tweeted. He had earlier said that he will enter electoral politics if Congress asks. Ahmed Patel was a close aide of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: H'yana to stay in Chandigarh until money given for new capital: Vij
text: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has said that the state will "stand firm" in Chandigarh until it gets "one single decision over Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water, Hindi-speaking regions and money from the Centre for establishing a new capital." Earlier, Punjab passed a resolution to transfer Chandigarh to itself. "[Haryana won't] pull back...'Angad ka paer' from Chandigarh," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Group with AK-47s shoots at Bihar MLC candidate's convoy; 1 dead
text: An Independent candidate for Bihar MLC elections had a narrow escape after a group of assailants armed with AK-47s allegedly shot at his convoy in Siwan on Monday. A 30-year-old villager who was in a car behind the convoy was killed in the attack after multiple bullets hit him. Four people, including two of the poll candidate's supporters, were injured.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: MNS Muslim leader resigns, accuses party of turning 'communal'
text: A Muslim politician, Majid Shaikh, has tendered his resignation from the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) by accusing it of being "more focused on communalism". "Raj saheb was an icon for me...that's why I had joined...in 2009. But now...politics of communalism has crept in MNS," Shaikh said. Notably, the Pune-based politician was an MNS branch head.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: I'm very much alive: Rijiju after NCP leader Sule's slip of tongue
text: After NCP leader Supriya Sule, in a slip of tongue, said Kiren Rijiju was no more, the Union Minister tweeted, "I am very much alive." While appreciating Rijiju's role as the Sports Minister, Sule said he is no more, which she immediately corrected by saying he is no more the minister. Rijiju had also tweeted a clip of the incident.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Row over loudspeakers at mosques will backfire BJP in elections: Siddaramaiah
text: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and said that the Karnataka BJP is "manipulating society with communal issues for their political gains" because the Assembly elections are nearing. "This will backfire BJP in coming days. Speakers are installed in temples, mosques and churches for a long time now. What harm did it cause to people?" Siddaramaiah added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP has become a 'company' recovering increased costs from public: Akhilesh
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday, while commenting on increased fuel prices in the country, alleged that BJP has become a "company", which is passing on "increased cost" to people without reducing profit. "Government's role in a democracy is...to make policies, which are in the public interest, so that no one can exploit and oppress the people," he tweeted.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together: Haryana CM
text: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Monday said that the Chandigarh issue should be resolved by "sitting together". "It’s not something that can be passed unilaterally in the Assembly," Khattar added. "They (AAP) have not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues, there must be a hidden agenda behind this," Khattar stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Did we have loudspeakers during inception of religion? : BJP's Roopa Ganguly
text: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, BJP's Roopa Ganguly said a religion's campaign shouldn't make others "insane". "I don't understand, did we have the concept of a loudspeaker during the inception of religion? What's the point of it?" Ganguly added. "This process of playing loudspeakers 5-10 times a day shouldn't continue," Ganguly stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Our responsibility is to keep the country united: Maha minister
text: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut on Monday, while reacting to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques, said, "It is our responsibility to keep the country united." "India is a country of different languages, religions and cultures...It is really sad that people are giving such statements about religion, it shows their mentality," the minister added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Why not ban liquor in Ramzan?: Cong leader on banning meat sale during Navratri
text: Reacting to reports of meat shops asked to shut in some parts of the country for Navratri, Congress leader Salman Nizami said, "Why not ban liquor during Holy Ramadan?" Taking to Twitter, the politician said, "If you don't eat onion or meat in Navratri why stop others. Is this democracy? What about our sentiments and constitutional rights!"
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: HC stays trial court summons to Subramanian Swamy in defamation case
text: Delhi HC stayed the summons and other proceedings issued by Rouse Avenue Court against Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy in a defamation case. Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged that Swamy had posted a defamatory tweet against him. Swamy had tweeted, "Journalists from Delhi told me...before joining BJP, Bagga was jailed several times...for petty offences."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: No alliance with TRS in Telangana: Rahul tells state Cong leaders
text: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has told the Telangana Congress leaders in a meeting at his Delhi residence that there will be "no alliance" with TRS for the next year's state elections. "We held a discussion with Rahul ji over various issues...He will visit Telangana this month. No alliance...Congress will fight against TRS and BJP," said PCC chief Revanth Reddy.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh is unconstitutional: Cong’s Deepender Hooda
text: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda termed Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh as "unconstitutional". "The resolution of Punjab over Chandigarh is in violation of the Act under which Punjab, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh were formed in the year 1966," Hooda said. "Punjab has suppressed the water of Haryana’s share, even after the Supreme Court’s decision in favour of Haryana," Hooda stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress does not look outside the Gandhi family: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress and said that the party does not look outside the Gandhi family. "Rahul Gandhi took charge but didn't get any seats in West Bengal. Priyanka Gandhi took charge of UP but lost deposits and won only two seats. Now again Sonia Gandhi has taken command of the party," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: UP Police stations, collectorates corruption dens under BJP: Akhilesh
text: Terming BJP's zero-tolerance policy a "sham", Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said that police stations, tehsil offices and collectorates have become dens of corruption under the current UP government. He added, "Under the protection of power, the administration is engaged in oppressing the innocent and the poor, and bulldozers are being run on farmers."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Sri Lanka's condition worrisome, India's could be worse: Sanjay Raut
text: Reacting to Sri Lanka's economic crisis, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the country's situation is "worrisome". He further added that "India is on that path" and warned that if situation is not handled then India's condition will be worse than Sri Lanka. "Mamata Banerjee has also said to call for an all-party meeting under PM Modi's leadership," Raut added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Goa CM retains Home & Finance Depts as portfolios allocated in new Cabinet
text: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday allocated portfolios to his eight Cabinet colleagues and retained the Home and Finance Ministries. Sawant also holds the Personnel and Vigilance portfolios. Rohan Khaunte, who joined BJP ahead of the state Assembly polls, will handle Tourism and Information Technology departments among others. Vishwajit Rane retained Health and Women and Child Development portfolios.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP received highest corporate donations of ₹720 crore in 2019-20: ADR
text: BJP received the maximum corporate donations of ₹720.407 crore from 2,025 corporate donors in 2019-20, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). The BJP was followed by INC which received a total contribution of ₹133.04 crore from 154 corporate donors, and NCP with ₹57.086 crore in corporate donations. CPM received ₹6.9165 crore in corporate donations.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: He's honest: 78-yr-old after transferring assets worth ₹50 lakh in Rahul's name
text: A 78-year-old woman from Uttarakhand's Dehradun has transferred all her property in Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's name. The woman, Pushpa Munjial, transferred assets worth ₹50 lakh and some gold in Rahul Gandhi's name. She said, "Rahul Gandhi is an innocent, honest man...he'll put my money into things that will be remembered...he's free to spend my money the way he wants."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Will restore B'luru's glory as best city: Shivakumar; KTR says, 'challenge accepted'
text: Responding to Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao's tweet asking a startup to shift its base from Bengaluru to Hyderabad owing to the latter's "better infrastructure", Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said he "accepts Rao's challenge". "By 2023-end, with Congress back in power...we'll restore the glory of Bengaluru as India's best city," Shivakumar added. "Challenge accepted," said Rao in reply.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Using loudspeakers outside mosques disturbs students, patients: K'taka minister
text: After Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Monday said using loudspeakers to call for prayer disturbs students and patients. "I have no objections to you (Muslims) offering prayers...If prayers are offered at temples and churches in a similar way, it'll lead to conflict between communities," he added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: MNS leader arrested for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers in Mumbai
text: MNS leader Mahendra Bhanushali was arrested on Sunday for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers without permission in Mumbai. "They have taken away my amplifier. But I would like to say, in coming times, 'Jai Shree Ram' will be played on loudspeakers," Bhanushali said following his arrest. Earlier, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Ghatkopar.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Will ensure police remain ahead of criminals: Shah on Criminal Procedure Bill
text: Lok Sabha passed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill by voice vote on Monday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the Bill has been brought in to ensure that police and investigators remain two steps ahead of criminals. The Bill seeks to provide legal sanction to police to take physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Rahul shares chart comparing cost of full tank of fuel in vehicles in 2014 & now
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a chart comparing the cost of a full tank of fuel in different vehicles in 2014 and now. According to him, it costed ₹714 for a full tank of fuel in a bike, compared to ₹1,038 now. It costed ₹2,856 for a full tank of fuel in car in 2014, compared to ₹4,152 now.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Chandigarh belongs to Punjab, next battle for river waters: Sidhu
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said Chandigarh belongs to Punjab and will always remain so and added that its next big battle with Haryana will be over river waters. Built on 27 villages of Punjab, Chandigarh was, is and will remain a part of Punjab, Sidhu tweeted in Hindi.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Halal meat issue being raised to disturb peace: Siddaramaiah
text: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said the halal meat issue is being made out to be a major issue to disturb the peace in society. "These are not issues that are relevant to people or the lives of people," Siddaramaiah said. "Do we not buy halal meat and eat it? We eat it often," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: People of Gujarat are frustrated, waiting for honest party: AAP Gujarat chief
text: AAP Gujarat President Gopal Italia said that the people of the state are "frustrated" and are waiting for an honest party. With the arrival of both AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, the hopes of the people have increased, Italia added. "BJP government has done nothing in all these years," Italia stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Kejriwal’s dreams to progress in other states will be crushed: Union Minister
text: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said AAP's Arvind Kejriwal will be taught such a lesson in Gujarat that his dreams to progress in other states of the country will be "crushed". His remark came after Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann visited Gujarat in the run-up to Assembly polls in the state later this year.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP can't dare to look at Haryana: CM Manohar Lal Khattar
text: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said AAP has double standards. "Despite being in rule for a few days (in Punjab), they have raised the controversial issue of Chandigarh. I feel they are doing so on someone else's commands...They can't dare to even look at Haryana," Khattar added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Guj BJP youth unit to hold 3,000-km march to mark 75 yrs of Independence
text: The Gujarat BJP's youth unit will hold a statewide march, Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav Yatra, to mark 75 years of Independence. The march will begin on April 6 in Ahmedabad and will conclude on April 25 in Surat. According to Prashant Korat, state president of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha, the 3,000-km long march will have tableaus on Independence-related themes.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Raj govt failed to maintain law & order: Shekhawat on Karauli clashes
text: Reacting to communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli on Saturday, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that state government has failed to maintain law and order. "If people are being attacked...for celebrating...Indian New Year in India...it's a matter of concern," he added. At least 25 people were left injured after clashes broke out following stone-pelting at a bike rally in Karauli.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Govt is not realising that country is under inflation: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the government is not realising that the country is under inflation. "We will raise the issue in the House. Other political parties will also raise the issue, including the hike in fuel prices," Kharge added. Earlier, Kharge said the hike in fuel prices directly affects the cost of all other commodities.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Let’s focus on infra, not on halal & hijab: KTR to K'taka Cong chief
text: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday replied to Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar, who had said that the party will restore the glory of Bengaluru by 2023. "Let's focus on infrastructure, IT and BT, not on halal and hijab," Rao tweeted. He added, "Let Hyderabad and Bengaluru compete healthily on creating jobs for...youngsters and prosperity for our great nation."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: It's condemnable: K'taka Minister on KTR's 'Move to Hyd' remark
text: Karnataka Minister CN Ashwathnarayan criticised Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao for suggesting a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur to shift to Hyderabad for better facilities. Ashwathnarayan said it was condemnable. "The tweet wasn't in a good taste...Trying to pull the legs of each other does not go well for any government," Ashwathnarayan added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Not keen on becoming UPA chief or leading anti-BJP front: Pawar
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Sunday that he isn't keen on becoming United Progressive Alliance's (UPA) chairperson or leading anti-BJP front. Pawar, however, stated that he's supportive of the formation of such an alliance, adding that Congress should be included in it. Pawar's comments came after NCP's youth wing proposed his name for UPA chief's post.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: TMC's Derek O'Brien pushes for Women's Reservation Bill in RS
text: TMC's Derek O'Brien submitted a notice under Rule 168 in the Rajya Sabha for introduction of the Women's Reservation Bill this week in Parliament. "Open dare to the government. Introduce the long-pending Women Reservation Bill in Rajya Sabha this week (before April 8). Accept and put to vote motion under Rule," O'Brien tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nawab Malik's judicial custody extended till April 18
text: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court has extended Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik's judicial custody till April 18 in Mumbai on Monday. Earlier, the special court had allowed Malik to be provided with home-cooked food and medicines during his custody period. Notably, the NCP leader was held in a money laundering case by the Enforcement Directorate in February.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Mission to bring Delhi CM Kejriwal's 'good governance' to B'luru: Rao
text: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Bhaskar Rao joined Aam Aadmi Party on Monday and said that his mission was to bring Delhi Chief Minister's "good governance" to South India, especially Bengaluru. He further stated that he was impressed with Kejriwal's leadership. Rao joined AAP in the presence of Delhi CM Kejriwal and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: AAP hasn’t been in power for 4 days, raising Chandigarh issue now: Khattar
text: Talking about the ongoing row between Punjab and Haryana over Chandigarh, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said, "They've (AAP) not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues". CM Khattar added, "Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together, it's not something that can be passed unilaterally in Assembly."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Sri Lanka's economic condition is bad, but India's is worse: Mamata
text: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that India's financial condition is worse than Sri Lanka's and urged the Centre to call for an all-party meeting to address it. "Fuel prices have been hiked 11 times in 13 days. The interest on Provident Fund has been slashed. From railways to banks, everything is being sold off," Mamata said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Rajya Sabha faces 2nd adjournment amid Opposition ruckus over price hike
text: The Rajya Sabha on Monday faced a second consecutive adjournment till 2 pm following the ruckus created by the Opposition parties against rising prices of petroleum products and essential commodities across India. The House was adjourned a few minutes after it assembled at noon today following a similar adjournment over the issue.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: It's 'jungle raj', never seen such 'anarchy' in Punjab: Sidhu on AAP
text: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said that he's never seen such "anarchy" in Punjab and criticised the Aam Aadmi Party government for unleashing "jungle raj" in the state. "No one is afraid of law and order. Cold-blooded murders are being committed in broad daylight," Sidhu added. He further said that maintaining peace in Punjab should be the priority.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Serious offence but Ashish Mishra not a flight risk: UP govt to SC
text: The UP government on Monday told the Supreme Court that while the "alleged offences are serious", Ashish Mishra, accused in farmers' killings in Lakhimpur Kheri, is not a flight risk. The apex court, which was hearing a plea seeking cancellation of bail granted to Mishra, MoS Ajay Mishra Teni's son, has reserved its order.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Ex-Odisha MLA Anup Sai sentenced to life for killing live-in partner, her daughter
text: Former Odisha MLA and Biju Janata Dal leader Anup Sai has been sentenced to life imprisonment by a Chhattisgarh court on charges of murdering his live-in partner and her daughter in 2016. Police claimed Sai conspired to kill her when she insisted on marriage and demanded a share in his property. Sai's driver, another accused in the case, was acquitted.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: How can he die suddenly?: Maharashtra minister on Aryan Khan drug case witness
text: The death of Prabhakar Sail, an independent witness in the drugs-on-cruise case involving Aryan Khan, will be investigated by Maharashtra Police, said the state Home Minister, Dilip Walse Patil. He said people were wondering how "such a strong man could die of a heart attack so suddenly". The minister asked the Director General of Police to investigate Sail's death.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: It's a joke: Tharoor as pic of him as 'child actor' goes viral on April Fool's Day
text: After film writer Vaibhav Vishal's picture claiming to show Congress MP Shashi Tharoor as a "child star" on April Fool's Day went viral, the MP on Saturday clarified, "It's a joke!" He added, "He's pulling my leg and I am playing along for fun." Tharoor had earlier commented on the picture, "I'd tried to keep it secret...Good sleuthing."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: BJP full of arrogance, give AAP a chance in Gujarat: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who held a roadshow in Ahmedabad on Saturday ahead of Gujarat polls scheduled for later this year, said BJP has become arrogant after being in power for 25 years. He urged people to give a chance to Aam Aadmi Party. "If you do not like it, change the government and bring them back," Kejriwal said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Delhi & Punjab done, ready for Guj: Mann in roadshow with Kejriwal
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls scheduled for later this year. "Delhi and Punjab sorted, now we are ready for Gujarat," Mann said. Kejriwal claimed he ended corruption in Delhi. "I don't know how to do politics but...know how to end corruption," he said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Kejriwal, Mann spin charkha at Guj's Sabarmati Ashram; video surfaces
text: Aam Aadmi Party has shared a video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann spinning the charkha at the Sabarmati Ashram in Gujarat's Ahmedabad during their visit on Saturday on Twitter. Mahatma Gandhi had stayed in the Ashram. "We consider ourselves blessed that we were born in Gandhiji's country...There is a feeling of peace here," Kejriwal said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Karauli incident could’ve been avoided if administration was vigilant: Ex-Raj CM
text: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje condemned the stone-pelting incident in Karauli and said it could have been avoided if the administration was vigilant. Communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring nearly 25 persons. "Hate mentality cannot be allowed to flourish in peace-loving Rajasthan. The administration should take strict action against the culprits," Raje added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No unrest in MVA govt, focussed on development: Uddhav Thackeray
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has claimed that there is "no internal unrest in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government" on Saturday. "This is MVA, which has its feet firmly on the ground and is working for the state’s development," Thackeray said. He added that the state's coalition government has responded to its critics through its commitment to work for Maharashtra.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Punjab should first give Hindi-speaking areas to Haryana: Khattar
text: After the Punjab Assembly sought the transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar asked the newly-formed AAP government to first hand over the Hindi-speaking areas to his state. "Rajiv-Longowal Accord was signed 35-36 years ago, as per which [Chandigarh] is the capital of both Haryana and Punjab," said Khattar.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Raj stays underground for 3-4 months, lacks consistency: Pawar
text: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray alleged that the NCP plays the caste card to "divide" people, the latter party's chief Sharad Pawar said that Thackeray should have "studied" NCP's history before making the remarks. Thackeray "stays underground for three to four months and suddenly surfaces to give a lecture" and never has a consistent stand on any issue, he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Law of land prevails in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut on Raj Thackeray’s remark
text: The law of the land prevails in Maharashtra and the state Home Minister will do everything as per the law, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Sunday. His statement came in reaction to MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques. "People thought it (Raj Thackeray's event) was BJP's event," Raut added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Petrol to cost ₹275/litre by next elections: Akhilesh on 'math of BJP inflation'
text: Samajwadi Party supremo Akhilesh Yadav criticised the Centre for increasing the fuel prices for the tenth time in 12 days and explained the "math of BJP inflation". "People are saying that at the (monthly) rate of... ₹24, if petrol prices keep increasing, then by the time the next elections are held in November-December... (petrol) will cost ₹275/litre," Yadav tweeted.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal starts following PM, UP CM on Twitter
text: Amid reports of a rift with his nephew and SP President Akhilesh Yadav, PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday started following PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Twitter. Notably, this comes after Yadav met CM Adityanath in Lucknow on Wednesday. Earlier, Yadav had claimed he was not invited to the SP Legislature Party meeting.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Bungalow of Hanuman set on fire: Tejashwi on Chirag's eviction from Janpath residence
text: Days after LJP leader Chirag Paswan was evicted from 12 Janpath bungalow which was allotted to Ram Vilas Paswan in New Delhi, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said that BJP has set fire to the bungalow of 'Hanuman'. "Ram Vilas Paswan was standing with the BJP till the last. This is the consequence of supporting the BJP," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP's poll wins give license to govt to loot people: Randeep Surjewala
text: Electoral victories for BJP have become a licence for the government to "loot" the people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said. "The diktat of the cruel, cumbersome and back-breaking price rise imposed by the PM Modi-led government with effect from April 1 has shattered the budget of every household in India," Surjewala added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Revolutionary move: Rijiju on withdrawal of AFSPA from NE areas
text: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday called the Centre's decision to withdraw AFSPA from major areas of Assam, Nagaland and Manipur a "revolutionary move". The minister said, "When AFSPA is withdrawn, it means that peace has returned to that area." He added that the development that the Northeast has seen under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi is "historic".
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Economic jihad by K'taka CM will ensure we don't get jobs: Cong MLA
text: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said "economic jihad" by CM Basavaraj Bommai's party "will ensure that we neither get investments [nor] jobs". This comes after Bengaluru-based Khatabook Founder Ravish Naresh said the city's HSR/Koramangala area has bad roads and poor quality water supply. Telangana Minister KTR Rao later replied to Naresh's tweet and asked him to move to Hyderabad.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Those involved in rioting won't be spared: Rajasthan CM on Karauli incident
text: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has assured strict action against those responsible for communal clashes that broke out in Karauli on Saturday. "Those involved in inciting riots will not be spared and stringent action will be taken against them. Rule of law will be followed in the state," Gehlot added. Section 144 was imposed in the area following the incident.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Was contacted by AAP but won't leave Congress: TS Singh Deo
text: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has claimed that he was "contacted" by AAP but asserted that he "won't leave" Congress. "Five generations of my family have been in Congress... (Can't) think beyond Congress," Deo said. "I've not met Arvind Kejriwal but it's true... there are people who contact each other. So, it's not like nobody contacted me," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: CM Bommai announces ₹5 crore for Karnataka's police welfare fund
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced a ₹5 crore grant for the police welfare fund on Saturday. CM Bommai added that the state government is "proud" of the force, which is known for its “conscience, impartiality and humanitarian qualities”. "Crime can be controlled if the police function without any compromise with...criminals," he said while participating in Police Flag Day celebrations.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: TN CM and DMK chief MK Stalin inaugurates party's new office in Delhi
text: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) chief and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday inaugurated the party's new office 'Anna-Kalaignar Arivalayam' in Delhi at Deen Dayal Upadhyay Marg. Congress leader Sonia Gandhi was also present during the inauguration. Notably, Stalin, who's on a three-day visit to Delhi, visited government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Remove mosque loudspeakers or will play Hanuman Chalisa there: Raj
text: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Saturday demanded that the Maharashtra government should remove loudspeakers at mosques and said that if this isn't done then loudspeakers will be placed outside mosques and "Hanuman Chalisa will be played at higher volume". "I'm not against prayers, you can pray at...home," he added. Moreover, he demanded that MP and MLA pensions should be stopped.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: AAP is a party without ideology, it only shows dreams to people: Cong
text: Congress Himachal Pradesh President Kuldeep Rathore on Saturday called Aam Aadmi Party a party without an ideology that only shows dreams to people. He added that a direct competition between Congress and Bharatiya Janata Party will take place in the Assembly elections in the state. Notably, AAP had said that it'll contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh elections.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Wearing mask is always safer: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray
text: On the first day of the removal of COVID-19 restrictions in Maharashtra, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray on Saturday urged people to follow the mask advisory. "Wearing a mask is always safer, don’t feel awkward wearing one for your own safety," Aaditya said. Recently, the Maharashtra government announced that wearing masks is no longer compulsory in the state.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP creates atmosphere via media, nothing on ground: Anurag Thakur
text: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has alleged that AAP creates "an atmosphere via media" but has "nothing on the ground". "He (Arvind Kejriwal) couldn't win a seat in UP, did you see his condition in Uttarakhand, Goa?" Thakur asked the press in Chandigarh. He further said that BJP gets votes "unilaterally" in PM Narendra Modi's name wherever there are elections.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will hold 5-pronged protest against Centre over paddy procurement: TRS Min
text: Telangana Rashtra Samithi Minister KT Rama Rao has said that his party is going to hold a five-pronged protest against the BJP-led Centre across Telangana over the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state. Different forms of protests including the blocking of national highways will take place on April 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11, Rao said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Saddened by the way Delhi bungalow was vacated: Chirag Paswan
text: LJP leader Chirag Paswan said he was saddened by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. "I never said that I want 12, Janpath forever. My family respects the law," Chirag Paswan said. "We were ready to vacate the house but why were we humiliated like this?" Paswan added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP becomes first party to cross 100-seat mark in Rajya Sabha since 1990
text: The BJP has achieved 101 seats in the Rajya Sabha for the first time in its history and has become the first party since 1990 to do so. This came after the party won four of the 13 seats up for election in the 245-member Upper House in the latest round of polls that concluded on Thursday.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Delhi Police gets 2 weeks to file status report on attack at CM's home
text: Delhi HC on Friday asked Delhi Police to file a status report within two weeks on the investigation it has carried out to date in connection to vandalism at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house. AAP alleged BJP workers orchestrated the attack over Kejriwal's comments on 'The Kashmir Files'. "You'll have to explain...what kind of threat perception was there," HC said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: BJP's Suvendu suspended from WB Assembly, likens move to Emergency
text: BJP MLA and Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari was on Thursday suspended from West Bengal Assembly for the remainder of the session that began on March 7. He said the decision reminds him of Emergency and called it a "dark chapter in the history of Indian politics". Adhikari was suspended days after BJP and TMC MLAs clashed over Birbhum violence.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Centre sought ₹7.5 cr for military sent during Pathankot attack: Punjab CM
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Friday alleged that he had received a letter from the Centre, saying that Punjab must pay ₹7.5 crore for the military that was sent during the 2016 Pathankot attack. "I went to Rajnath Singh. Told him to deduct from my MPLAD but give in writing that Punjab isn't the country's part," he added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Chandigarh is and will remain joint capital of Punjab, Haryana: CM Khattar
text: After Punjab government's resolution seeking transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said Chandigarh is the joint capital of the two states and will remain so. "Punjab government's one-sided resolution has no meaning," he added. "This isn't only a subject of Punjab but also of Haryana. Even the people of Himachal Pradesh claim their share," Khattar said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Jaya holds screening of Abhishek Bachchan's 'Dasvi' for MPs
text: Actress-turned-politician Jaya Bachchan organised a special screening of her son actor Abhishek Bachchan's upcoming film 'Dasvi' for her fellow Members of the Parliament in Mumbai. Maharashtra MP Rajani Patil and Maharashtra MP and deputy leader of Shiv Sena Priyanka Chaturvedi took to social media to share pictures from the event. 'Dasvi' was earlier screened for inmates in Agra Central Jail.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: Tamil Nadu CM visits Delhi govt schools & mohalla clinics with Kejriwal
text: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin visited Delhi government schools and mohalla clinics with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday. "They were amazed by the school and all the facilities that we have," the headmistress of one school said. Stalin said his government will establish a world-class government model school in Chennai and he has invited Kejriwal in advance.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Nepalese PM arrives in India on 3-day visit, meets BJP chief Nadda
text: Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba arrived in India on Friday for his three-day visit to the country. BJP chief JP Nadda welcomed him at the party's headquarters in Delhi. Deuba also met External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today, while on Saturday, he will meet PM Narendra Modi. Notably, this is Deuba's first visit to India since assuming office last year.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: 1st time feels like Northeast is part of India's mainstream: Rijiju
text: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju while addressing a conference over the reduction of areas under AFSPA in Manipur, Nagaland and Assam on Saturday, said that for the "first time" it feels like the Northeast is part of India's "mainstream". He also called the decision to withdraw AFSPA "revolutionary", and added that it means that "peace has returned to that area".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: G-23 never sought a non-Gandhi Congress President: Kamal Nath
text: Congress leader Kamal Nath has claimed that the group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, has never demanded a Congress President outside the Gandhi family. "They (G-23) have been my colleagues for years. They have never made any such demand," Nath said. "They have asked for party elections... which will be held in three months' time," he added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: 'Achhe din', ₹15 lakh in bank promises are April fool jokes: Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday criticised the Centre over rising fuel prices following the Assembly elections, saying that the rulers always "make a fool" out of the common man. "Promises of 'achhe din', depositing ₹15 lakh into...bank accounts of citizens...and providing employment are nothing but April fool jokes," he added. The Centre should "stop lying", he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Manik Saha becomes BJP's first-ever Rajya Sabha MP from Tripura
text: Tripura BJP President Manik Saha was elected to the Rajya Sabha on Friday, making him the party's first-ever member in the Upper House of the Parliament from the state of Tripura. The dental surgeon-turned politician defeated his nearest rival CPI(M)’s Bhanulal Saha by 25 votes. Manik got 40 votes in his favour, 33 of which came from the BJP itself.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Karnataka government 'most corrupt' in the country: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and alleged that 40% Karnataka government is the "most corrupt" administration in the country. While addressing a rally in Bengaluru, he said, "If PM Modi comes to Karnataka and says that he wants to fight corruption, the entire state will start laughing. This is a 40 percent government."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Soldiers who drink not Indians?: Tejashwi on CM's 'Mahapaapi' remark
text: Commenting on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's "people who drink alcohol aren't Indians but 'Mahapaapi'" remark, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Friday said that going by his logic, Indian soldiers who drink are also not Indians. Taking to Twitter, Yadav added, "Criminals who spill rivers of blood and the corrupt aren't 'mahapaapi' (sinners) or 'maha-ayogya' (good-for-nothing people) but drinkers are?"
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP should hold 'charcha' on UP paper leak: Priyanka Gandhi
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday said the BJP should hold a discussion on the UP paper leak incident. Her remarks came after the UP Secondary School Board's Class 12 English examination was cancelled in 24 districts on Wednesday following the leak of the question paper. Priyanka said, "The paper leak system has a strong foothold in the government."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Ensure patients get best facilities in all hospitals: UP CM Yogi
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday chaired a high-level meeting with officials and asked them to ensure that patients get the best facilities in all hospitals and medical colleges in the state. He directed them to conduct a detailed physical review of fire safety and electrical safety mechanisms at these places. "System should be updated to avoid...mishap," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Not upset with Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil: Maharashtra CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday dismissed reports of being upset with Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil. "I've full faith in Patil," his office said. There have been speculations that Thackeray was upset with Patil, an NCP leader, over the latter's response to former state CM Devendra Fadnavis's allegations that the state government was hatching a conspiracy against Opposition leaders.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Anyone can meet him: KP Maurya on CM Yogi, Shivpal Yadav's meet
text: A day after PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath amid reports of rift with his nephew Akhilesh Yadav, Keshav Prasad Maurya said that Adityanath is the CM and "anyone can meet him". "Yogi Adityanath is CM of 24 crore population in UP. Anyone can meet him. Recently, he also met Akhilesh Yadav," the UP Deputy CM said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM 'robbing' Punjab of its rights: CM Bhagwant Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accused PM Narendra Modi of "robbing" the state of its rights amid a political row over Home Minister Amit Shah's recent announcement that central service rules will apply to employees of Chandigarh. "The PM says 'sabka saath sabka vikas'. Where is our 'saath'? Neither you take our 'saath' nor give the same to us," Mann said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bulldozers have started crushing people under BJP rule: Akhilesh
text: Criticising the BJP, Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav has said that bulldozers have started crushing people under the party's rule. "Inflation is increasing day by day. The government is playing with lives of people by being insensitive and careless," he added. Notably, the BJP had promoted "bulldozer" as a symbol of development and action against criminals during UP Assembly polls.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Viewing deck at Mumbai's Girgaum Chowpatty 'illegal': BJP's Rane
text: The ₹2.5 crore viewing deck, being constructed on a stormwater drain at the BR Tambe Square over the Girgaum Chowpatty in Mumbai, has been called "illegal" by the opposition. BJP leader Nitesh Rane, in a letter to BMC, alleged that pillars were erected in the sea without permission under CRZ norms, adding that "it...effectively damaged the ecosystem in the sea."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Tharoor moves Private Member's Bill to repeal UAPA, calls Act a 'tool of abuse'
text: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor came up with a Private Member’s Bill to repeal the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act in Lok Sabha on Friday. "It’s (UAPA) a tool of abuse in which 66% of cases involve no violence, 56% are detained w/no charge-sheet for two years & conviction rate since 2014 is an abysmal 2.4%," Tharoor said in a tweet.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Neighbours allegedly beat Muslim man for putting up BJP flag in UP
text: A case has been filed after a Muslim man from Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur alleged that his neighbours thrashed him for putting up a BJP flag at his house. The man claimed that his neighbours were angered after a BJP MLA had come there and garlanded him. Earlier, a Muslim man was allegedly killed for celebrating BJP's win in state polls.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP MP demands renaming UP's Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar, writes to CM
text: BJP MP from Farrukhabad, Mukesh Rajput, has written to UP CM Yogi Adityanath demanding renaming Farrukhabad as Panchal Nagar. “Farrukhabad has links to the Mahabharata era. The capital of king Drupada used to be here... known as Panchala area,” he wrote. However, Rajput denied the request being based on religious lines and claimed it's to only "revive ancient Indian culture".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Punjab govt is 'baccha party': Anil Vij on Punjab seeking transfer of Chandigarh
text: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking the immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana Minister Anil Vij, said, "Punjab government is 'baccha party'. They don't have complete knowledge of issues." "Chandigarh isn't the only issue but there are many other issues linked to it," he added. "They didn't speak anything about issues like SYL, Hindi speaking areas," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Nishank to evict govt allotted residence for Scindia: Reports
text: Former Union Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank is likely to evict his government allotted accommodation (27, Safdarjung Road) soon to make room for Union Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, reports said. According to sources, Nishank isn't a minister anymore, which makes him ineligible for a bungalow, and a team of officials will be sent on Monday to begin the eviction process.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: It's possible to resolve issues through talks: Karnataka CM on Kiran Shaw's tweet
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the state is known for peace and progress and it is possible to resolve social issues through peaceful talks. He added, "Everyone should show restraint." This comes after Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "If ITBT became communal it would destroy our global leadership", and urged Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide".
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Communalism will destroy India's global leadership in IT: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide" in state. She tweeted, "Karnataka has always forged inclusive economic development and we must not allow communal exclusion - If ITBT became communal it would destroy our global leadership." This comes amid reports of banning Muslim traders from temple festivals.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Commend K'taka CM for asking for restraint: Shaw on Bommai's response
text: Biocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Thursday appreciated Karnataka CM Basavaraj S Bommai for calling for restraint and saying that social issues can be resolved through discussions. Earlier, she urged Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide". Subsequently, Bommai said, "Karnataka is known for peace and progress and everyone should observe restraint."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: BJP leader arrested for abetting doctor's suicide in Rajasthan
text: Rajasthan BJP leader Jitender Gothwal and one Ram Manohar have been arrested for allegedly abetting the suicide of Dr Archana Sharma. She was booked for murder after her pregnant patient died during childbirth in Dausa. Her husband claimed Gothwal was present when the patient's family protested against her death. Meanwhile, Gothwal claimed a false case was lodged against him.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Come again: PM Modi tells 72 retiring Rajya Sabha MPs
text: In a farewell speech to 72 Rajya Sabha MPs, PM Narendra Modi asked them to come again. "This is a farewell. But as they say in Bengali- 'Ami aaschi' or in Gujarati - 'Aao jo'...come again," PM Modi said. He added, "Even though we are leaving these four walls, let's take the experience to all four directions in the country."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: PM gets clicked with retiring Rajya Sabha members, pics surface
text: PM Narendra Modi, VP Venkaiah Naidu, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla and senior cabinet ministers like Piyush Goyal, Nirmala Sitharaman and Dr S Jaishankar got photos clicked with 72 retiring MPs of Rajya Sabha. PM Modi also shook hands and exchanged laughter with senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge. The MPs will attend a farewell dinner at Naidu's official residence.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: 8 people arrested over vandalism at Delhi CM Kejriwal's home
text: Delhi Police have arrested eight people in connection with a protest and vandalism outside Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence on Wednesday. Police said they are conducting raids to arrest more people involved in the case. The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) had alleged that Kejriwal's house was vandalised by BJP workers over his remarks about 'The Kashmir Files' movie.
author: Athira Sasidharan

headlines: Rahul shares petrol prices in neighbouring nations as prices hiked 9th time in 10 days
text: As petrol and diesel prices were hiked for the ninth time in 10 days, Congress' Rahul Gandhi shared a list claiming that they were the petrol prices in the neighbouring countries. Rahul claimed petrol price in Afghanistan is ₹66.99 and Pakistan is ₹62.38. He added it's ₹72.96 in Sri Lanka, ₹78.53 in Bangladesh, ₹86.28 in Bhutan and ₹97.05 in Nepal.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: My comments aren't politically coloured: Shaw to BJP leader on communalism tweet
text: Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw told BJP's IT cell head Amit Malviya on Twitter, "I...assure you that my comments aren't politically coloured." Malviya alleged that Shaw was imposing her "politically coloured opinion" after she asked CM Basavaraj Bommai to resolve the "growing religious divide" in Karnataka. Shaw said that communalism would destroy India's global leadership in IT.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: BJP creating poisonous atmosphere through 'The Kashmir..': Pawar
text: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday accused BJP of creating a "poisonous atmosphere" by spreading "false propaganda" about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits through the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. He said that such a movie "shouldn't have been cleared for screening", but is given tax concessions. "Pakistan-based terror groups were responsible for...attacks on Kashmiri Pandits and Muslims," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Delhi HC rejects Chirag Paswan's plea against eviction from bungalow
text: The Delhi High Court has dismissed a petition by late Ram Vilas Paswan's family against the Centre's decision to evict them from the bungalow allotted to the former Union Minister in 1990. Refusing to interfere, the court said, "It's not your party headquarters." LJP leader Chirag Paswan, the son of Ram Vilas Paswan, occupied the bungalow in central Delhi.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Take measures to reduce fuel prices: Mayawati tells Centre
text: Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) supremo Mayawati on Thursday urged Centre to adopt measures to reduce fuel prices. "Prices of petrol and diesel have gone up across the country after the recent Assembly elections in five states. This is directly affecting the poor and the middle class," she added. Fuel prices were hiked today for the ninth time in 10 days.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Congress worker attacked after Punjab polls dies, party accuses AAP
text: A Congress worker who was allegedly attacked by three men in Ferozepur on March 12, two days after Punjab Assembly polls' results were declared, succumbed to his injuries on Tuesday. Congress has alleged that Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) workers were behind the attack and has sought action against them. "Culprits (AAP Goons) should be...arrested immediately," Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu tweeted.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: AAP MLA moves Delhi HC seeking SIT probe into violence at Delhi CM's house
text: A day after Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence was allegedly vandalised, AAP MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj on Thursday moved the Delhi High Court for a high-level probe. In his petition, Bharadwaj has sought a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to conduct an independent probe. "The attack appears to have been carried out with Delhi Police's tacit complicity," Bharadwaj's petition stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Priyanka to take part in protest against fuel price hike in Shimla
text: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will take part in a protest organised by the party's Himachal Pradesh unit in Shimla against the increase in fuel prices on Thursday. Priyanka tweeted, "BJP...should tell...the method by which the price of petroleum products doesn't increase at the time of elections." Notably, fuel prices have been hiked for the ninth time in 10 days.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Cong suspends 2 MLAs for violating party's whip, cross-voting in RS elections
text: The Congress in Assam has suspended two of its MLAs for violating the party's whip and cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. The party suspended its Karimganj South MLA Siddeque Ahmed for writing 'ONE' instead of numeric 1 which led to the cancellation of his vote and also suspended MLA Sashi Kanta Das for voting in favour of BJP.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Chhattisgarh CM Baghel releases ₹1,029 crore for 20 lakh farmers
text: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday released the fourth instalment of ₹1,029.31 crore under the state's flagship scheme, Rajiv Gandhi Kisan Nyay Yojana, for 20 lakh farmers in the state. "Our government's main focus is to create employment opportunities besides putting the money directly into the pockets of people," Baghel said. Additionally, he launched 60 mobile medical units.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: SC asks Sharad Yadav to vacate govt bungalow in Delhi by May 31
text: Supreme Court on Thursday directed former Union Minister Sharad Yadav to vacate the government bungalow in Delhi occupied by him till May 31. Yadav was elected to the Rajya Sabha in 2017 and was disqualified the same year. The court asked Yadav to file an undertaking that he shall vacate the bungalow on or before the said date.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Intervene to stop misuse of central agencies: Patole to judiciary
text: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole urged the Supreme Court and the Bombay High Court to intervene suo moto and stop central investigative agencies' misuse by the BJP. He said this after the Enforcement Directorate raided advocate Satish Uke, who is fighting Patole's ₹500 crore defamation suit. "This action is to suppress all who speak out against BJP," Patole added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rahul Gandhi leads protest against fuel price hike by Congress MPs in Delhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday led a protest by Congress MPs, at Vijay Chowk in Delhi, against the fuel price hike. "In last 10 days, petrol and diesel prices have been increased nine times. We demand that the rising prices should be brought under control," Gandhi said. "Congress party is holding nationwide protests on this issue today," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ensure proper budget allocation for MGNREGA: Sonia Gandhi urges Centre
text: Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi on Thursday urged the Centre to ensure proper allocation of budget to the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA). While speaking in the Lok Sabha, Sonia said, "MGNREGA...provided timely help to crores of affected poor families during COVID-19." "Still, constant cuts are being made in the budgetary allocation for MGNREGA," she added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: CM Ibrahim resigns from Karnataka Legislative Council
text: Former Union Minister CM Ibrahim resigned from the membership of the Karnataka Legislative Council with immediate effect on Thursday. His tenure at the Legislative Council was scheduled to end in June 2024. He had also quit the Congress party on March 12 and later announced his decision to join the Janata Dal (Secular).
author: Swati Dubey

headlines: 8 CPI(ML) MLAs marshalled out of Bihar Assembly by Speaker amid ruckus
text: Eight CPI(ML) MLAs were marshalled out by Bihar Legislative Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Thursday after they created a ruckus in the House over the law and order situation in the state. Reacting to the Speaker's action, CPI(ML) MLA Birendra Prasad Gupta said, "We wanted a discussion...But this government wasn't ready...They threw us out with the help of marshals."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: When will PM Modi hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha': NCP on fuel price hike
text: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) criticised PM Narendra Modi over fuel price hike and unemployment and asked when will he organise 'Parseshani Pe Charcha (interaction on hardships)'. "Students are under stress during the exam period. We thank PM for interacting with them...But when is he going to hold 'Pareshani Pe Charcha' to address concerns...of common people?" NCP's Clyde Crasto said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Karnataka Cong stages protest against fuel price hike in Bengaluru
text: Karnataka Congress leaders, including KPCC President DK Shivakumar, on Thursday, protested against the increase in gas, petrol and diesel prices in Bengaluru. Sharing a video of the same, Shivakumar tweeted, "Congress is...voice of common people...we shall make their concerns be heard loud and clear." Notably, following the latest price revision, petrol in Bengaluru now costs ₹107.30 per litre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Nitish will not leave Bihar: JDU rejects speculation of him going to RS
text: The Janata Dal (United) refuted rumours of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar going to Rajya Sabha and said that Nitish will not leave Bihar. Taking to Twitter, JDU leader Sanjay Kumar Jha, said, "Shri Kumar has people's mandate to serve Bihar, and will continue to do so for the full term as Chief Minister. He is not going anywhere."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Lok Sabha passes bill to unify all 3 municipalities of Delhi
text: The Lok Sabha on Wednesday passed the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, which seeks to unify the three municipalities of Delhi. Talking about the bill, Home Minister Amit Shah dismissed AAP's allegations that the BJP is scared of polls. "If you are so confident of the victory then why do you want elections right now?" he asked.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Govt sends team to evict Chirag Paswan from bungalow allotted to Railway Minister: Report
text: The Directorate of Estates (DoE), under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, sent a team to 12 Janpath in New Delhi to get the bungalow occupied by LJP chief Chirag Paswan vacated, according to reports. The bungalow was allotted to Ram Vilas Paswan and last year in August, it was allotted to Union Railways and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: TMC's Shatrughan Sinha dances, plays 'dhol' before Asansol by-polls
text: TMC candidate for Asansol Lok Sabha by-polls, Shatrughan Sinha, was seen playing 'dhol' and dancing with tribal women during his campaign. The polls are scheduled to be held on April 12. The Asansol Lok Sabha seat fell vacant last year after singer Babul Supriyo, who was earlier with BJP and joined TMC, resigned. Supriyo was a Union Minister.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Video shows protesters breaking barricades outside Kejriwal's home
text: A video shows a group of protesters dismantling barricades outside the residence of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday. The protesters, allegedly from the BJP, were protesting against Kejriwal's remarks on 'The Kashmir Files' movie. After the incident, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia claimed that BJP could not defeat Kejriwal in elections so it wants to kill him.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP wants to kill Kejriwal: AAP on violence at Delhi CM's house
text: AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday claimed BJP wants to kill Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. He made the remarks after Kejriwal's house was allegedly vandalised over his remarks about 'The Kashmir Files' movie. "They aren't able to defeat him in elections so they want to kill him," Sisodia said, adding that everything happened in police's presence.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: U'khand CM to head 23 depts including Home as portfolios allocated
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has allotted portfolios to the ministers in his new cabinet and kept charge of 23 departments. These include Home, Industrial Development (mining), Justice, Labour, Excise, Environment Conservation and Climate Change and Civil Aviation. Premchand Aggarwal will handle Finance and Satpal Maharaj has been given charge of the Public Works Department.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Pics show Chirag Paswan vacating Delhi bungalow allotted to father
text: LJP leader Chirag Paswan on Wednesday vacated the 12 Janpath bungalow in New Delhi, which was allotted to his late father Ram Vilas Paswan. Pictures showed Paswan's belongings leaving the premises in trucks. The bungalow has been allotted to Union Railways and IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw and earlier Directorate of Estates (DoE) sent a team to evict him.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Delhi Police registers case over vandalism at Kejriwal's home
text: Delhi Police on Wednesday registered a case against unidentified persons in connection to the alleged violence at the residence of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Earlier, AAP claimed BJP workers broke CCTV cameras over the AAP leader's comments on 'The Kashmir Files'. Deputy CM Manish Sisodia even claimed BJP wants to kill Kejriwal as it can't defeat him in polls.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Shivpal Yadav meets CM Yogi amid reports of rift with Akhilesh
text: Amid reports of rift with his nephew and SP President Akhilesh Yadav, PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow on Wednesday. PSPL spokesperson Deepak Mishra said that the meeting, which lasted about 20 minutes, was a mere courtesy visit. Days ago, Yadav had claimed he was not invited to the SP Legislature Party meeting.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Rahul Gandhi to meet TRS leaders over paddy procurement issue
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will meet TRS leaders at his residence in Delhi over Telangana's issue of paddy procurement on Wednesday. This comes a day after Gandhi accused TRS and BJP of "neglecting their moral responsibility of procuring paddy produced by Telangana farmers and politicising the issue". Gandhi will be accompanied by state AICC in-charge Manickam Tagore.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Venkaiah Naidu to host dinner for outgoing Rajya Sabha MPs tomorrow
text: Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu will host a farewell dinner for 72 MPs at his official residence on Thursday. Several Rajya Sabha members are expected to showcase their cultural talents on the occasion. BJP MP Roopa Ganguly will sing a Hindi song, TMC's Santanu Sen will play the guitar and Dola Sen will present Rabindra Sangeet.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Tejasvi Surya arrested for protesting outside Delhi CM's house
text: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya was arrested by the Delhi Police on Wednesday for protesting outside Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence. Surya was protesting against Kejriwal's comments on 'The Kashmir Files'. In response to demands that the film should be made tax-free in Delhi, Kejriwal had remarked that the film's director Vivek Agnihotri should post the video on YouTube.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Raising fuel prices, making farmers helpless on PM’s to-do list: Rahul Gandhi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said PM Narendra Modi's daily to-do list includes raising fuel prices among other things. "PM's daily to-do list...How to stop discussion on people's expenses, how to show hollow dreams of employment to the youth, which public sector company to sell and how to make farmers more helpless," Gandhi tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Destroying social fabric to win polls unacceptable: K'taka BJP MLC
text: Karnataka BJP MLC AH Vishwanath, who voiced against ban on Muslim traders from participating in temple festivals, said that destroying social fabric to win polls is unacceptable. "The peace and co-existence of different communities in Karnataka are going to be destroyed to win an election - is it right to do so? It is not acceptable," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: BJP report on Birbhum killings will weaken CBI probe: WB CM Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that a BJP fact-finding panel's report on the Birbhum violence will weaken and interfere with the CBI investigation into the incident. She said the report mentions the name of TMC Birbhum district president Anubrata Mondal, adding, "It shows BJP's vindictive attitude." "Without completion of the probe, how can [BJP] name [Mondal]?" she asked.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Mafia ruling Bengal: BJP fact-finding team on Birbhum violence
text: Mafia is ruling West Bengal in connivance with police and political leadership, said a five-member fact-finding committee of the BJP on Birbhum violence in which nine people were killed. Attributing the violence to state-sponsored extortion, the committee added that the law and order has totally collapsed and people have lost faith in the TMC government.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Attack on Delhi CM's house is a cowardly act: Bhagwant Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday said the attack on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house "is a cowardly act". "BJP’s frustration over the crushing defeat in Punjab at the hands of the AAP is clear now," Mann added. "Just because BJP cannot defeat Kejriwal, it is trying to kill him," Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said regarding the attack.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kejriwal playing victim card by claiming threat to life: Gambhir
text: After AAP alleged that BJP wants to kill Arvind Kejriwal, MP Gautam Gambhir said that the Delhi CM was playing the victim card. Pretending to speak on behalf of Kejriwal in a mocking tone, Gambhir tweeted, "I am badly trapped after making insulting comments on Kashmiri Hindus… Now, I have only one way out - the victim card."
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: No dissent among Congress MLAs against Maharashtra govt: Patole
text: Congress leader Nana Patole has refuted reports of alleged discontent among party legislators against the functioning of Maharashtra's Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. "The MVA government is stable and there is no threat to [it]," he added. Patole's comments came after reports surfaced that 25 Congress MLAs had sought an appointment with party chief Sonia Gandhi to discuss their concerns.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: TMC MLA barred from campaigning for trying to intimidate voters
text: Election Commission of India has prohibited TMC MLA Narendranath Chakraborty from campaigning till 8:00 pm of April 6 ahead of the West Bengal Lok Sabha by-polls. This comes after a video purportedly showed him asking TMC workers to intimidate voters. "Tell them if you go to vote...where you will live will be your risk," he can purportedly be heard saying.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Arrest me if you've proof: TN BJP chief on DMK's ₹100 cr defamation notice
text: Commenting on DMK's ₹100 crore defamation notice, BJP Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai said, "Arrest me if you have proof." He added, "I've also received a notice even from BGR energy. Including ₹100 crore (damages) demanded by DMK's Organising Secretary RS Bharathi...I've received notices for over ₹600 crore...I've few cows and goats in my village. You can take them."
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Reducing fuel prices before polls was BJP's strategy to win: Kharge
text: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday accused the BJP of reducing fuel prices before the Assembly elections as part of its "strategy" to win polls. "Now [BJP is] compensating by increasing prices in the guise of the Russia-Ukraine crisis," he added. Petrol and diesel prices were hiked today for the eighth time in the last nine days.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP unable to accept its defeat in Punjab Assembly polls: AAP MLA
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj alleged on Wednesday that BJP is unable to accept its defeat in Punjab Assembly polls and hence wants to "kill" Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "BJP lost against AAP in Delhi. They played dirty politics in Punjab...still they lost...so they're furious," he added. Bharadwaj's comments came after Kejriwal's residence was allegedly vandalised earlier today.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Protests will continue till Delhi CM apologises for his remark: Surya
text: BJP MP and Yuva Morcha president Tejasvi Surya on Wednesday said that the protests will continue till Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal doesn't apologise for his remark about 'The Kashmir Files' film. Last week, Kejriwal had criticised BJP for promoting 'The Kashmir Files' and making it tax-free in some states. "We demand an unconditional apology from him," Surya said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: 2 booked by Thane Police over derogatory comments against UP CM
text: Two people were booked by Ambernath Police in Thane recently. One of the accused had allegedly made derogatory comments about UP CM Yogi Adityanath in a video. The complainant, in this case, is a VHP member, who had received the 47-second-long video on a WhatsApp group. The complainant and other VHP members then confronted the group member about the video.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: SC panel recommends cancelling Ashish Mishra's bail in Lakhimpur case
text: A committee formed by Supreme Court to monitor the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case has recommended cancellation of Ashish Mishra's bail, the court told UP government. Ashish, the son of Union Minister of State for Home Ajay Mishra, is the main accused in the case. The court asked the state to make its stand clear on challenging Ashish's bail by Monday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Read the Constitution: Shah tells Kejriwal on MCD unification in Delhi
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that unification of three municipal corporations of Delhi is constitutionally legal and those opposing it should re-read the Constitution. Arvind Kejriwal talks about rights of states but if he doesn't know the difference between a state and a UT,  then "I think Constitution needs to be studied again", Shah further added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: AAP shares letter from Kashmiri Pandit teachers' body, says 'fake claim by BJP busted'
text: The AAP on Tuesday shared an official letter from Government School Teachers Association (Migrant) on Twitter, confirming that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal had helped Kashmiri Pandit teachers by regularising their services. This comes after a fake press release surfaced on social media, which stated that Delhi government's claim of job regularisation was false. "Fake claim by BJP busted," AAP said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Assam & Meghalaya sign agreement to resolve 50-year-old boundary dispute
text: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma signed an agreement on Tuesday to resolve a 50-year-old border dispute between the states. "Six out of 12 points of the dispute have been resolved...The remaining six points will be resolved at the earliest," said Home Minister Amit Shah. He also congratulated the two CMs on the resolution.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Delhi CM Kejriwal's house attacked by BJP, claims AAP; shares pics
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) alleged on Wednesday that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's house was attacked by BJP. Sharing the pictures on social media, AAP alleged that security barriers and CCTV cameras were broken and the gate was vandalised. It also claimed that Delhi Police helped BJP in this. "All for demanding rehabilitation of Kashmiri Pandits?" AAP asked.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Only authorised agencies can tap phones, intercept WhatsApp texts: Govt
text: MoS (Home) Ajay Kumar Mishra said in Parliament on Tuesday that only authorised law enforcement agencies can tap telephones or intercept and monitor any electronically transmitted information, including WhatsApp messages, as per the legal provisions of Section 69 of IT Act, 2000. The government was asked whether national or international agencies are authorised to monitor digital information.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Opposed Ashish Mishra's bail plea in Lakhimpur case: UP govt to SC
text: UP government on Tuesday told Supreme Court that it 'vehemently opposed' the bail plea in Allahabad High Court of Ashish Mishra, who is accused in the Lakhimpur Kheri case involving farmers. Ashish is the son of Union Minister Ajay Mishra. The government also dismissed allegations that attackers threatened victims. "Families of all victims and witnesses...are being provided...security," it added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Man who attacked Bihar CM sent to hospital for psychiatric treatment
text: The man who had attacked Bihar CM Nitish Kumar at a function two days ago has been admitted to a hospital for psychiatric treatment, police said on Tuesday. "We conducted a thorough inquiry. Neither the attacker nor any of his family members have any criminal history," police said. The 32-year-old man had attacked Kumar in his hometown Bakhtiyarpur on Sunday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Former PM Devegowda's wife gets I-T notice over family-owned land
text: Former PM HD Devegowda's wife Chennamma has been issued a notice by Income Tax Department over the land owned by the family in Hassan district. "I-T notice has been issued...seeking all details pertaining to our property," her son HD Revanna said. Criticising the move, he asked, "Have my parents made crores of rupees...Why is one political party being targeted?"
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: What was Centre's announcement on Chandigarh that Punjab govt is opposing?
text: AAP leader and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann has warned of protests against Home Minister Amit Shah's announcement that from April 1, Central service rules will apply to Chandigarh UT employees. The demand for the shift is pending for 20-25 years and Shah said it will benefit the employees. Punjab political parties, however, claim the Centre wants to 'usurp Punjab's rights'.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 2 BJP MLAs marshalled out of Delhi Assembly by Speaker amid ruckus
text: BJP MLAs OP Sharma and Vijender Gupta were marshalled out of Delhi Assembly on Tuesday amid ruckus in the House. They raised objections when AAP MLAs criticised the Centre over the law-and-order situation in Delhi. Speaker Ram Niwas Goel alleged that Delhi Assembly was being incapacitated on the behest of the Centre's order through the Lieutenant Governor.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: House collapses in WB due to bomb explosion, Suvendu seeks NIA probe
text: A house in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal was demolished on Tuesday allegedly due to a bomb explosion. BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari demanded an NIA probe, saying that the site is close to the Bangladesh border. "West Bengal has become a stockpile of explosives, gunpowder, arms and other inflammable substances...Bombs keep going off regularly," he tweeted.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Was thrown out of house, threatened: Guj Congress leader's wife
text: Reshma Solanki, the wife of former chief of Gujarat Congress Bharat Solanki, has alleged domestic violence and claimed she was thrown out of the house two-three times. She said she fled to the US for safety and later was warned that she will be killed if she returned. "I'll live with my husband, won't give him a divorce," she added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Bhumi shares pic with Smriti Irani; appreciates her work for kids, women
text: Actress Bhumi Pednekar on Tuesday took to Instagram to share a picture with Minister of Women and Child Development of India Smriti Irani. She wrote in the caption, "Loved meeting you today. More power to you ma'am for all the amazing work you're doing towards uplifting our gender, the children of our country and all compromised communities."
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: SP complicit with BJP in giving communal colour to UP polls: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Tuesday accused Samajwadi Party of being complicit with BJP in giving communal colour to the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls. "They created an atmosphere of fear by making the Assembly elections a Hindu-Muslim affair, which especially misled the Muslim society and it made a huge mistake of voting unilaterally for the SP," she said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Backwards, SCs & minorities have still not understood their rights: SBSP chief
text: In the recently held UP Assembly polls, some people voted in name of free ration and salt, while some others who are hardliners and want Hindu-Muslim (division), voted on these lines, SBSP chief, OP Rajbhar, said. "The backwards, Scheduled Castes and minority communities have still not understood their rights. We had to suffer because of all these things," he added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: It takes 15-20 years to become a pan-India party: Prashant Kishor
text: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said it takes 15-20 years for any party to become a pan-India party. Historically, only Congress and BJP have so far been able to become a pan-India party by winning the Lok Sabha elections, he added. "Winning elections in two states is one thing, winning the LS elections is another," he said while referring to AAP.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Patriotism, honesty, humanity are pillars of AAP ideology: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said his party has brought a 'Rozgar Budget' because the three pillars of AAP's ideology are "hardcore patriotism, honesty and humanity". "The Budget presented in the Assembly is not an ordinary document, it is historical. A 'Rozgar Budget' has been presented for the first time in independent India," Kejriwal added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Mamata talking Opposition unity to divert attention from Birbhum: BJP
text: BJP has called West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's move to unite the Opposition parties against the Centre a way to divert attention from the Birbhum violence. The death of people in the Birbhum incident shows that lawlessness is rampant in West Bengal and Banerjee is simply seeking to "deflect attention" from this "serious issue", BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Stones hurled at ex-Sikkim CM Pawan Chamling's convoy; vehicles damaged
text: Former Sikkim CM Pawan Chamling's convoy was attacked with stones while he was returning from the state Assembly on the first day of Budget Session in Gangtok on Monday. Four people have been arrested in connection with the incident in which several vehicles were damaged. Chamling alleged that top leadership of the ruling Sikkim Krantikari Morcha (SKM) instigated the attack.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Don't pay bills till govt gives steady power supply: AAP to farmers
text: The Aam Aadmi Party on Tuesday appealed to farmers in Gujarat to not pay their electricity bills if the BJP-led state government failed to provide an uninterrupted power supply during the ongoing summer season. Farmers won't be able to get their summer harvest, because of frequent interruptions and large gaps in electricity supply, said activist and AAP leader Sagar Rabari.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: No one has approached BJD for Presidential polls yet: Odisha CM
