text: Odisha CM and Biju Janata Dal (BJD) supremo Naveen Patnaik said on Tuesday that neither Centre nor Opposition parties had approached BJD yet for upcoming Presidential elections. Patnaik, who's on a three-day visit to Delhi, said he doesn't have any thoughts about polls, adding that "there's time" for it. "I've come to Parliament to...take up...developmental schemes of Odisha," he added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee skips ED summons in WB coal scam case
text: TMC National Secretary Abhishek Banerjee, who was summoned by ED for questioning in a money laundering case linked to West Bengal coal scam case, skipped his scheduled appearance on Tuesday. According to reports, he sent an email to officials citing some personal reasons for his non-appearance. Banerjee was earlier quizzed for eight hours by ED in Delhi on March 21.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: BJP, SP complicity known, Muslims made mistake of voting for SP: Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party chief Mayawati on Tuesday said that the Muslim community made a "huge mistake of voting unilaterally for the SP" and that it has to be rectified to defeat the Bharatiya Janata Party in Uttar Pradesh. "The internal complicity of SP and BJP...in Uttar Pradesh is widely known...They created an atmosphere of fear...misled the Muslim society," she added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: YSRCP has turned Visakhapatnam into 'city of sorrow': Lokesh Nara
text: Telugu Desam Party's (TDP) Lokesh Nara on Tuesday accused the YSRCP of turning Visakhapatnam into a "city of sorrow and suppression". He alleged that it's high time that "encroachments" by YSRCP leaders in Andhra Pradesh are brought to an end. Lokesh's comments came after Visakhapatnam MP MVV Satyanarayana was accused of encroaching on land belonging to a Central Intelligence SP.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I guarantee to make Punjabi University debt-free: Bhagwant Mann
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said he is working to make the Punjabi University free from debt. "I guarantee to make the Punjabi University free from debt so as to regain its pristine glory as a seat of higher learning in northern India," Mann added. Providing world-class education to students of the state is the Punjab government's priority, Mann stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Rahul criticises TRS, BJP on paddy procurement issue in Telangana
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused TRS and BJP of "politicising" the paddy procurement issue and has asked them to stop "harassing" the farmers in Telangana. He also said that Congress will stand by Telangana's farmers. Meanwhile, Telangana Minister Harish Rao Thanneeru has responded by criticising the Congress for allegedly not supporting TRS on the 'One Nation, One Procurement' policy.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: LG Anil Baijal opposed regularisation of Kashmiri migrant teachers: AAP
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) alleged that Lt Governor Anil Baijal had opposed the regularisation of services of Kashmiri migrant teachers in Delhi government schools even after Arvind Kejriwal-led Cabinet approved it. "BJP's LG never stood by Kashmiri migrant teachers. He openly opposed their regularisation. He even filed a petition in the Supreme Court," AAP leader Atishi claimed.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat to address Kashmiri Pandits on April 3
text: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat will virtually address Kashmiri Pandit community members on April 3, the last day of Navreh celebrations in Jammu, BJP said on Tuesday. "He'll address the displaced community across the world," BJP spokesperson GL Raina said, adding it'll be the first time Bhagwat will be addressing them. RSS-backed Sanjeevani Sharda Kendra will be organising the three-day celebrations.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Maharashtra ministers Gaikwad, Shaikh booked for showing swords at event
text: A case has been registered against Maharashtra ministers Aslam Shaikh and Varsha Gaikwad in Mumbai after they were seen brandishing swords at a public event on Sunday. The event was held in Bandra to welcome the chairman of Congress' Minority Department Imran Pratapgarhi. Several Congress leaders were present on the occasion.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill tabled in Lok Sabha amid protests
text: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Mishra Teni introduced the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022 in Lok Sabha on Monday. Opposition parties raised objections over the Bill and called it unconstitutional. The bill proposes to allow police and prison authorities to collect, store and analyse physical and biological samples of convicts as well as persons accused of crimes.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Mamata writes to Oppn leaders, calls for meet against BJP's 'attack on democracy'
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to all Opposition leaders, "expressing her concern over BJP's direct attacks on democracy", TMC said. "I urge everyone [to]...come together for a meeting to deliberate on the way forward at a place as per everyone's convenience," Mamata wrote. She added that central agencies are being used to harass political opponents across the country.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Don't vote or face consequences: TMC MLA to BJP supporters
text: BJP leader Amit Malviya has shared a clip showing TMC MLA from Pandabeswar, Narendranath Chakraborty, threatening BJP supporters ahead of the Asansol Lok Sabha seat bypolls. "If you vote, where you would be after voting is at your own risk," he purportedly said. Malviya wrote that such "criminals should be behind bars" but West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee "patronises them".
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Sena workers assault man for criticising Maha CM; video surfaces
text: A video of Shiv Sena workers allegedly assaulting a man for criticising Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray in a Facebook post has surfaced online. The incident took place at a mall in Jalgaon. A Shiv Sena worker called this the party's "style of justice", saying, "We first tried to explain [it to the man] peacefully but he wasn't ready to accept."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Motion to remove PM Imran Khan tabled in Pakistani Parliament
text: A no-confidence motion to remove Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan was moved by the Leader of the Opposition in the country's National Assembly on Monday. A debate will begin on the motion moved by Shehbaz Sharif and voting will be held on April 4 or 5. The Speaker had refused to allow the motion to be tabled on March 25.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CM orders probe after Muslim man killed for celebrating BJP's win in UP
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered a probe into the alleged killing of a Muslim man in Kushinagar for celebrating the BJP's victory in the recently-held Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. Adityanath also announced a compensation of ₹2 lakh for the family of the victim. Meanwhile, police said that two persons have been arrested in connection with the case.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Ruckus in Bihar Assembly after Oppn tears tickets of 'The Kashmir Files'
text: A ruckus erupted in Bihar Assembly on Monday after MLAs of RJD and CPI(ML) tore the free tickets of 'The Kashmir Files' which was being distributed by the Bihar government in Vidhan Sabha. The Bihar government had arranged for a special screening of the movie for all the MLAs. The opposition parties alleged the ruling government of promoting communal agendas.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PM, UP CM gave tight slap to Opp'n by making me minister: Ansari
text: UP Minority Welfare Minister, Danish Ansari, said on Sunday that PM Narendra Modi and CM Yogi Adityanath "delivered a tight slap" to opposition parties accusing the BJP of being anti-Muslim by making him a minister. He further added that leaders like Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav and Congress leaders Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi promote falsehoods among Muslims for political benefits.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Centre being run by pickpockets: Cong's Nana Patole on fuel price hike
text: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole criticised the Centre over the fuel price hike and said that "the Modi government is being run by pickpockets". "Crude oil prices have declined by 26% but petrol prices have been increased by 80 paise and diesel by 70 paise today. There has been an increase of ₹4.80 in a week," he said on Twitter.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Raj Speaker tells BJP MLAs to take back iPhones they'd returned
text: After Rajasthan BJP MLAs returned iPhone 13 gifts given to them during the state's Budget Session last month, the state Assembly Speaker CP Joshi on Monday asked them to take them back. He said that the iPhones were given to make the entire House's proceedings IT-enabled. "In order to improve members' efficacy, it is necessary...you use the phones," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Price hikes show govt’s anti-people, anti-poor mindset: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
text: Following the fuel price hike, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the price hikes show government's "anti-people" and "anti-poor" mindset. "My argument (in LS) was that prices of petroleum products including cooking gas have been increasing relentlessly," Chowdhury added. "Adding fuel to the fire, the government is also going to raise the prices of essential medicines," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP worried for 'The Kashmir Files' but not Kashmiri Pandits: Sisodia
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia criticised BJP saying that the party is worried for 'The Kashmir Files' film but not the Kashmiri Pandits. "The BJP has been in power for eight years now. What did they do for Kashmiri Pandits?" he asked. Sisodia further praised Arvind Kejriwal saying that the Delhi CM did a lot for Kashmiri Pandits.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Gulmaki elected as Odisha's 1st Muslim woman chairperson in urban polls
text: Odisha's Gulmaki Dalwazi Habib who was elected as the chairperson of Bhadrak Municipality became the first-ever Muslim woman to get the chairperson post of a local body in the state. The 31-year-old who contested as an Independent candidate defeated BJD's Sasmita Mishra by 3,256 votes. She is a newcomer to politics, however, her husband was a Bhadrak BJD vice-president.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: JD(U) leader Mehta shot 5 times, succumbs to bullet injuries
text: Janata Dal (United) leader Deepak Kumar Mehta was shot by unidentified assailants in Patna's Danapur area before he succumbed to the injuries in the hospital on Monday. According to the police, five shots were fired at Mehta including one on his head. "It is a very unfortunate incident and the government will take action," said senior JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP increased fuel prices after polls, they're ravan bhakts: Rajasthan minister
text: Rajasthan Minister Pratap Khachariyawas on Monday said the BJP should distribute coupons for petrol, diesel and LPG just like they "distributed" tickets for the movie 'The Kashmir Files'. "After polls, BJP increased petrol and diesel prices...They are Ravan bhakts, not Ram bhakts," Khachariyawas added. "Ravan was a deceiver, but Lord Ram did not deceive anyone," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Only CAs, lawyers gaining from present Income Tax laws: P Chidambaram
text: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Monday urged the Centre to replace the existing Income Tax Act with the Direct Taxes Code. Taking part in the debate on the Appropriation Bill and Finance Bill in the Rajya Sabha, Chidambaram said, “No one benefits from this Income Tax Act except the Chartered Accountants (CAs) and the lawyers."
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Banning Muslims from Hindu fairs is not right: Karnataka BJP MLA
text: BJP's Belagavi North MLA Anil Benake has spoken against the recent practice of disallowing Muslim vendors to conduct business in Hindu temples' fairs in Karnataka. "No question of banning Muslims...but if people do it, we cannot say much. No matter where it is, whether people should buy or not buy from somewhere is wrong," Benake said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Bihar's youth is frustrated due to unemployment: BJP MP
text: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Gopal Narayan Singh has said that Bihar's youth population is "frustrated" due to unemployment. "The situation in Bihar is not very normal, especially among (the) youths...To address their frustration, either provide them jobs or education," Singh said. The politician was speaking in reference to the recent attack on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar by a youth.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will quit politics if Opp'n can prove allegations: Ajay Misra
text: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Misra Teni on Monday said he will quit politics if the Opposition can prove allegations against him. "If there is even one case against me...I will quit politics," Misra said. This comes after Opposition members continued to raise the issue of the alleged involvement of Misra's son in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We've demanded a discussion in LS on fuel price hike: Cong leader
text: Cogress MP Kodikunnil Suresh on Monday said the party has demanded a discussion in Lok Sabha on the recent hike in fuel prices. "The Speaker advised government to have this discussion next week," Suresh said. Petrol, diesel prices were hiked for the sixth time in a week on Monday, leading to an increase of ₹4 and ₹4.1/litre respectively since Tuesday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: I'm fortunate: KP Maurya after taking charge as UP's Dty CM
text: Keshav Prasad Maurya took charge as UP's Deputy CM on Tuesday and said that he is "fortunate" to have gotten the opportunity for "upliftment of rural sector". He has been given the Rural Development and Food Processing department under the Yogi Adityanath-led government. "Will do everything possible to deliver our schemes to the needy in a timely manner," he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Surya calls Kejriwal a 'liar' over Kashmiri Pandit teachers claim
text: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya has called AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal a "blatant liar" over his claims about providing assistance to Kashmiri Pandits. Sharing a 2015 article's screenshot on Twitter, Surya wrote, "It wasn't his government that regularised...service of Kashmiri Pandit contractual teachers...in Delhi schools. It happened because of a court order." He further claimed Kejriwal had opposed it.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Ex-UP CM Kalyan Singh awarded Padma Vibhushan posthumously
text: Former UP Chief Minister late Kalyan Singh was awarded India's second-highest civilian award, the Padma Vibhushan, posthumously on Monday. His son Rajveer Singh collected the award on his behalf from President Ram Nath Kovind. The former BJP leader was elected as the UP CM twice, in 1991 and 1997, and had also been a member of the Parliament.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: U'khand Cong VP removed for 6 yrs for making 'unnecessary remarks'
text: Uttarakhand Congress Vice-President Aqueel Ahmed was expelled from the party for giving 'unnecessary remarks' in the media for a period of six years. "Statements made during the Assembly elections...were not appropriate keeping the dignity of your (Ahmed) post," the notice read. Notably, Ahmed had made claims about Congress setting up a Muslim University during the run-up to the polls.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP trying to influence judiciary: WB CM in letter to non-BJP CMs
text: In a letter to Chief Ministers and heads of non-BJP states and UTs, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said BJP is trying to "influence a certain section of the judiciary". "Time and again, BJP tries to attack the federal structure of this country," she added. Banerjee also called for a chief ministerial meeting of all non-BJP states and parties.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TMC, BJP MLAs clash inside Bengal Assembly; 5 BJP MLAs suspended
text: Five BJP MLAs, including Suvendu Adhikari, were suspended after a scuffle broke out between TMC and BJP MLAs in West Bengal Assembly on Monday. The incident took place after BJP legislators demanded a statement from CM Mamata Banerjee over Birbhum violence, in which eight people died. Both parties have alleged that some of their MLAs suffered injuries in the clash.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Pramod Sawant takes oath as Goa CM for 2nd consecutive term
text: Three-time MLA Pramod Sawant was sworn in as the Chief Minister of Goa for the second consecutive term on Monday. The oath-taking ceremony was held at Dr Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Indoor Stadium in Taleigao at 11 am. Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and BJP National President JP Nadda also attended the ceremony, among other leaders.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: 'Is it a mask or a beard?', Vice President asks MP Suresh Gopi in Rajya Sabha
text: A video has shown Vice President Venkaiah Naidu jokingly asking Rajya Sabha MP and Malayalam actor-turned-politician Suresh Gopi if there was a 'mask or a beard' on his face during a Parliament session. Gopi is heard replying, "Beard, beard. My new look, sir", even as other members of the Upper House are heard breaking into laughter.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CM Yogi shakes hand with Akhilesh in UP Assembly, video surfaces
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday greeted Leader of Opposition Akhilesh Yadav in the Legislative Assembly during oath-taking of newly-elected MLAs. In a video, Adityanath can be seen shaking hands with the Samajwadi Party chief and later giving him a pat on the back. Adityanath was sworn in as the UP CM for the second consecutive term on Friday
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Foreign powers behind conspiracy to topple govt: Pak PM at rally
text: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday, while addressing a massive rally in Islamabad, claimed there were "foreign powers" behind a 'conspiracy' to topple his government. This came a day ahead of the no-confidence motion that is to be tabled against Khan in the Pakistani Parliament. During the show of strength, Khan also denied that he'll resign, as has been speculated.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 3 BJP MLAs suspended from Delhi Assembly amid protests over remarks against CM
text: BJP MLAs Anil Bajpai, Jitender Mahajan and Ajay Mahawar were suspended for the day from Delhi Assembly on Monday after the AAP protested over alleged derogatory remarks against CM Arvind Kejriwal. AAP MLAs entered the well of the House shouting slogans over Delhi BJP chief Adesh Kumar Gupta's remarks. Proceedings of the House were adjourned for 15 minutes after this.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BSP fields ex-MLA Guddu Jamali for Azamgarh Lok Sabha bypoll
text: The BSP has fielded its former two-time MLA Shah Alam alias Guddu Jamali for the Azamgarh Lok Sabha bypoll. Jamali held the position of BSP's legislature party leader in the last Uttar Pradesh Assembly before being sacked ahead of the polls. Jamali then contested from Mubarakpur in Azamgarh on an AIMIM ticket before joining the BSP again.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Congress can't compete with BJP in Assam: AAP leader Rajesh Sharma
text: Ahead of municipal elections in Guwahati, AAP leader Rajesh Sharma has said that the Congress "can never compete" with BJP in Assam and his party has become the "only alternative" for the state's people. This comes as AAP declared its first list of 10 candidates for the polls on Sunday. "[People] have also realised our work in Delhi," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Centre barred ration scheme in Delhi, we'll start it in Punjab: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday reacted to Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announcing doorstep ration delivery scheme, saying, "[Centre] didn't allow us to implement it in Delhi, no problem, we'll do it in Punjab." He added that there's a saying- 'You can't stop the idea whose time has come'. "It'll get implemented in...country, like mohalla clinics," he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Trying to take PM's work forward, no one can step in his shoes: Guj CM
text: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that every worker of the Bharatiya Janata Party draws inspiration from Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "We are only trying to take his work forward. Nobody wants to nor can ever step into his shoes," he said, adding, "Our government as well as the organisation work in tandem and not in silos."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Hope Congress gets stronger as strong Oppn is a need for democracy: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said it's his "honest wish" that Congress party should become stronger as a strong Opposition is a need for democracy. With the weakening of Congress, its place has been taken by regional parties, which is not good for the Indian democracy, Gadkari added. "Democracy runs on two wheels, the ruling dispensation and the Opposition," Gadkari stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Opp'n blaming Centre 'out of frustration': Goyal on fuel price hike
text: Union Minister for Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal on Sunday said that the Opposition is blaming the BJP-led Central government for a hike in fuel prices 'out of frustration' of losing Assembly elections. Goyal further said that the prices were hiked because of the implications of the ongoing crisis in Ukraine, despite the government's efforts to keep it under control.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Don't be so anti-Hindu openly: Assam CM to Kejriwal over 'The Kashmir Files' remark
text: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma commented on Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's remark on 'The Kashmir Files' movie saying, "Don't be so anti-Hindu openly." "Kejriwal has earlier made many films tax-free but why he wants 'The Kashmir Files' to be uploaded on YouTube. What's his interest?" Sarma added. "You do whatever you want but don't be so anti-Hindu openly," Sarma stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Ex-NC leader says party was ready to join BJP after 2014 J&K polls
text: BJP leader Devender Singh Rana, who was formerly associated with the National Conference, has claimed that NC was ready to tie up with the BJP to form government after 2014 polls resulted in hung assembly. "I was sent to Delhi to persuade the BJP to form a coalition government with us," Rana said. NC chief Farooq Abdullah refuted the claim.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: AAP dissolves all units in Rajasthan ahead of state Assembly polls
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday dissolved all its units in Rajasthan to restructure party ahead of the 2023 state Legislative Assembly elections, the party's new election incharge in Rajasthan, Vinay Mishra, said. Mishra added that party will soon start a membership drive in the state. "We'll connect people from village to village...and...create a strong organisation in Rajasthan,” Mishra said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Swami Prasad Maurya is an opportunist: UP minister Baby Rani Maurya
text: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet Minister Baby Rani Maurya has termed Swami Prasad Maurya as an "opportunist". "He had come (for)... opportunities. He went after doing what he had to do," she said referring to Swami's decision to leave BJP. Notably, Swami had left BJP ahead of the Assembly elections citing that Dalits and OBCs were allegedly being neglected by the BJP.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will provide employment opportunities: Pramod Sawant after taking oath as Goa CM
text: After swearing-in as Goa CM on Monday, Pramod Sawant said that the newly-formed government will work for development with a primary focus on providing employment opportunities in the coastal state. Sawant took oath as the Goa CM for the second consecutive term today. "Goa will rise high in future," Sawant added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Banks never got back money from defaulters under UPA govt: Sitharaman
text: Speaking about recovering money from bank loan defaulters under Narendra Modi-led government, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday claimed, "During the UPA government, no money was recovered from the NPAs." "Over ₹10,000 crore...have been recovered by PSU banks from loan defaulters after taking over their assets," she said. The Congress protested against Sitharaman's remarks.
author: Shailesh

headlines: When I was young, we were given Chandigarh's example as good city: Shah
text: Home Minister Amit Shah said that when he was young, children in Gujarat were given example of Chandigarh as a planned and good city. "Chandigarh is one of the most developed cities in the country and I am confident that in coming days, it will become one of the most advanced cities of the world in future," Shah added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Rajya Sabha adjourned till noon as Oppn creates ruckus over fuel price hike
text: The Rajya Sabha was adjourned till noon on Monday as the Opposition parties created a ruckus over fuel price hike and the general strike by trade unions in India. "I have rejected the notices but the matter raised by the Opposition members can be discussed later in the day," Rajya Sabha Chairman, M Venkaiah Naidu, said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Birbhum killings a plot to stall coal block project in district: CM Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday said that the killings in Birbhum's Bogtui village were a "conspiracy" to stall the Deucha Pachami coal block project in the district. "The coal block project will generate one lakh jobs in Birbhum alone," Banerjee added. "These killings were executed to prevent us from taking forward the project," Banerjee stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: BJP MLA alleges corruption in NDA-run Bihar's state govt
text: Bihar BJP MLA Haribhushan Thakur (Bachol) criticised the state government, led by CM Nitish Kumar in a coalition with the BJP being a part of it. Thakur alleged that the state's administrative "system is mired in corruption". He further alleged that "no action was taken" despite him informing the Muzaffarpur's Superintendent of Police about an alleged corruption case.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Giving free food grains without corruption shows PM's determination: Amit Shah
text: Union Minister Amit Shah said providing free food grains and COVID-19 vaccines to crores of countrymen without any corruption through technology shows the determination and power of PM Narendra Modi. "While being the Chief Minister of Gujarat, he (PM Modi) had worked to bring the modern techniques of urban development to the grassroots," Shah added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nitish Kumar fires VIP chief from Cabinet after BJP’s request
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has fired Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP) chief Mukesh Sahani from the post of Animal Husbandry and Fisheries Minister. "After BJP made the request for Mukesh Sahani's termination as minister, the CM has recommended it to the Raj Bhavan," said state's public relations department. Notably, three other VIP MLAs had recently joined BJP.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Impose Article 355 in WB as law & order is collapsing: Cong leader
text: West Bengal Congress chief Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said Article 355 must be imposed in the state as the law and order situation is collapsing under CM Mamata Banerjee's rule. Chowdhury was leading a 'padyatra' demanding an impartial and fair investigation into the mysterious death of student leader Anis Khan. State government has "miserably failed to control the situation", he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Aradhana Misra elected as Congress Legislature Party leader in UP
text: Aradhana Misra alias Mona was elected as the Congress Legislature Party (CLP) leader in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly. Mona, who is a three-time MLA, was appointed CLP leader by Congress President Sonia Gandhi. The 47-year-old politician is an MLA from the Rampur Khas constituency, which has been a Congress bastion for the past four decades.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Uttar Pradesh assembly to elect new speaker on March 29
text: As per an official statement by the assembly secretariat, the election for Uttar Pradesh Assembly's new Speaker will be held on March 29. The statement added that the nominations can be filed till Monday. The assembly's newly elected MLAs will take oath from tomorrow, which would be administered by protem Speaker Ramapati Shastri at the Assembly hall.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: UP Deputy CM KP Maurya's son meets with car accident, suffers injuries
text: Yogesh Kumar Maurya, the son of Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister KP Maurya, suffered minor injuries after meeting with an accident on Jhansi-Kanpur Highway, Jalaun SP said on Saturday. "There were no casualties, the car was slightly damaged," he said, adding that Yogesh is under doctor's observation. He reportedly met with an accident on way to visit a temple.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Cong MLA's son booked for raping & blackmailing minor girl in Raj
text: The son of Rajasthan Congress MLA Johari Lal Meena and two others were booked for allegedly gang-raping a minor girl and blackmailing her, using her obscene pictures in Samleti. The accused allegedly attempted to extort ₹15.40 lakh and jewellery from the victim. Dismissing the allegations, Meena said on Saturday, "The rape case...is fake, baseless and a political conspiracy."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: AAP MP Raghav Chadha walks the ramp as showstopper at Lakme Fashion week
text: Aam Aadmi Party MP Raghav Chadha on Sunday walked the ramp as showstopper for designer Pawan Sachdev at the Lakme Fashion Week 2022. The 33-year-old, who was recently nominated by the party for the Rajya Sabha polls, is the youngest member of the Upper House. A video showed Raghav walking the ramp with the designer and actor Aparshakti Khurana.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Will challenge Centre's MCD bill in court if needed: Delhi CM
text: Delhi Chief Minister and AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said his government will study the bill, introduced in Lok Sabha by the Central government for the unification of three municipalities of Delhi, and challenge it in court if needed. "Reduction of wards' number to 250 from 272 means delimitation, which further means no elections," he claimed.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: BJD's Sulochana Das becomes 1st female Mayor of Bhubaneswar
text: BJD's Sulochana Das on Saturday became the first female Mayor of Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation. "I want to thank the people of Bhubaneswar and our CM Naveen Patnaik for giving me this opportunity. Smart and vibrant Bhubaneswar is our first priority," she said. BJD's mayoral candidates won in all three municipal corporations namely Bhubaneswar, Cuttack and Berhampur.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Firefighters waited for 10 hrs to enter homes: Birbhum eyewitness
text: An eyewitness of the Birbhum violence has claimed firefighters waited for nearly 10 hours to enter burnt homes due to immense heat. The eyewitness, who is a sub-inspector, said he tried to douse the fire with his son. He added firefighters arrived at the scene around 10:25 pm. They again returned around 7:00 am the next day for rescue operations.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Will protest if CBI follows BJP's directions in Birbhum: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday alleged that there was a conspiracy behind the Birbhum violence, in which at least eight people were killed. She said, "If [CBI] will only follow BJP's directions, we are ready to protest." The CBI is probing the case and a 15-member team of the agency visited the Bogtui village on Saturday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: SP, Muslim vote bank responsible for our defeat in polls: Mayawati
text: BSP chief Mayawati on Sunday said the Samajwadi Party and the Muslim vote bank were responsible for her party's loss in the UP Assembly elections. She added that she will not be accepting the President's position if such an offer is made to her. Mayawati also announced former MLA Shah Alam as BSP's candidate for Azamgarh Lok Sabha bypoll.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Punjab CM gives compensatory cheques to cotton farmers over damaged crop
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Saturday gave compensatory cheques to cotton farmers for crop damage due to pink bollworm attack in Mansa. During the distribution of the cheques, CM Mann said, "People are honest, but it will take some time to correct the system, every work will be done." "The whole world will watch the upliftment of Punjab," he added.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Muslims love BJP, Yogi & Modi: Uttar Pradesh MoS Danish Azad Ansari
text: Danish Azad Ansari, who took oath as Minister of State in Yogi Adityanath-led government, said Muslims have understood government has worked for all sects of Muslim community and they love BJP, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "Opinion has changed...schemes for ration, houses, Ayushman card have benefited all sections," he said.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Give account of ₹26 lakh cr tax earned on petrol, diesel: Cong to govt
text: Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala has said that the government should give an account of the ₹26 lakh crore "accrued" through excise duty on petrol and diesel in about eight years. Notably, Surjewala's comment comes after petrol and diesel prices were hiked five times in the past week. The price hikes have come after a gap of over four months.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Cong to stage protests against inflation in Maha from Mar 31: Patole
text: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole has said that party will launch statewide protest from March 31 against rising prices of fuel and other commodities. Congress workers will stage agitation that day from 11 am onwards, while from April 2 to 4, they'll organise sit-in protests at various district headquarters, he added. Fuel rates have increased by ₹3.70/litre in five days.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Every state should implement Uniform Civil Code as decided by U'khand: Giriraj
text: Union Minister Giriraj Singh has said that as announced by the Uttarakhand government, Bihar and other states should also implement the Uniform Civil Code. Giriraj said, "Every state of [India] should implement it...Let it be one-state, one-law." Giriraj also thanked Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami after he announced that his government has decided to implement the UCC in the state.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Inflation begins after elections are over: Congress' Digvijaya Singh
text: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh criticised at the Central government over the rising prices of petrol and diesel. The former Madhya Pradesh CM said, "Inflation starts after the elections are over. If elections come again, then the government will come again to control the prices." He also added that "people of the whole country are being cheated".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Entirely predictable: Tharoor as fuel prices hiked for 5th time
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Sunday reacted to the hike in petrol and diesel prices for the fifth time in six days, saying, "This was entirely predictable!" The price of petrol has been increased by 50 paise/litre, while that of diesel is by 55 paise/litre. "Tax-gouging and price manipulation have been...hallmarks of this government’s contempt for...common citizen," he added.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Youth Congress workers protest against rising fuel prices in Delhi
text: Youth Congress workers on Saturday protested against the increase in prices of diesel, petrol and LPG gas cylinders in Delhi. Congress has also announced a 'Mehngai Mukt Bharat Abhiyan' over the issue of fuel price hike. Notably, the prices of petrol and diesel were hiked for the fourth time in five days on Saturday by around 80 paise per litre.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Ban madrasas, they'll never say Bharat Mata ki jai: K'taka BJP MLA
text: Karnataka BJP MLA MP Renukacharya on Saturday urged the state CM and Education Minister to ban madrasas, saying, "They will go against our country and they will never say Bharat Mata ki jai." He added that madrasas "teach anti-national lessons". Furthermore, he criticised Congress' call for a Karnataka bandh over hijab controversy, saying, "Is this Pakistan, Bangladesh, or Islamic country?"
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: TDP, Cong call for 'financial emergency' in YSRCP-ruled Andhra
text: The Telugu Desam Party and Congress have asked the Centre to clamp "financial emergency" in Andhra Pradesh due to the alleged mishandling by the YSRCP regime. "Centre should... impose financial emergency under Article 360," said TDP's Yanamala Rama Krishnudu. He further questioned by referring to the financial transactions through 'special bills' that "into whose pockets have ₹48,284 crore gone".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: At least 22 ministers of UP govt face criminal charges: ADR report
text: In the newly formed Uttar Pradesh government, at least 22 ministers have declared criminal cases against them, claims the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR) report. The poll rights body, which had analysed the self-sworn affidavits of 45 of the total 53 ministers, also claimed that at least 20 (44%) ministers have declared serious criminal cases against themselves.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: No entry for those with black masks & clothing at Goa CM's swearing-in
text: Goa BJP chief Sadanand Shet Tanavade on Saturday said that people wearing black masks or black clothing will not be permitted to enter the venue of the swearing-in ceremony of CM-designate Pramod Sawant on Monday. "However, the ceremony is open to all," he added. PM Narendra Modi, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah will attend the ceremony.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Nitish Kumar fell on PM's feet due to compulsions: Rabri Devi
text: RJD leader Rabri Devi has alleged that CM Nitish Kumar "fell on the feet" of PM Narendra Modi in Lucknow because of some 'majboori' (compulsions). Her remark was in reference to a video of Kumar greeting the PM at UP CM Yogi Adityanath's oath-taking ceremony on Friday. Responding to her remark, JD(U) leader Upendra Kushwaha said that it's called courtesy.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Cong alleges corruption in Amtek insolvency; demands CBI probe
text: Congress on Sunday alleged that Centre was protecting the promoters of Amtek Group which has declared insolvency and demanded a CBI probe into it. The party said that the group took a loan of ₹21,000 crore from banks and then put it on sale for ₹4,100 crore. Congress leader Pawan Khera said that institutional corruption is going on.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Talks with Pak on Kashmir only when there's no sound of guns: Singh
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh on Sunday reacted to Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti's demand of BJP holding talks with Pakistan, stating that dialogue's only possible when there's no sound of guns or bullets. "Would BJP talk to people of [India] or [foreigners]?" he added. Mufti had said BJP should hold talks with Pakistan to ensure peace in Kashmir.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Rape case against son fake, it's political plot: Cong MLA Johari
text: Congress MLA Johari Lal Meena said that the rape case against his son is "fake and baseless". "[It is] a political conspiracy after seeing my popularity," he added. Johari's son and two others were booked for allegedly gang-raping a minor girl. "We will take stern action...irrespective of who the accused may be," Congress chief spokesperson Randeep Surjewala said.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: BJP responsible for Mufti's 'dialogue with Pakistan' comment: Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut has criticised Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti's demand of BJP holding dialogue with Pakistan if it wants to ensure peace in Kashmir. Raut said BJP was once PDP's "friend" as they were in an alliance and is responsible for Mufti's remarks. PDP has always been "pro-Pakistan" and sympathises with terrorists, Raut alleged.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: BJP's Suvendu demands WB CM's resignation over Birbhum violence
text: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari and party workers on Saturday held a 'padyatra' in violence-hit Birbhum. Adhikari demanded CM Mamata Banerjee's resignation over the violence in which about eight persons, including children, died after miscreants allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village. Adhikari said, "The arrest of murderers won't do, conspirators must be arrested too."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP & RSS spread propaganda, won't accept President's post : Mayawati
text: Bahujan Samaj Party president Mayawati on Sunday alleged that BJP and RSS spread "false propaganda" that she would be made President of the country if BJP won the Uttar Pradesh polls. Mayawati further said that she won't accept an offer for President's post from BJP or any party because it would be the "end" of the BSP party.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jitin Prasada, Swatantra Dev Singh & others take oath as UP cabinet ministers
text: Former Congress leader Jitin Prasada, UP BJP chief Swatantra Dev Singh and 50 others took oath as Uttar Pradesh cabinet ministers on Friday. Ashish Patel of Apna Dal (S), Nishad Party's Sanjay Nishad and former Uttarakhand Governor Baby Rani Maurya also took oath. Prominent ministers in previous regime Shrikant Sharma, Satish Mahana, Ashutosh Tandon and Sidharth Nath Singh were dropped.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Use money earned from 'Kashmir Files' for Kashmiri Pandits: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said the money earned from the Bollywood movie 'The Kashmir Files' should be spent on the welfare of Kashmiri Pandits. "Was a single Kashmiri Pandit family relocated to valley by BJP in last eight yrs? BJP doing politics over the issue," he said. Earlier, Kejriwal suggested the movie must be uploaded on YouTube.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Don't harass anyone's family members: Maha CM to Centre on raids
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Friday criticised the Union government over raids conducted by central agencies and asked it not to "harass family members". His reaction came after ED attached properties of his brother-in-law. "What's the use of exposing all these things...Put me in jail, I am not Krishna but can you say that you are not Kans?" he asked.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Video shows former K'taka CM performing folk dance in village
text: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah was seen performing a folk dance with his childhood friends in his native village in Mysuru on Thursday, a video of which has surfaced on social media. He had gone to his hometown for the annual jaathre or festival. In the clip, onlookers were seen cheering and clapping as the senior Congress leader danced.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Website on untold stories of PM Modi launched, Minister says 'from ordinary boy to PM'
text: A website called 'Modi Story', a volunteer-driven initiative that aims to tell untold stories about PM Narendra Modi, has been launched. Several Union Ministers also tweeted about the website. "From an ordinary boy to becoming the Prime Minister of India, Shri [Narendra Modi] ji's journey is full of events that will inspire all of us," Union Minister Darshana Jardosh tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Akhilesh Yadav to be Leader of Opposition in Uttar Pradesh Assembly
text: Akhilesh Yadav is going to be the Leader of the Opposition in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly. Earlier this week, Yadav had resigned as Lok Sabha MP after winning his first Assembly election from Karhal. The party's newly-elected MLAs unanimously chose Yadav as the leader of SP's legislative party during a meeting on Saturday, state SP chief NU Patel said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: TMC leader named prime conspirator in Birbhum killings, sent to 14-day custody
text: TMC leader Anarul Hossain was remanded to 14-day police custody after police informed a court that he is the prime conspirator behind the killings of eight people in West Bengal's Birbhum earlier this week. The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered a CBI probe into the violence. Hossain was named as the main accused by 21 people arrested so far.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Waited for 2 days but wasn't invited to SP meet: Shivpal Yadav
text: Months after former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav mended ties with estranged uncle Shivpal Yadav, the latter said he wasn't invited to the legislative meeting of Samajwadi Party on Saturday. "I waited for two days and cancelled all my programmes for the meeting, but I wasn't invited. I am an MLA from Samajwadi Party but still (was) not invited," Shivpal said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: I clicked the photo, ANI got credit: Irani on viral pic of Shah, Nadda & PM Modi in UP
text: Sharing a news clipping that featured a picture showing top BJP officials at UP CM Yogi Adityanath's swearing-in ceremony, Union Minister Smriti Irani tweeted, "I took the photo, credit went to ANI." The picture featured PM Narendra Modi, Union Ministers Nitin Gadkari, Amit Shah, Rajnath Singh and BJP's National President JP Nadda. Irani had captioned it as "My family" earlier.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ring bells, beat drums at 11am on March 31 to protest rising fuel prices: Congress
text: Congress has announced a 'Mehngai Mukt Bharat Abhiyan' against the increase in gas, petrol and diesel prices across the country after state elections. "On 31st March at 11 am, Congressmen and people will protest outside their homes and public places with garlanded gas cylinders and beat of drums-bells, other instruments," the party said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Watch in cinemas: Anupam on Kejriwal saying 'Upload Kashmir Files on YouTube'
text: Anupam Kher on Thursday urged people to watch 'The Kashmir Files' in theatres only to understand the pain of Kashmiri Hindus. This comes after Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal criticised BJP for demanding the film be declared tax-free and told them to upload it on YouTube. "But those making fun of this tragedy, make them feel your power," Anupam tweeted.
author: Kriti Kambiri

headlines: UP CM took oath at stadium built by SP: Akhilesh Yadav
text: Samajwadi Party (SP) President Akhilesh Yadav said that Lucknow's Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Stadium, where Yogi Adityanath took oath as the UP CM for the second consecutive term on Friday, was built by SP. Taking to Twitter, the former CM added, "Oath should be taken to serve the people and not just to form the government."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: She's a big actress, did drama: TMC MP as Ganguly breaks down in RS
text: After BJP MP Roopa Ganguly broke down in Rajya Sabha over the Birbhum incident, TMC MP Dola Sen accused her of doing "drama". Sen added, "She started crying as well, we all know she's a big actress, she's shown that while portraying Mahabharat's 'Draupadi'." Ganguly had demanded President's rule in West Bengal over the violence in which eight people died.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: If said with smile, no criminality: Delhi HC on hate speech plea
text: While hearing a plea on alleged hate speeches by Union Minister Anurag Thakur and BJP MP Parvesh Verma, Delhi High Court reserved its judgement and questioned what is communal in the speeches. "If you're saying something with...smile then...no criminality, if you're saying...offensively, then criminality," it said. It added that election speeches are "different" from those given in ordinary times.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Don't use Assembly to rub salt in wound of Hindus: Assam CM to Kejriwal
text: Reacting to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's remark on 'The Kashmir Files' in Delhi Assembly, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "It doesn't behove a CM to use the Assembly to rub salt in wound of Hindus." "If you don't want to make #KashmirFiles tax-free, don't. But stop this constant mocking of Kashmiri Pandits," he said in a tweet.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: They're habitual liars: Joshi on AAP's criticism of MCD unification
text: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Friday termed the Aam Aadmi Party as "habitual liars" amid the party's criticism of the unification of three municipal corporations of Delhi. Joshi said, "Bill has been brought to remove discrepancies due to trifurcation of MCD." Notably, AAP has been criticising BJP after MCD polls were deferred over the unification of the Delhi municipal corporations.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: BJP aims to win over 75 Lok Sabha seats from UP in 2024 polls: Dy CM
text: After taking the oath of office, UP Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya has said that the BJP aims to win over 75 of the 80 Lok Sabha seats from the state in the 2024 polls. The oath-taking ceremony was held on Friday in Lucknow. Notably, BJP had won 62 out of 80 seats in the 2019 Lok Sabha polls.
author: Shailesh

headlines: PM is afraid of the voice of the people of Delhi: Sisodia on MCD unification
text: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia criticised the BJP government over the merger of three municipal corporations in Delhi (MCDs) and said that PM Modi is "afraid of the voice of the people of Delhi". "The PM should be thinking about the position of India amidst the Russia-Ukraine war but he is concerned about the MCD elections," he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Launch a probe: BJP after Maha CM alleges corruption in PCMC
text: BJP leader Namdev Dhake has asked Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to launch an investigation after he alleged corruption in the BJP-ruled Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation. Dhake said, "We are ready for all...scrutiny." Meanwhile, Shiv Sena leader Sulbha Ubale said, "The CM was referring to the corruption in the Pimpri-Chinchwad Smart City Works Ltd, which was set up by the BJP."
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: PM Modi, Shah to visit Karnataka in early April: CM Bommai
text: PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah are scheduled to make official visits to Karnataka in early April, CM Basavaraj Bommai said. Asked if the Cabinet expansion will be discussed during their visit, Bommai said, "The cabinet will not be discussed in Bengaluru." "Whenever the leadership calls me, I will go to Delhi and discuss it," he added.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Threat to Bikram Majithia from Khalistani outfits: Intel reports
text: A letter written by the ADGP (Internal Security) to police authorities claims that fresh intelligence inputs suggest that "pro-Khalistan elements are planning to target Bikram Singh Majithia". The letter further stated that the Akali Dal leader is on the hit list of foreign-based "organizations like BKI (Babbar Khalsa International), KTF (Khalistan Tiger Force), KZF (Khalistan Zindabad Force)".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: EC should announce next election dates: Shiv Sena MP mocks BJP on fuel price
text: Taking a jibe at PM Narendra Modi-led government over hike in fuel prices, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said, the Election Commission should immediately announce the schedule of upcoming state elections. Such an announcement will  automatically move fuel price from "deregulation to regulation mode" and bring relief to Indians hit by soaring prices, she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Will put barricades if coal firms don't pay ₹1.36 lakh cr dues: Soren
text: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday demanded the payment of ₹1.36 lakh crore dues from coal companies, saying that if the payment isn't made then the state will "put barricades around coal mineral resources". He added that the state government will take the dues for sure as it is the state's "right". Soren was addressing the state Assembly Budget Session.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No role of Assembly elections in fuel price rise: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rejected opposition allegations that the government is increasing fuel price as the Assembly elections are over and said "it has nothing to do with election time". The war in Ukraine has impacted all countries by disrupting supply chains, particularly of crude oil, and this is not a time when "we are looking at racing", she added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP paints lotus over artwork in Guj; whitewashes after complaint
text: BJP on Friday whitewashed walls in Gujarat's Rajkot after it painted the party's lotus symbol over artwork done by an NGO at Kisanpara Chowk following a complaint. BJP had painted the symbols as part of a campaign ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections. "I told [authorities] that...BJP's 10-day long drive can undo...hard work of 1,000 artists," an NGO trustee said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Ritu Khanduri becomes first female Speaker of Uttarakhand Assembly
text: BJP MLA Ritu Khanduri Bhushan has become the first woman Speaker of the Uttarakhand Legislative Assembly in the state's 21-year-history. Ritu, who is the daughter of former state Chief Minister BC Khanduri, was elected unopposed. Ritu will be the fifth speaker of the state Assembly and will succeed BJP MLA Premchand Aggarwal.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Adityanath elected BJP's legislative party leader, swearing-in tomorrow
text: Yogi Adityanath was elected as leader of the BJP's legislative party in Uttar Pradesh on Thursday. He will take oath as UP CM for a second straight time on Friday, March 25. Adityanath thanked BJP for believing in him in 2017. About the last five years, he said, "For the first time people realised that UP can be riot free."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Adityanath takes oath as UP CM for 2nd term; PM, Shah attend event
text: BJP leader Yogi Adityanath took oath as Chief Minister of Uttar Pradesh for the second straight term on Friday in Lucknow in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah. With this, Adityanath became the first incumbent UP CM to return to power in nearly 40 years. He was elected as BJP's legislative party leader yesterday.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: 'Kashmir Files' team, PM to attend Adityanath's swearing-in event: Reports
text: PM Narendra Modi, Home Minister Amit Shah, BJP President JP Nadda and CMs of BJP-ruled states will reportedly attend the swearing-in ceremony of Yogi Adityanath in Lucknow's Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium on Friday. An invitation has reportedly been extended to the team of the Bollywood movie 'The Kashmir Files'. Seers have also been reportedly invited.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: We've decided to implement Uniform Civil Code in U'khand: CM Dhami
text: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Thursday said his government has decided to implement the Uniform Civil Code. "The state cabinet unanimously approved that a committee will be constituted at the earliest," he said. UCC calls for the formulation of one law that would be applicable to all religious communities in matters like marriage, divorce, inheritance and adoption.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: KP Maurya and Brajesh Pathak take oath as Deputy CMs of UP
text: BJP leaders Keshav Prasad Maurya and Brajesh Pathak took oath as Deputy Chief Ministers of Uttar Pradesh on Friday in Lucknow's  Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium. Maurya, who was CM Yogi Adityanath's deputy in his first term too, lost the election from Sirathu. Pathak, who switched to BJP from BSP in 2016, has replaced Dinesh Sharma.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Tell Agnihotri to release Kashmir Files on YouTube: Kejriwal on demand to make it tax-free
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri should release 'The Kashmir Files' on YouTube so that it's available to everyone. This comes a day after BJP legislators in the Delhi assembly interrupted the ongoing budget session, demanding that the movie be made tax-free in the state. "Why do you want it to be tax-free?" Kejriwal asked.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Malik's claim of ₹300cr bribe offer for 'clearing Ambani file' to be probed by CBI
text: CBI was granted consent to probe the bribery allegations levelled by former J&K Lieutenant Governor Satya Pal Malik, the current Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said. Malik had alleged that he was offered ₹300 crore for clearing the files related to an "RSS affiliated man" and "Ambani" during his tenure as J&K Governor. "We want everything to be clear," said Sinha.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: We're born to correct arrangements: Lekhi on MCD unification
text: Commenting on the unification of three municipal corporations of Delhi, Union Minister Meenakshi Lekhi on Friday said the current regime has been "born to correct arrangements". "Like we did in Jammu and Kashmir by removing Article 370, we will do the same in Delhi," she said. The bill to unify municipalities was introduced in Lok Sabha today.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: All Muslims & Christians will associate with RSS: K'taka minister
text: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa said in the state Assembly that all Christians and Muslims will associate themselves with the RSS one day. He made the statement during a discussion when Speaker Vishweshwar Hegde Kageri used the term 'Our RSS'. Soon a verbal argument followed and Congress' Siddaramaiah said, "I'll never ever be part of RSS and say its name."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Brown-nosing version of North Korea: Tharoor on ministers invoking PM
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Thursday criticised Union ministers for repeatedly invoking the virtues of PM Narendra Modi in the Parliament. "We are sliding into a brown-nosing version of North Korea," Tharoor said. He has expressed disappointment with the answers and interventions of ministers in the House in the past as well.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Harbhajan, Raghav & 3 other AAP nominees elected to RS unopposed
text: All five nominees of AAP, including former cricketer Harbhajan Singh and former Delhi Assembly MLA Raghav Chadha, were elected to the Rajya Sabha unopposed from Punjab on Thursday. The other three MPs are IIT Delhi Professor Sandeep Pathak, Chancellor of Lovely Professional University Ashok Mittal and founder of Krishna Pran Breast Cancer Care Charitable Trust Sanjiv Arora.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Phone call was made from PMO to defer MCD polls: Delhi CM Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday claimed a phone call was made from Prime Minister Narendra Modi's office to State Election Commissioner to defer MCD polls. "This would not have happened anywhere in the world...The BJP doesn't want elections," he claimed. AAP has been criticising BJP after polls were deferred over the unification of three municipal corporations of Delhi.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Ambani, 60 other tycoons invited to Yogi's swearing-in as UP CM: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani and 60 other business tycoons have been invited to watch Yogi Adityanath take oath as UP's CM for a second time, PTI reported on Thursday. Leading industrialists have been invited as they have a role in boosting the state's economy, former UP BJP chief Laxmikant Bajpai told ANI. Yogi will be sworn in as UP's CM on Friday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who is stopping you now: Sidhu shares old video of Kejriwal on 2015 sacrilege issue
text: While referring to the 2015 Guru Granth Sahib sacrilege incident, Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu asked AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal who is stopping his party's government in Punjab from taking action against those involved. Sidhu shared a video clip from last year, in which Kejriwal is purportedly heard saying that action can be taken against the accused within 24 hours.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train is Centre's vanity project: TMC MP
text: TMC MP Derek O'Brien on Thursday said the Mumbai-Ahmedabad bullet train line is a "vanity project" of the Centre. Accusing the government of not addressing real transportation needs of the common people, O'Brien said, "To make that bullet train, it costs you about ₹200 crore/km. Our priority would have been the dedicated freight corridor for [essential commodities] at ₹25 crore/km."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UP man arrested for posting derogatory remarks against Smriti Irani
text: A man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun on Thursday for allegedly posting derogatory remarks against Union Minister Smriti Irani on social media, police said. The arrest was made after BJP worker Kuldeep Shankhdhar complained on Twitter, Additional Superintendent of Police (Rural) Siddharth Verma said. A case has been registered against him, police said.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Broadest possible front needed to isolate & defeat BJP: Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury on Thursday called for the formation of "broadest possible front of secular forces" to "isolate and defeat" BJP. "We appeal to all the democratic forces, let us keep our differences aside. We can discuss what we want for the country only when this country is saved," he added. BJP is weakening India's institutions, Yechury further alleged.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Mamata has destroyed Bengal: Congress leader on Birbhum killings
text: Reacting to killings in West Bengal's Birbhum, Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said CM Mamata Banerjee has "destroyed" state. "It's a living example of medieval barbarism...Connivance between police and Trinamool Congress (TMC) is looting [Bengal]," Chowdhury, who visited Birbhum on Thursday, added. As many as eight people were burnt to death on Tuesday in violence following a TMC leader's death.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Sonia convenes Cong meeting of general secretaries on March 26
text: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has convened a party meeting of general secretaries and state incharges to discuss organisational polls and the party's membership drive at Congress headquarters in Delhi on Saturday. Party leader KC Venugopal will chair the meeting. Notably, this comes after Gandhi's meeting with some G-23 leaders, who've been demanding an organisational overhaul in Congress.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Rampurhat TMC Block President's arrest 'fake': BJP on Birbhum violence
text: BJP National Vice President Dilip Ghosh termed the arrest of TMC Block President Anarul Hussain in Birbhum violence case as "fake arrest". "So far nothing happened and just after the Chief Minister took someone’s name and he got arrested," said Ghosh. Further, BJP MP Saumitra Khan alleged that TMC Birbhum District President Anubrata Mandal is behind the massacre.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP's Roopa breaks down in RS over Birbhum violence, seeks Prez rule
text: BJP MP Roopa Ganguly on Friday broke down in Rajya Sabha over the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum that left eight people dead and demanded that President's Rule be imposed in the state. "Mass killings are happening there...the state is no more liveable," she said. Later, she also spoke about her breakdown, adding, "We don't do stone-hearted politics."
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: BJP MLA opposes move to rename Naigaon chawl in Maharashtra after Sharad Pawar
text: BJP MLA Kalidas Kolambkar has opposed the proposal to rename Maharashtra's Naigaon chawl after the NCP chief Sharad Pawar. "I respect Sharad Pawar but...renaming any place in the name of people who are alive is not right," said Kolambkar. The decision to rename was announced in the assembly by the state Housing Minister Jitendra Awhad.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: PM Modi doesn't care about people, workers, COVID-19 patients: Rahul
text: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said that PM Narendra Modi does not care about people, workers or COVID-19 patients. In a tweet, Gandhi cited news reports that claimed that India saw a surge in suicide cases in the last two years and that COVID-19 patients did not receive free treatment under the government's 'Ayushman Bharat Yojana'.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: WB in a state of anarchy, people living in terror: BJP leader
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Thursday said that West Bengal is in a state of anarchy, adding that the people of the state are living in an atmosphere of terror. He also said that the killings (Birbhum violence) are happening "under the aegis of the government" and that the dissidents are either "manhandled or murdered in the state".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Punjab CM meets PM Modi, seeks financial package of ₹1 lakh cr
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann met PM Narendra Modi for the first time on Thursday since taking the oath as CM and sought a special financial package for the state worth ₹1 lakh crore. The CM said that Punjab's financial condition is in "doldrums" and that he's demanded ₹50,000 crore per year for two years to make the state "self-reliant".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: WB Guv threat to parliamentary democracy: TMC MPs demand removal
text: Trinamool Congress (TMC) MPs met Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday and demanded the removal of West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar, calling him a "threat to the parliamentary democratic system". TMC also asserted that the Bengal Police will not spare anyone involved in Birbhum violence and will make arrests at the quickest possible time.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Senior Congress leader Thalekkunnil Basheer dies at 77
text: Senior Kerala Congress leader and former MP Thalekkunnil Basheer passed away aged 77 in Thiruvananthapuram on Friday. Basheer had served as a member of Rajya Sabha from 1977 to 1984 and then in Lok Sabha for two terms from 1984 to 1991. A law graduate, Basheer also authored several books in Malayalam, including travelogues.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Mamata orders police to arrest TMC leader over Birbhum killings
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday ordered police to arrest Trinamool Congress leader Anarul Hossain, in connection with the violence in Birbhum district that left eight people dead. "TMC Block President Anarul will be arrested or he'll surrender," she said. Subsequently, he was arrested. Banerjee said she was dissatisfied with the action taken by SDPO and the inspector in-charge.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Centre to help punish Birbhum culprits, don't forgive supporters of violence: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke on the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum and assured that the Centre will help the state government in punishing the criminals at the earliest. "I would also urge the people of Bengal to never forgive the perpetrators of such incidents and those who encourage such criminals," he added. Eight people died in the incident.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: TRS MLC & KCR's daughter Kavitha-led leaders protest LPG price hike, cook on road
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao's daughter and TRS MLC Kavitha Kalvakuntla and other party leaders staged a protest in Hyderabad against fuel and LPG gas price hike. TRS workers were seen cooking food at the protest site. Domestic cooking gas prices were increased by ₹50, while fuel prices were hiked by over 80 paise for second consecutive day on Wednesday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: All 3 MLAs of Bihar minister Mukesh Sahani-led VIP party quit, join BJP
text: All three MLAs elected on the ticket of Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP), led by Minister for Animal Husbandry and Fisheries Mukesh Sahani in Bihar, quit the party and joined BJP. The three MLAs, Raju Kumar Singh, Mishri Lal Yadav and Swarna Singh, met Bihar Assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Sinha on Wednesday evening informing him that they wished to join BJP.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: There's a big conspiracy: Mamata as she visits violence-hit Birbhum
text: Facing criticism from Opposition over the deaths of eight people in Birbhum, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said, "There is a big conspiracy. Police will do an impartial investigation (and) take stringent actions." Banerjee, who visited the village and met affected families, added, "I want people responsible to be arrested and policemen to be punished for lapses."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Man asks Kapil 'Are you buttering Punjab CM for RS seat?'; comedian responds
text: Comedian Kapil Sharma responded to a man who tweeted to him, "Are you also buttering him (Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann) up for a Rajya Sabha seat like Harbhajan?" Sharma responded, "Not at all...my dream is that the country should progress. If you want, I can ask for a job for you." Earlier, Sharma lauded Punjab CM for launching anti-corruption helpline.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: AAP will leave politics if BJP gets MCD polls held timely & wins: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said AAP will quit politics if BJP gets civic body polls conducted timely and wins them. "I dare BJP to conduct elections on time and win," Kejriwal said. The State Election Commission had postponed the announcement of dates for the poll after a communication from the Centre on the unification of the civic bodies.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: You should come and meet mother once: Sister to Yogi Adityanath
text: Shashi Singh, the sister of Uttar Pradesh CM-designate Yogi Adityanath, in a recent interview with a news channel said he should come and meet their mother once. When asked whether she believes Adityanath should have become Uttarakhand's CM, she replied, "If he would have been Uttarakhand's CM, the state would have developed a lot." Shashi lives in Uttarakhand.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Punjab CM meets PM Modi, seeks his support for national security
text: Newly-appointed Punjab CM and AAP leader Bhagwant Mann on Thursday met PM Narendra Modi in Delhi and sought his support for national security. "PM Modi gave his assurance," Mann said. Mann added that PM Modi congratulated him for winning Assembly elections and extended wishes for his good health. Mann is expected to meet Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal later today.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Why did Nehru take Kashmir issue to UN, we could've handled it: FM
text: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticised India's first PM, Jawaharlal Nehru, for taking Kashmir issue to United Nations in 1947. "It was our first PM...who internationalised the Kashmir issue...Why...This issue shouldn't have gone to a global forum...We could've handled it," she said in Rajya Sabha. Referring to Pakistan, she said, "Till today, our neighbours are misusing (this) move."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Our MLAs helped BJP become number 1 party of Bihar: VIP party chief
text: Soon after three MLAs of Vikassheel Insaan Party quit and joined BJP, the party chief Mukesh Sahani said, "My good wishes are with those three MLAs who were with us till yesterday." "Our three MLAs [helped BJP become] number one party of Bihar, I congratulate them," he added. "I knew that anything can happen in this fight," Sahani further added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Assam, Meghalaya agreed to settle boundary issues in 6 areas: MHA
text: The Chief Ministers of Assam and Meghalaya have agreed to permanent settlement of the inter-state boundary in six of the 12 areas of difference, said the Centre in Parliament. "Discussions have been going on at various levels between the states of Assam and Meghalaya to arrive at an amicable solution to the border issue," said MoS Home Nityanand Rai.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Congress responsible for Kashmiri Pandits exodus, partition: Anil Vij
text: Haryana Minister Anil Vij on Wednesday said that the Congress doctrine is responsible for the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits and also for the partition of India on communal lines. He further alleged that Congress was responsible for the "1984 Sikh riots, the mysterious death of Subhas Chandra Bose, Lal Bahadur Shastri and more such incidents".
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Mamata announces ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for 8 killed in Birbhum violence
text: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday announced ₹5 lakh compensation for families of each of the eight people who were killed in violence in Birbhum. On her visit to the district, she said a financial aid of ₹2 lakh will be given to rebuild homes burnt down in the incident. Mamata also promised government jobs to the affected families.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Upcoming decade will be U'khand's, we're determined to make it so: Dhami
text: After taking oath as Uttarakhand CM for the second term, Pushkar Singh Dhami said the upcoming decade will be Uttarakhand's. "The upcoming decade will be Uttarakhand's and we are determined to make it so...We'll start working from today for the development of our state," Dhami added. He had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Lalu Yadav re-admitted to Delhi AIIMS hospital to undergo treatment
text: Former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav has been re-admitted to Delhi's AIIMS and is said to be undergoing treatment. His son and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav said in a statement, "His creatinine level was 4.5 when he was in Ranchi. It increased to 5.1 when it was tested in Delhi...[and] reached 5.9 when tested again. So the infection is increasing."
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: PM Modi meets BJP MPs from Bihar, Jharkhand over breakfast
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday met BJP MPs from Bihar and Jharkhand over breakfast. Bihar MP Pradeep Singh said, "The meeting was a short one and it was just a courtesy call." "We had breakfast there and clicked a group photo," he said, adding that PM Modi spoke about the impact of BJP's recent victory in four states.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: This sacrifice is necessary: Akhilesh on quitting as Lok Sabha MP
text: A day after quitting as MP after winning his first Assembly poll from UP's Karhal, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on Wednesday said, "This sacrifice is necessary for the struggle against inflation, unemployment and social injustice." The former UP CM said he will represent Karhal and always remain committed to the progress of Azamgarh. He represented Azamgarh in the Lok Sabha.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: NPP extends support to N Biren Singh-led BJP govt in Manipur
text: The National People's Party (NPP) has extended support to CM N Biren Singh-led BJP government in Manipur. Seven NPP MLAs submitted a letter of support to the Governor. Notably, NPP was part of the previous coalition government led by the BJP. In the recently concluded elections, BJP bagged a majority of 32 seats out of 60, while NPP managed seven.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: We feel Kashmiri Pandits' pain but you can't hate Kashmiri Muslims: Mufti
text: Jammu and Kashmir Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chief Mehbooba Mufti said that what happened with Kashmiri Pandits was horrible. "I have not seen 'The Kashmir Files'...have heard that...it shows a lot of violence and bloodshed and that it has painful scenes...We feel their pain. But you cannot hate every Kashmiri Muslim (for the exodus of Pandits)," Mufti added.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Remember promise of quitting politics after Delhi MCD polls: BJP MP
text: BJP's West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh told Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal to not go back on his word about quitting politics post MCD polls in the city. "I challenge the BJP, if you have courage in you, get the MCD elections held immediately. If you win, we will leave politics there and then," Kejriwal had said on Wednesday.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PM believes short-term gain will lead to long-term pain: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi does not believe in short-term gains and believes it will lead to long-term pain. "We have seen instances...when wrong decisions were taken for short term benefits," Goyal said, adding, "In 2008, when there was global economic crisis...decisions taken during that time took our economy 5-6 years behind."
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: After Birbhum violence, TMC asks Amit Shah to remove Bengal Guv
text: Days after violence erupted in West Bengal's Birbhum, a TMC delegation on Thursday met Home Minister Amit Shah and asked Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar to be removed. "We've said that Governor of West Bengal should be removed in view of the Rampurhat, Birbhum incident. His work is against our constitutional system. Parliamentary democratic system is under threat," said MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Now that elections are over, inflation is back: Raut on fuel price rise
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut criticised the Centre over the rise in fuel prices in the country and said, "Fuel prices are rising...now that the elections are over, inflation is back." "The real issue is not the war between Russia and Ukraine or the movie 'The Kashmir Files' or hijab, it's inflation and unemployment," Raut further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BJP MLAs marshalled out of Delhi Assembly over installation of tricolour
text: Two BJP MLAs were marshalled out of the Delhi Assembly on Thursday after Aam Aadmi Party legislator Somnath Bharti alleged that the BJP and RSS were opposing the installation of a tricolour in his constituency. BJP MLA from Rohtash Nagar, Jitender Mahajan said that Aam Aadmi Party members were part of the “tukde tukde gang”.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: RJD MLAs protest over deaths due to consumption of illicit liquor in Bihar
text: RJD MLAs staged a protest against the state government outside the state Assembly in Patna over deaths allegedly due to the consumption of illicit liquor in Bihar, on Wednesday. "The government is not able to see anything. Several people have died. What type of liquor ban it is?" RJD MLA, Mukesh Raushan, said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Over 1.41 lakh projects started in last 2.5 years in J&K: Centre
text: More than 1.41 lakh (1,41,815) new projects have started across various sectors in Jammu and Kashmir in the last 2.5 years since the abrogation of Article 370, said the Centre in Parliament. MoS Home Nityanand Rai further said that tap water connections have increased from 5.75 lakh to 10.55 lakh households.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: MP IAS officer to get notice over tweets on 'The Kashmir Files'
text: The Madhya Pradesh government will issue a show-cause notice to IAS officer Niyaz Khan over his tweets on 'The Kashmir Files' movie, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. Khan had asked the producer to make a movie on the killings of Muslims across several states. "He is crossing and violating the 'lakshman rekha' set for officials," Mishra said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Pushkar Singh Dhami sworn in as Uttarakhand Chief Minister for 2nd term
text: BJP leader Pushkar Singh Dhami on Wednesday took oath as the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand in Dehradun. This is Dhami's second term as the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand. He had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021. Notably, Dhami had lost the Khatima seat to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri in the recently held Assembly elections in the state.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Don't make unwarranted statements: Mamata on Guv's 'arson orgy' remark
text: After Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar described the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum as 'arson orgy', CM Mamata Banerjee wrote to him asking him to refrain from making unwarranted statements.
