Banerjee said Dhankar's statements were unbecoming of a person holding a constitutional post and asked him to allow the administration to conduct an impartial probe. Eight people died in the violence.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Uproar in Raj Assembly as Sec 144 imposed in Kota over 'Kashmir Files'
text: Rajasthan Assembly witnessed an uproar on Tuesday after Section 144 was imposed in Kota till April 21 in view of 'The Kashmir Files' screening. "What kind of an order has been issued...Is the...administration incapable to handle law and order?" asked BJP MLA Sandeep Sharma. Several BJP MLAs supported the issue. The administration clarified there's no ban on watching the film.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Vikramaditya Singh, grandson of J&K's Maharaja Hari Singh, quits Cong
text: Former J&K MLC Vikramaditya Singh, the grandson of J&K's Maharaja Hari Singh and son of Congress veteran leader Karan Singh, resigned from Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter to interim party chief Sonia Gandhi, he wrote, "It's my belief that the Congress is unable to realise and reflect the sentiments and aspirations of the people of Jammu and Kashmir."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Not justifying Birbhum killings but such incidents common in UP, MP: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday said she isn't justifying the incident in Birbhum, where eight people were killed after houses were set on fire, but added that such incidents are more frequent in UP, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar and Rajasthan. "Action will be taken against perpetrators of violence in Birbhum, irrespective of their political colours," she added.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Gadkari explains how cost of building Majuli bridge was cut from ₹6,000 cr to ₹680 cr
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari told Parliament he was forced to announce the construction of Majuli bridge by ex-Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal. He said he was discouraged after officials told him it would cost ₹6,000 crore. He said new technology was brought from Singapore and Malaysia which increased gap between beams from 30 to 120 metres, reducing cost to ₹680 crore.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Maha CM's brother-in-law raided by ED, properties worth ₹6 cr frozen
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday provisionally attached immovable properties, worth over ₹6 crore, allegedly linked to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law Shridhar Madhav Patankar. The properties include 11 residential flats. ED is probing a money laundering case against Pushpak Bullion and found that illegal funds were allegedly diverted to Patankar's company.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Mayawati demands President's rule in Rajasthan over atrocities on Dalits
text: BSP chief Mayawati has demanded the imposition of President's rule in Rajasthan alleging that the incidents of atrocities on Dalits and Adivasis (tribals) have increased in the state. "Congress has failed...in protecting Dalits and Adivasis," she added. "Recently, the rape of Dalit girls in Didwana and Dholpur...the murder of a Dalit youth in Jodhpur has shaken Dalit samaj," Mayawati tweeted.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 11 arrested after 8 killed as houses set on fire in WB's Birbhum
text: Eleven people have been arrested after eight persons, including two children, died in West Bengal's Birbhum district as nearly 10-12 houses were set ablaze. The incident happened hours after deputy gram pradhan of the Trinamool Congress was killed in a bomb attack on Monday night. "We are investigating...whether the incident is related to death of Trinamool panchayat leader," police said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Video shows Farooq lashing out at media when asked about Kashmiri Pandits
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and National Conference veteran Farooq Abdullah was seen in a video lashing out at reporters in Parliament premises on Tuesday when asked about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. "You (BJP) want to know the truth, you should appoint a commission," he said. When asked another question, he replied, "Don't push me."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: BSP's votes shifted to BJP: SP leader on UP Assembly poll results
text: Reacting to the results of UP Assembly elections, Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Imran Masood alleged that the BJP benefitted from the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP). "It is a 100% fact that the BSP's votes transferred to the BJP," he said. Masood, who resigned from Congress to join SP before the polls, added that elections should be conducted using ballot papers.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: People feared going out post-sunset, now even girls move: Nitish on his govt
text: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar said people were afraid of venturing out of their homes after sunset before his government came into power. "And look at the change that has come. Even girls move around without fear," he added. He further said President Kovind and Prime Minister Modi extending greetings on Bihar Diwas proves people of state are making mark.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Vajpayee's worst fears came true: Mahua Moitra on 'Modi' chants in Parliament
text: After chants of 'Modi, Modi' were made in Parliament by BJP members, TMC MP Mahua Moitra on Tuesday said that former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's worst fears have come true. She quoted Vajpayee saying, "The chanting of a PM's name on All India Radio from morning to night, saturated propaganda on cinema screens, how can Opposition fight this?"
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Rajya Sabha adjourned till noon amid Opposition ruckus over fuel price hike
text: The Rajya Sabha was adjourned till noon on Wednesday following a ruckus by the Opposition parties against the rising cooking gas and fuel prices in India. This was the second consecutive day when the House faced similar protest leading to adjournment. The House was adjourned twice on Tuesday in the first half of the day over rising prices of fuel.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Innocent people being killed, failure of law & order in WB: BJP's Arjun Singh
text: Condemning the violence in Birbhum in which eight people died, BJP leader Arjun Singh said that there is a failure of law and order in West Bengal. "Innocent people are being killed. Even the police do not help the people in the state," Singh added. "CM Mamata Banerjee should immediately resign. CBI enquiry should be done," Singh stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: I'm slave of Nehru-Gandhi family, will remain one till death: Raj MLA
text: Rajasthan MLA Sanyam Lodha on Tuesday described himself as a "slave" of the Nehru-Gandhi family, adding that he'll remain one until his death. "We'll keep doing slavery of the Gandhi-Nehru family as [they]...led the development in [India]," he added. Lodha, who is an independent MLA from Sirohi, made the statement in state Assembly in response to a BJP legislator's remark.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Sonia holds talks with Congress' rebel leaders at her residence
text: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday held discussions with some rebel party leaders, also known as G-23, at her residence in Delhi. The party leaders included Anand Sharma and Manish Tewari. Gandhi is likely to meet some other leaders of the group in the coming days. The G-23 leaders have been demanding an organisational overhaul.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Form panel to know truth behind exodus of Kashmiri Pandits: Abdullah
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said that the BJP-led Centre should appoint a commission to know the truth behind the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. Abdullah had previously alleged that 'The Kashmir Files' was far from reality and nothing but "pure propaganda" to polarise the nation.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Kashmiri Muslims suffered 50 times more than Pandits: Sajad Lone
text: Calling 'The Kashmir Files' a work of fiction, J&K People's Conference President Sajad Lone said the Kashmiri Muslims have suffered 50 times more than the Kashmiri Pandits. "You cannot document the pain of just one community. We are all in it together," Lone added. He further stated that the Kashmiri Muslims were as helpless as the Kashmiri Pandits in 1990s.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Over 200 BJP workers killed so far in West Bengal: Dilip Ghosh
text: BJP's Dilip Ghosh condemned the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum in which eight persons died as nearly 10-12 houses were set ablaze. "We are ashamed that such an incident took place in West Bengal...More than 200 BJP workers have been killed so far in the state. What is the government doing? This can't be tolerated," Ghosh said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Dhami visits Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple ahead of taking oath as U'khand CM
text: BJP's Pushkar Singh Dhami offered prayers at the Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple on Wednesday in Dehradun before taking oath as the CM of Uttarakhand. "I will be taking the oath today. People of the state have given us 2/3rd majority and today our government is officially going to be formed," Dhami said.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: I challenge BJP to conduct MCD polls on time: Kejriwal
text: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday reacted to the "postponement" of municipal elections saying everyone knows BJP will be wiped out in the MCD polls. "I challenge them to conduct MCD polls on time," Kejriwal added. "If due to fear of losing minuscule MCD polls, BJP will postpone elections then it'll muzzle people's voices," Kejriwal stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Congress kept nation safe, BJP wants to divide: Mehbooba Mufti
text: Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday accused the BJP of "wanting to divide the nation" and "make many Pakistans" while saying that Congress kept the nation safe during its rule. She further said BJP wants the fight with Pakistan to prevail while addressing a public meeting. "My father's uncles...cousins were killed. We want...violence to stop," she added.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: AAP is not yet born in Himachal, our competition is with BJP: Cong
text: Himachal Pradesh Congress leaders met the party President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday and discussed over strengthening the party in the state. On the upcoming Assembly election in Himachal Pradesh, the leaders said, "AAP is not yet born in the state...Our competition is with BJP." Notably, AAP had said that it'll contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh elections.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Watching 'Kashmir Files' more important for BJP MLAs than attending Assembly: Maha Min
text: Maharashtra Minister Jayant Patil alleged that the BJP MLAs attended screening of 'The Kashmir Files' film while the Assembly was discussing matters during its Budget session. Referring to the absent MLAs, he said, "The Kashmir Files was more important and the issues concerning the state's development are not." According to Patil, only two opposition MLAs attended the discussion in Assembly.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Niece attacked, would've killed 2-5 attackers if it were me: Ex-Bihar CM
text: Former Chief Minister of Bihar Jitan Ram Manjhi said that his niece Kesari Devi and her family members were attacked by 25 people including "strongmen". "If such an incident would've happened with me I would open fire on them," Manjhi said. He added that he would have killed at least two to five attackers.
author: Ria Kapoor

headlines: Akhilesh quits as Lok Sabha MP after winning 1st Assembly poll
text: Former Uttar Pradesh CM and Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav has resigned as Lok Sabha MP, days after he won his first Assembly poll from Karhal in UP. He had won from Azamgarh Lok Sabha constituency in the 2019 election. With 1,48,196 votes, he defeated his closest rival from BJP, Prof SP Singh Baghel, in Karhal.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Lalu suffering from heart & kidney issues, to be shifted to AIIMS Delhi: Doctor
text: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is hospitalised in Jharkhand's Ranchi, would be shifted to AIIMS Delhi as he is facing heart and kidney-related issues, a doctor said. Lalu has been sentenced to five years in prison by a special CBI court in connection with the fifth fodder scam case. He has previously been convicted in four fodder scam cases.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Govt made 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free to spread hatred: Former J&K CM
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said the central government wants to "further spread hatred in people's hearts" by making the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free. "They (government) are saying that every policeman and soldier...should see this movie, so that they hate us to the extreme," he added. "It is a propaganda movie," Abdullah further said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Pushkar Singh Dhami to take oath as U'khand CM for 2nd time tomorrow
text: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami will take oath as the Chief Minister for the second time in Dehradun on Wednesday. The ceremony will be held at 3.30 pm at the Parade Ground. Dhami, who lost from the Khatima seat in the Assembly polls, was elected leader of the BJP legislature party in Uttarakhand on Monday.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Opposition walks out of Lok Sabha over fuel, cooking gas price hike
text: Members of the opposition parties staged a protest in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday against the rise in prices of petrol, diesel and domestic cooking gas. They then staged a walkout demanding a rollback. Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked by 80 paise a litre and domestic cooking gas prices have been increased by ₹50 per cylinder.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: TMC panchayat leader killed in bomb attack in West Bengal's Birbhum
text: Bhadu Sheikh, a TMC panchayat leader of Barshal village in the Rampurhat area of West Bengal's Birbhum, was killed in an alleged bomb attack on Monday evening, police said. According to witnesses, the victim was attacked by four men on motorcycles, who had their faces covered. The incident took place days after two councillors were shot dead in the state.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Working with Prashant on bringing change in country: T'gana CM KCR
text: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Monday said that he's working with political strategist Prashant Kishor on bringing a "parivartan (change)" in the entire country. He called Kishor his "best friend" for the last seven and a half years, adding that he isn't a paid worker. "There's a vacuum in national politics. I'm pursuing national politics now," he further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No evidence my fist blow killed the man: Sidhu to SC in 1988 road rage case
text: Navjot Singh Sidhu has told Supreme Court there is no conclusive evidence to show his single fist blow led to the death of a 65-year-old man in a 1988 road rage case. He said it while opposing a plea by the victim's family to punish him for a more serious offence like culpable homicide or murder, than for causing hurt.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Will run govt transparently, make U'khand best state of India: Dhami
text: Uttarakhand CM-designate Pushkar Singh Dhami said on Tuesday that he'll ensure his administration's work reaches people at the grassroots. "We will run our government in complete transparency and make Uttarakhand the best out of all the states in the country," Dhami added. Dhami, who lost from Khatima Assembly constituency, will take oath as CM for a second term on Wednesday.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: There will be daily 'vikas' in petrol & diesel prices: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge said that by increasing fuel prices the PM Modi-led government is making money worth ₹10,000 crores by plundering the poor. Taking to Twitter, he said, "Congratulations to PM Modiji for achieving his 'target' of ₹1,000 per LPG cylinder...There will now be daily 'vikas' in petrol and diesel prices as well."
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: ED searches premises linked to Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday searched premises linked to Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla. ED had arrested Malik in a money-laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides on February 23. On Monday, a special court extended Malik's judicial custody till April 4 and allowed him to be provided with a mattress, bed and chair.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Congress unaffected by victory or defeat: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that Congress is "not affected by victory or defeat" in elections. Kharge said, in context to the party's debacle in the recent five state assembly elections, that the Congress "doesn't engage in vote-bank politics and also, doesn't abandon its core ideology". He further accused BJP of being a "dictatorial party".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Parliamentary panel examining raising marriageable age for women gets 3-month extension
text: The Parliamentary Standing Committee examining the proposed increase in legal age of marriage for women to 21 years has been granted a three-month extension by Rajya Sabha Chairman Venkaiah Naidu. The panel was expected to submit its findings on the Prohibition of Child Marriage (Amendment) Bill by March 24. Now it has to submit its report by June 24.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: CM Yogi resigns as MLC ahead of oath-taking ceremony on March 25
text: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has tendered his resignation from the UP Legislative Council days after getting elected as an MLA from the Gorakhpur Urban constituency. CM Yogi was elected to the UP Legislative Council soon after becoming the state's CM in 2017. The 49-year-old politician is likely to take oath as CM again during the ceremony on March 25.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Shiv Sena will always remain a Hindutva party: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that his party was a "Hindutva party" and will always remain the same. "The question of political ideology should be asked to BJP when they formed government with Mehbooba Mufti in Kashmir, where did their political ideology go?" he added. Earlier, Raut had said that BJP is doing politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RSS is similar to Jinnah, both divide people: Assam AIUDF MLA
text: An All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) MLA from Assam, Rafiqul Islam, has equated RSS to Pakistan's founder Muhammad Ali Jinnah. "Jinnah divided the country into two parts - India and Pakistan...BJP and RSS are also doing the same thing, and they are dividing Hindu and Muslim, Dalits and non-Dalits," the MLA from Jania constituency said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: PM Modi-led govt not at all reluctant to loot poor: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
text: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury on Tuesday said that PM Narendra Modi-led government is not at all reluctant to "loot" the poor. "We said that there'll be an exorbitant rise in fuel prices post the Assembly elections, we have been proven right," Chowdhury added. "We'll stand against this for common people both outside and inside the Lok Sabha," Chowdhury stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: HP University VC files nomination as BJP candidate for Rajya Sabha poll
text: Himachal Pradesh University vice-chancellor Sikander Kumar on Monday filed his nomination as BJP candidate for election to the lone vacant seat in Rajya Sabha from the state. The election has been necessitated as Congress MP Anand Sharma will complete his term on April 2. Notably, two of the three Rajya Sabha seats from the state are occupied by BJP.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: AAP names office-bearers for 9 states, aims to 'expand footprint'
text: AAP has announced office-bearers for nine states including Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh where elections are due later this year. AAP released the names by posting, "We are all set to increase our footprint throughout India!" AAP's Rajya Sabha nominee Sandeep Pathak has been appointed as incharge of Gujarat and also, he will be replacing Raghav Chadha as co-incharge of Punjab.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Fresh notices sent to Sonia, Rahul, Kapil Mishra in Delhi riots case
text: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued fresh notices to several political leaders, including Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi and BJP's Kapil Mishra, while hearing pleas in connection with Delhi riots cases and alleged hate speeches by political leaders. The court sought a response from them on the application which freshly impleaded them as a party in the case.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: UP's ex-minister Swati Singh moves plea to divorce legislator husband
text: Ex-Minister in the previous Yogi Adityanath's government, Swati Singh, has moved application seeking divorce from her husband. Swati was denied party ticket in the recently concluded UP Assembly polls while her husband Dayashankar Singh had contested as BJP candidate from Balia seat and won. Earlier, Swati alleged that Dayashankar has been conspiring against her to obtain party ticket for himself.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Lockdown imposed on fuel prices lifted: Rahul Gandhi mocks PM Modi
text: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi-led government over hike in fuel prices. "The lockdown imposed on gas, diesel and petrol prices has been lifted. The government will now regularly do 'vikas' (development) in prices," tweeted Gandhi. "If PM is questioned about the inflation epidemic, he would say 'Thali Bajao' (bang plates)," he added.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: T'gana BJP MP slams CM KCR for politicising paddy procurement
text: After Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao demanded that the Centre buy the entire paddy crop produced in the state, BJP MP D Arvind slammed the former for politicising paddy procurement. "The TRS government has to give around 5,00,000 tonnes of paddy to the Centre, but they're not doing that...instead, Telangana government is black marketing it," the Nizamabad MP added.
author: Shiwangi

headlines: Akhilesh repeatedly said fuel prices will rise after polls: Jaya
text: After fuel prices were raised for the first time in over four months, SP MP Jaya Bachchan on Tuesday said, "This is how the government does." She added that party chief Akhilesh Yadav had "repeatedly" said that people should be alert as "price is going to increase after the elections". "Don't know who brought [BJP] to power," she further said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: AAP's Sanjay Singh asks party workers to prepare for UP civic polls
text: AAP on Sunday decided to contest the forthcoming civic polls in UP and also make changes in the party's organisational structure. Presiding over a two-day meeting of AAP state executive, the party's state in-charge Sanjay Singh told party workers to start preparing for the UP civic polls. Singh stated that AAP had emerged as an alternative to other national parties.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: No plans to make Tripura dry state, no proof that prohibition works: Govt
text: There are no plans to make Tripura a dry state, said Deputy Chief Minister Jishnu Dev Varma on Monday. "There is no scientific evidence that substantiates the claim that a ban on alcohol sales would reduce consumption," he added. The minister said the government is acting against illegal brewers, dealers and stockists of alcohol across the state.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: New batteries for Delhi remote control: Sidhu on AAP's RS nominee choices
text: Taking a jibe at Aam Aadmi Party's Rajya Sabha nominee choices, Congress leader Navjot Sidhu said, "New batteries for the Delhi remote control, it's blinking... Harbhajan is an exception, the rest are batteries and betrayal of Punjab." Earlier, the AAP party rivals had claimed that Arvind Kejriwal intends to "control" the new Punjab government from the national capital.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Pramod Sawant to continue as Goa Chief Minister for 2nd term
text: Goa's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has been chosen as the CM of the state for a second term, days after BJP won 20 seats in the 40-member Goa assembly. Notably, this will be the third straight term of the BJP in Goa. Reports suggest that the swearing-in ceremony of the new government will tentatively take place between March 23-25.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pushkar Singh Dhami named as Uttarakhand CM
text: Uttarakhand's caretaker CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has been chosen as the new state CM after BJP won 47 seats in the 70-member Assembly in the recently-concluded elections. Dhami had lost the Khatima seat to Congress candidate Bhuwan Chandra Kapri, who won by a margin of over 6,500 votes. Dhami had earlier taken charge as CM in July 2021.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I will only help those who voted for me: UP BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat
text: BJP MLA Dinesh Rawat, who won from Uttar Pradesh's Haidergarh constituency, said, "These people should not come to me for any kind of help. I will help only those who have voted for me." Rawat said this while addressing a gathering on Holi and it came to light when a video of the event surfaced online.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: N Biren Singh takes oath as Manipur CM; 5 MLAs sworn in as Cabinet ministers
text: N Biren Singh on Monday took oath as the Chief Minister of Manipur, for the second term. Singh was administered the oath of office by Manipur Governor La Ganesan at Raj Bhavan in Imphal. Five MLAs, including Nemcha Kipgen, Yumnam Khemchand Singh, Thongam Biswajit Singh, Awangbou Newmai and Govindas Konthoujam, were also sworn in as Cabinet ministers of the state.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Hope wisdom prevails in future: Tharoor as Sonia denies permission for CPI(M) event
text: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he pulled out of a CPI(M) event after party chief Sonia Gandhi denied him permission to attend it. Stressing on the need to follow procedures in such issues, Tharoor said, "I regret that some preferred the unseemly airing of internal differences, thereby creating a needless controversy...I hope wisdom will prevail in the future."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Akhilesh alleges irregularities in vote counting during UP polls
text: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that there were irregularities in counting of votes during the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls. He said that the SP candidate from Varanasi South was leading till 20 rounds of counting. However, counting of votes was suddenly stopped and some time later, BJP's Neelkanth Tiwari, a minister, was declared the winner, he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Channi meets Punjab CM Mann in 1st meeting since Assembly polls
text: Former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi met and congratulated the state's new CM Bhagwant Mann in Chandigarh on Monday. This is Channi's first meeting with CM Bhagwant Mann after the Assembly election results were announced on March 10. Channi lost the elections from both Assembly seats of Bhadaur and Chamkaur Sahib, where he had contested from.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: WB introduces new govt school uniform with 'Biswa Bangla' logo
text: The TMC-led West Bengal government has introduced a common blue-and-white uniform featuring the 'Biswa Bangla' logo in all state-run schools. According to the notification, the Department of MSME and Textiles will be supplying the new uniforms. However, the move has garnered some criticism with a lawyer filing public interest litigation in Calcutta High Court against the use of the logo.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Loyalty must be considered while naming Punjab Cong chief: Bajwa
text: Punjab Congress leader Pratap Singh Bajwa on Monday said that the appointment of the next state party chief should be based on loyalty, seniority and capability. "I leave everything to the party's high command, three factors need to be looked after," he added. Bajwa submitted his resignation as a Rajya Sabha member after being elected to the Punjab Assembly.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP announces 6 more names, completes list for all 36 UP MLC seats
text: After announcing candidates on 30 seats, BJP has now announced candidates on six more seats for the upcoming UP Legislative Council elections in which 36 MLC seats will be contested. The BJP's list comprises of several defectors including those from BSP, SP and Congress. Currently, BJP has 35 MLCs while SP has 17 MLCs in the 100-member UP Legislative Council.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Doesn't matter if 32 or 50 people die after having spurious liquor In Bihar: JDU MLA
text: Janata Dal (United) MLA Gopal Mandal said, "It doesn’t matter if 32 people die or 50 after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar." Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has closed all liquor shops in the state long ago, Mandal added. "Senior police officers are connected to liquors smugglers for their personal benefits," Mandal stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Abhishek being harassed by Centre: TMC as ED questions him
text: After TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was questioned by Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case linked to Bengal coal scam on Monday, party spokesperson Kunal Ghosh claimed Banerjee is being harassed by the union government. BJP is controlling agencies like CBI and ED, Ghosh said. He also asked why BJP's Suvendu Adhikari wasn't questioned in cases he was named in.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Uttarakhand will make rapid progress under Dhami: Rajnath Singh
text: Defence Minister and senior BJP leader Rajnath Singh congratulated Pushkar Singh Dhami on being chosen as Uttarakhand Chief Minister on Monday. While talking to media outside the party's office in Dehradun, he said, "I'm confident that under his leadership Uttarakhand will make rapid progress." Dhami will be taking over the reins of the state for the second time.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: Manipur CM lists govt's 3 priorities after taking oath for 2nd term
text: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Monday listed his government's three priorities after taking oath for his second consecutive term as Chief Minister. He said his government's "primary duty [is to] wash out corruption from the state". He added that his second and third priorities are to "wash out any kind of drug-related matter" and bring "insurgents...to the negotiating table".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UP among 3 poorest states as per NITI Aayog’s ranking: Akhilesh
text: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said under the BJP government, Uttar Pradesh is among the three poorest states in India as per NITI Aayog's multidimensional poverty index. "[UP] ranks third in terms of malnutrition rate," Yadav said. Adding that UP ranks last in the child and adolescent mortality rate category, he said, "These are the badges of failure of BJP government."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: S Phangnon Konyak to be Nagaland's first woman Rajya Sabha MP
text: BJP leader S Phangnon Konyak is set to become the first woman Rajya Sabha MP from Nagaland after winning the Rajya Sabha seat on Monday. "Women comprise 50% of the electorate. While Naga women have been very actively involved in politics, they haven't been forthcoming to contest the elections," she said. Konyak is the second Naga woman parliamentarian.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: BJP MP gives Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding Uniform Civil Code
text: BJP MP Harnath Singh Yadav on Monday submitted a Zero Hour notice in Rajya Sabha demanding the implementation of Uniform Civil Code (UCC) in the country. Notably, the party had promised to bring UCC in Uttarakhand ahead of the assembly elections. Months ago, the Centre had told Delhi High Court that there is no immediate plan to implement UCC.
author: Saurabh Sinha

headlines: Punjab Vidhan Sabha proceedings will now be telecast live: CM Mann
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday said proceedings of the state's Vidhan Sabha will now be telecast live. In his maiden address to the House after Kultar Singh Sandhwan's election as the Speaker, Mann said, "From now on, nobody will need to make a video without permission and face Privilege proceedings. The media will also get audio and videos."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AIMIM is working at the behest of BJP: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has accused AIMIM of working at the behest of BJP and has rejected any possibilities of an alliance with the Asaduddin Owaisi-led political outfit. "Congress has not received any proposal (of an alliance)," Kharge said. He added that "there is a need to be cautious of such parties which attempt to defeat secular parties".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong doesn't politicise religion or caste: Kharge on Azad's remark
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said on Monday that the party doesn't engage in politicising religion or caste and added that no other party should do it either. Kharge's remark came a day after fellow Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said that all parties divide people on a religious and caste basis, which Kharge has termed Azad's "personal view".
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Past 5 yrs saw disconnect between people of Punjab, govt: Governor
text: The past five years saw a serious disconnect between the people of Punjab and the government as they considered themselves "masters" and the public their "servile subjects," said Governor Banwarilal Purohit on Monday. He also highlighted Aam Aadmi Party's plan for the next five years, adding that the party has a "zero-tolerance policy towards corruption."
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Agencies running under BJP dictatorship: Abhishek on ED probe
text: TMC MP and Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee has claimed that investigating agencies are functioning under BJP's dictatorship. His statement came after he was questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) for eight hours over the coal scam in West Bengal. "Since they're failing to take on TMC democratically, they're using...central agencies to scare the opposition," Banerjee added.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: Saffron flag may become national flag if Hindus unite: RSS leader
text: RSS leader Kalladka Prabhakar Bhat said if Hindus unite, the "Bhagwa Dwaj" (saffron flag) may become the national flag. "It can and should happen if Hindu Samaj comes together," Bhat said. "If a majority of people vote in Parliament and Rajya Sabha in favour of changing the National Flag, then the flag can be changed," Bhat stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Nadda arrives in Imphal ahead of N Biren Singh's oath taking ceremony
text: BJP National President JP Nadda arrived in Imphal on Monday, ahead of the swearing-in ceremony of Manipur CM- designate N Biren Singh. He is going to be the CM of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will try to better my 2nd inning of politics: Supriyo on Bengal by-polls
text: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly by-elections, Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo said on Monday that he'll try to better his "second inning of politics". Supriyo, who is TMC's candidate from the Ballygunge seat, filed his nomination for the polls today. Supriyo had resigned as Union Minister and BJP's MP from Asansol in 2021 citing "politics of hatred" as reason.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: SBSP on wrong track with Samajwadi Party: BJP leader
text: UP BJP Vice President Daya Shankar Singh said Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) is on the "wrong track" with the Samajwadi Party. He added that only BJP can help SBSP achieve its goals. Singh also said SBSP chief OP Rajbhar has been raising issues of the most backward communities and BJP works for taking the weaker sections ahead.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Nationalism infused in J&K post abrogation of Article 370: Kailash Vijayvargiya
text: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Monday said that the social and political ecosystem of Jammu and Kashmir is being improved post the abrogation of Article 370. "The sense of nationalism has been infused in the hearts of the people of Jammu and Kashmir by the government," said Vijayvargiya before watching the movie 'The Kashmir Files'.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: AAP nominates Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha, IIT prof for RS from Punjab
text: Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh, IIT professor Sandeep Pathak, Delhi MLA Raghav Chadha and Lovely Professional University (LPU) Chancellor Ashok Mittal and industrialist Sanjeev Arora are the Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) nominees for Rajya Sabha, party officials confirmed. The Rajya Sabha elections will be held on March 31. The party had won 92 of Punjab's 117 seats in the Assembly elections.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: N Biren Singh to be Chief Minister of Manipur for 2nd time: BJP
text: N Biren Singh is going to be the Chief Minister of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal. BJP's announcement comes 10 days after the party won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: PM chairs meeting over govt formation in UP, U'khand, Goa: Reports
text: PM Narendra Modi chaired a meeting at his residence on Sunday over the government formation in Uttar Pradesh, Uttarakhand and Goa, as per reports. Union Ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh, BJP National General Secretary (organisation) BL Santhosh, party President JP Nadda were reportedly present. Yogi Adityanath will take oath as UP CM for the second term on March 25.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: AAP MLA Kultar Sandhwan unanimously elected Punjab Assembly Speaker
text: Two-time Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Kultar Singh Sandhwan was unanimously elected as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Legislative Assembly in Chandigarh on Monday. Mann, who had proposed Sandhwan's name in the House, congratulated him and said, "I hope you will give equal opportunity to everyone." Mann also urged the 46-year-old Speaker to allow live proceedings of the House.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: All parties, including mine, divide people: Congress' Ghulam Nabi
text: Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad, speaking at an event in Jammu on Sunday, said that all political parties, including his own, create divisions among the people along caste and religious lines. He added, "Civil society should stay together. Justice must be given to everyone irrespective of caste and religion." His remarks came amid the ongoing controversy over 'The Kashmir Files'.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Thieves break into BJP MP's Chhattisgarh home on Holi, steal ₹1 lakh
text: Thieves broke into the residence of BJP Rajya Sabha MP Ramvichar Netam in Chhattisgarh's Ambikapur on Holi on Friday and stole ₹1 lakh, police said on Sunday. A senior police officer said that guards of his residence are being questioned. He added that the police are investigating the matter.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: BJP promoting 'The Kashmir Files' to win Guj, Raj elections: Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday accused the BJP of promoting 'The Kashmir Files' with an eye on the forthcoming Assembly polls in Gujarat and Rajasthan. He added that an attempt has been made in the film to suppress several "harsh truths". The film has been brought to the screen with inspiration from the Sangh Parivar (RSS), he claimed.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: My tenure as Goa CM is over, will gladly accept duty given: Sawant
text: Ahead of BJP's legislature party meeting in Goa, state's caretaker CM Pramod Sawant has said he'll "gladly accept" whatever responsibility BJP gives him. "My...tenure has come to an end...I'm happy that I was able to get 20 seats for [BJP]," he said. The decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken on Monday, Sawant had said.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Will ensure stability: Nirmala on Biren Singh being Manipur CM again
text: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday termed the unanimous election of N Biren Singh as Manipur's CM for a second term a "good decision". "It'll ensure that Manipur has a stable and responsible government," she added. Singh was elected as CM in BJP's legislature party meeting in Imphal, 10 days after BJP won 32 Assembly seats in Manipur elections.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Cong holds 'Tiranga Yatra' in MP, observes 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'
text: The Congress Committee in Madhya Pradesh's Indore took out a 'Tiranga Yatra' on Sunday to mark two years since the day Kamal Nath resigned as CM after his government was toppled. Party workers shouted anti-BJP slogans while observing the day as 'Samvidhan Samman Diwas'. "BJP had insulted...Constitution by forming...government by horse-trading," City Congress president Vinay Bakliwal said.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Cong doesn't know many of its MLAs will join BJP: Sarma on RS polls
text: Ahead of Rajya Sabha elections for two seats in Assam, state CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said that "Congress doesn't know that many of their MLAs are going to join the BJP." He added that "candidates are not bound to follow the whip issued in the party" in these polls. "We'll manage to get both the seats," he asserted.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: No governance in Bihar but circus without ringmaster: Manoj Jha
text: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha said there is no governance in Bihar but a "circus" and that too without a "ringmaster". The people of Bihar are suffering in the ongoing circus, he added. Jha alleged that the Bihar government has lost credibility amongst the people and the administrative officers are not under the control of the government.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Merger of LJD with RJD was demand of people: Tejashwi Yadav
text: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav welcomed the move of Sharad Yadav-led Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) to merge with his party on Sunday. The Bihar Assembly's Leader of Opposition said, "The decision (merging of LJD into RJD) taken by Sharad Yadav was the demand of the people." Tejashwi also made calls for a united opposition front to defeat BJP.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP to fulfil promise of liberating Pakistan occupied Kashmir: Jitendra Singh
text: Union Minister Jitendra Singh said PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government will fulfil its promise to liberate Pakistan occupied Kashmir (PoK) just like it fulfilled its promise of abrogating Article 370. "When BJP promises something, it fulfils…Parliament passed a resolution unanimously in 1994, emphasising that Pakistan must vacate parts of J&K under its illegal occupation," Singh added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Attempts being made to divide the country once again: Mehbooba
text: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Sunday said that attempts are being made to divide the country once again on communal lines. "If we allow this religious division to happen, the sacrifice of freedom fighters like Bhagat Singh will go in vain. Therefore, do not allow Gandhi to die once again," she further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Section 144 imposed in Nizamabad after clash over new Shivaji statue
text: Telangana government imposed Section 144 in the Nizamabad district on Sunday after members of two political groups clashed over the installation of a statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The order is said to have been imposed in the Bodhan town to prohibit further escalation of the matter. Activists of both parties reportedly pelted stones at each other during the clash.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: AIUDF to back Congress' Ripun Bora in Rajya Sabha biennial polls
text: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) will back Congress' Ripun Bora in upcoming Rajya Sabha biennial elections, AIUDF's leader Aminul Islam has said. "We went to Delhi, where we had a meeting with Congress high command...Sonia Gandhi requested AIUDF chief...to support [Bora]...We agreed," he added. Congress has named Ripun Bora as its candidate from Assam for elections on March 31.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Our Hindutva not like BJP, Shiv Sena won't ally with AIMIM: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray said that Shiv Sena will not form an alliance with Asaduddin Owaisi and All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen, adding that his party's Hindutva is not like BJP. He also asked Shiv Sena's members to be ready to defeat BJP. Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday called AIMIM the "B team" of the BJP.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: State govt hoarded 'tuvar dal', over 70 lakh people affected: Cong
text: The Gujarat government, along with black marketers, has hoarded 'tuvar dal' supply for the past four months, the Congress said on Sunday. Gujarat Pradesh Congress Committee (GPCC) spokesperson Manish Doshi accused the state government of not providing 'tuvar dal' to over 70.81 lakh beneficiaries, adding that several claims about distributing food grains at cheaper rates were made in the past.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Nashik Police to summon Rajasthan CM's son in cheating case
text: Nashik Police has said that it'll summon 14 accused in a cheating case, including Rajasthan’s Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's son Vaibhav Gehlot, for questioning this week. This comes after a complaint was filed by a Nashik-based businessman on March 17 who claimed that he was lured into investing in a company with which Vaibhav was allegedly affiliated.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: No objection to teaching Bhagavad Gita in schools: Siddaramaiah
text: Former Karnataka CM and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah said that he does not have any objections to teaching the Bhagavad Gita in schools. "Children are taught Bhagavad Gita, Ramayana and Mahabharata at home as well. Moral education should be taught to children," Siddaramaiah added. "The country believes in a pluralistic society and we believe in harmony and tolerance," he stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Decision on swearing-in of Goa CM to be taken tomorrow: Sawant
text: Goa caretaker CM Pramod Sawant said the decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken during a legislature party meeting on Monday. Sawant and his party colleague Vishwajit Rane met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Saturday. Union Ministers Narendra Singh Tomar and L Murugan are observers to oversee government formation in the state.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: How can I be an outsider if PM can contest from Varanasi: Sinha
text: TMC candidate for Asansol Shatrughan Sinha on Sunday questioned the BJP's allegation that he is an "outsider from Bihar", saying, "How can I be an outsider if PM Narendra Modi who comes from Gujarat [can] contest from Kashi (Varanasi)." Furthermore, he praised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and called her a "historic leader in true sense and a tigress".
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Abhishek Banerjee to appear before ED in coal scam case tomorrow
text: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee will appear before ED in Delhi in the coal scam case on Monday. At the Kolkata airport, he said, "BJP government is taking on TMC by using Central agencies. We've defeated them and they cannot digest this." He added, "I'm ready to bow down before the power of people but not before the people in power."
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: PM Modi has given respect to North-Eastern states: Tripura CM
text: Tripura Chief Minister Biplab Kumar Deb on Sunday said PM Narendra Modi "has given respect to the North-Eastern states". "All the Chief Ministers of the North-East region have been tied into the same string of development," Deb said. He added that only after PM Modi came to power did Chief Ministers of small states get "equal importance and patient hearing".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AAP's Gopal Rai inaugurates new party office in Chhattisgarh
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Gopal Rai inaugurated a new party office in Chhattisgarh's Raipur on Sunday. "We've been receiving...calls from...people of the state to join the party," said Rai who'll be participating in 'Vijay Yatra' in the capital on Monday to mark AAP's victory in Punjab. The party is reportedly planning to contest the Chhattisgarh assembly elections next year.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Punjab govt forms new SIT in SAD leader Majithia's drug case
text: The newly-formed Punjab government has formed a new Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia in a drug case. The four-member SIT will be headed by Assistant Inspector General of Police Rahul S. Majithia is currently lodged in the Patiala jail as his judicial custody was earlier extended till March 22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sharad Yadav merges his LJD party with Lalu's RJD after parting ways 25 yrs ago
text: Former Union Minister Sharad Yadav on Sunday merged his Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) party with Lalu Prasad Yadav-led Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Delhi. The two leaders had parted ways 25 years ago. "Merger of our party with RJD is first step towards Opposition unity. It's imperative that whole Opposition gets united across India to defeat BJP," Sharad said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Bengal BJP MP claims bomb hurled at his car after watching 'The Kashmir Files'
text: Jagannath Sarkar, BJP MP from West Bengal's Ranaghat, has alleged that a bomb was hurled at his car while he was returning after watching the film 'The Kashmir Files'. "We escaped the bomb narrowly. No one is secure in Bengal...Democracy has been toppled by the state government," he said. Sarkar added that President's rule should be imposed in the state.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Some films inspire change, Kashmir Files incites hate: Cong's Jairam
text: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday criticised the newly-released 'The Kashmir Files' and said that while some films inspire change, the Vivek Agnihotri directorial incites hate. "Truth can lead to justice, rehabilitation, reconciliation and peace. Propaganda twists facts, distorts history to whip up anger and promote violence," he tweeted. Several BJP members have lauded the movie.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: What's wrong with saffronising education, shed colonial mindset: VP
text: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said the government is accused of saffronising education but "what is wrong with saffron". "We must give up our colonial mindset and teach our children to take pride in their Indian identity," he said. He also called for rejecting Macaulay's system of education in the 75th year of Independence. He made the comments in Haridwar.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: 25,000 jobs to be notified in 1 month: Punjab CM after cabinet meet
text: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann presided over his first cabinet meeting on Saturday and later said the cabinet passed a proposal to issue 25,000 government job notifications in one month. This includes 10,000 vacancies in Punjab Police and 15,000 vacancies in other government departments. "As we promised...job opportunities...will be the top priority of the AAP government," Mann said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Unfortunate that Congress didn't call it a genocide: Anupam on 'The Kashmir...'
text: Actor Anupam Kher, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', reacted to the Congress' remark wherein they said that the Kashmiri Hindus cannot be classified as "internally displaced persons". He said, "It is unfortunate that the ruling government of that time did not think of protecting or of not calling it a genocide." "It is a genocide...It's not fiction," he added.
author: Mahima Kharbanda

headlines: You'll have to work 30 hours a day: Kejriwal to Punjab MLAs
text: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday told Punjab MLAs to work hard and fulfil targets set by Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. "A day of 24 hours won't be enough. You'll have to work 30 hours a day," Kejriwal said. "If you don't meet the targets, then people will say change the minister...[then] we'll have no option," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: People crushed by price rise; inflation a tax on all: Rahul Gandhi
text: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Centre by tweeting that India's poor and middle-class were crushed by the "record price rise" even before the Ukraine war. Gandhi also added that "Inflation is a TAX on ALL Indians...GOI must act now" to protect the Indian citizens. His criticism comes days after Congress' debacle in the recent assembly elections.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: AIMIM is BJP's 'B team' which was proved in UP polls: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday dubbed Asaduddin Owaisi-led AIMIM as the "B team" of BJP. "The AIMIM has a secret alliance with the BJP which was proved in Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal elections," he said. Raut also rejected the suggestion of AIMIM to be part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance in Maharashtra.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Baseless allegations made due to Raj polls next yr: Vaibhav Gehlot
text: President of the Rajasthan Cricket Association Vaibhav Gehlot has dismissed the allegations levelled at him of duping a Nashik resident. "Rajasthan Assembly polls (are) scheduled to be held next year. So, these kinds of baseless allegations will be levelled at me," said Gehlot. The FIR was lodged against 16 people, including Gehlot, at the Gangapur Police Station in Nashik.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: All not well in BJP, says Digambar Kamat on delay in govt formation in Goa
text: Goa Leader of Opposition Digambar Kamat said that even after a week’s time since the Assembly poll results were declared in Goa, there has been a delay in swearing-in the new government which indicates that "all is not well in BJP". "The people of Goa are deprived of a government to govern the state," Kamat added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: SP-ally Rajbhar denies meeting Shah, says 'old pic' circulating
text: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar, an ally of SP, has denied reports of him meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Those are old photos. Someone can repost the old photos and say whatever they want," said Rajbhar. "The reports are baseless. Neither did I go to Delhi nor did I meet anyone," Rajbhar added.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Target is 2024 LS polls, needs more hard work: Mulayam to SP cadre
text: SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has addressed the party workers by saying that the next "target is 2024" general elections and will require "more hard work and strengthening of the party". Speaking at a Holi gathering in Saifai, Yadav praised the workers for their effort which helped SP in getting its highest vote share ever in the UP Assembly elections.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Telangana's veteran CPI(M) leader Mallu Swarajyam passes away at 91
text: Telangana's veteran communist leader Mallu Swarajyam passed away due to multiple organ failures in Hyderabad on Saturday. The 91-year-old CPI(M) member participated in the Telangana People's Armed Struggle (1946-51) against feudal lords and Razakars during the Nizam rule. As a candidate of CPI(M), she was elected to the state Assembly of undivided Andhra Pradesh for two terms (1978 and 1983).
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Ready to ally with Cong or NCP; not 'B' team of BJP: AIMIM MP
text: Aurangabad MP and AIMIM leader, Imtiaz Jaleel, has said that his party is willing to ally with the NCP and Congress for civic polls in Maharashtra. Jaleel said that it is always alleged that BJP wins because of AIMIM splitting votes. Jaleel added that to prove AIMIM is not a 'B' team of BJP, he "proposed...for the alliance".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Blaming Gandhi family alone for election debacle is not right: Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that blaming just the Gandhi family for Congress' performance in the elections is not right. Kharge said, "We've always wanted that everyone should come together to strengthen the party...We're all responsible, mentioning the Gandhi family alone is not right." This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: We want democratic 'Khela Hobe' in WB, says BJP's Keya Ghosh
text: The BJP's candidate for Ballygunge Assembly by-polls, Keya Ghosh, on Saturday said they "don't want 'Khela Hobe' of murdering people but democratic 'Khela Hobe'". Her remark was in reference to TMC's slogan 'Khela Hobe' (Game's on). Commenting further about TMC candidate Babul Supriyo she said, "Earlier, he asked for votes for BJP and now he'll ask...against...People will laugh at him."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: 'The Kashmir Files' won't provide political advantage to anyone: Sanjay Raut
text: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said it is not right to do politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir. "'The Kashmir Files' is just a film, I don't think it will provide any political advantage to anyone in the coming elections," Raut added ahead of the BMC elections. "By the time elections come, the film will be gone," Raut stated.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Whole country is talking about Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann & his works: Kejriwal
text: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal addressed Punjab AAP MLAs on Sunday and said that the whole country is talking about CM Bhagwant Mann and his works. "Compensation for crops damaged in October has been released and farmers will get cheques in the coming days. You have done good work within three days of forming the government," Kejriwal added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Will hold protests if railway concessions for senior citizens not restored: Pune Cong
text: Congress' Pune unit has warned the Centre that it will hold protests if concessions for senior citizens on railway tickets are not restored. Congress spokesperson Gopal Tiwari said concession helps senior citizens "in religious journeys and to visit other places". Tiwari added, "We condemn the decision of the Central government."
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Nawab Malik will have to resign, divesting portfolio not enough: Fadnavis
text: NCP leader Nawab Malik will have to resign and divesting portfolio is not enough, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said. "We'll not relent until he resigns. His continuation in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government as a Cabinet minister is not only unethical but goes against the spirit of the Constitution," Fadnavis added. ED arrested Malik in a money laundering case.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Uttarakhand MLAs to take oath tomorrow: BJP state chief
text: Uttarakhand BJP head Madan Kaushik has claimed that all newly elected members of the state Legislative Assembly will take oath on Monday. "All newly elected members...will take oath at 11 am in Vidhan Sabha tomorrow," said Kaushik. He further informed that the state's CM will be announced after the meeting of the Legislative Party in the evening.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP luring 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs, claims Rajasthan CM's adviser
text: Sanyam Lodha, an adviser to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, has claimed that BJP is allegedly trying to lure 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs ahead of the state elections later this year. "Number may eventually be more than 10... I had warned (Congress' Gujarat in charge) Raghu Sharma a month ago but there was no response, so I tweeted," Lodha said.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting Sonia is a good sign: Mallikarjun Kharge
text: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that G-23 leader Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting party President Sonia Gandhi was a good sign as Azad said he wants to strengthen the party. He added, "Azad has been in the party for years. He knows everything...He met Sonia Gandhi. He has spoken about keeping the party together."
author: Shreya Das

headlines: We are not opposing moral education: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah
text: Leader of the Opposition in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly and former Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday said, "We're not opposing moral teachings. We believe in the constitution and secularism."  "Let the government teach Bhagavad Gita, Quran or Bible as part of moral education," he added. "We don't have any objection, provided children get quality education," he further said.
author: Shailesh

headlines: India may soon top hate and anger charts: Rahul Gandhi
text: Citing India's global ranking on various parameters, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted that India may soon "top the Hate and Anger charts!". "Hunger Rank: 101, Freedom Rank: 119, Happiness Rank: 136," he wrote in the tweet. Notably, Rahul Gandhi's comment comes after India moved up three spots this year in the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report.
author: Shailesh

headlines: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleges ₹1,000 cr scam by Shiv Sena leaders in Mumbai
text: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed of exposing ₹1,000 crore scam alleging that Shiv Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav and his wife, an MLA, Yamini Yashwant bought 36 old buildings in Mumbai in the past two years. "₹1,000 crore scam exposed, I am confident of actions by ED, Company Ministry, Income Tax Department in next few days," the BJP leader tweeted.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Won't take pension as ex-MLA, use it for people's welfare: Parkash Badal
text: Former Punjab CM and SAD patriarch Parkash Singh Badal has decided to not take the pension as a former MLA and asked the Punjab government to use it for the welfare of the people of Punjab. "Formal request in writing being sent separately," he said. A five-time Punjab CM, Badal lost his first Assembly election since 1969 from Lambi.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: 10 MLAs sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet
text: Ten MLAs were sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet after they took oath on Saturday at Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh. The ceremony began with Harpal Singh Cheema, a second time MLA from Dirba, taking the oath. Aam Aadmi Party announced Kultar Singh Sandhwan, a two-time MLA from Kotkapura, as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Vidhan Sabha.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Was offered Pegasus spyware 4-5 years ago for ₹25 cr, rejected it: Mamata
text: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee claimed on Thursday that Israeli cyber intelligence company NSO had approached the state police department four-five years ago to sell their Pegasus spyware for ₹25 crore. "I turned it down as it could have been used politically...which is not acceptable," she said. Banerjee has repeatedly accused BJP-led Centre of using Pegasus for spying on opponents.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Political misfire: Ex-Guj CM Vaghela on giving Priyanka charge of UP
text: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela on Thursday said the decision to give Priyanka Gandhi Vadra charge of Congress in UP was a political misfire. He made the comments a day after attending the meeting of rebel Congress leaders. "G-23 isn't a revolt against the Congress...They just want to put forth concerns about the functioning of the party," he said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Bhagavad Gita to be part of school syllabus for Class 6-12 in Guj
text: Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani said on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be part of the school syllabus for Classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23. "For students of Classes 6- 8, the scripture will be introduced in the textbook of...holistic education. From Classes 9-12, it'll be introduced in form of storytelling in textbook of the first language," he explained.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Message to save water on Holi is cultural terrorism: MP minister
text: The message to save water on Holi is an attack on Hindu festivals and is cultural terrorism, Madhya Pradesh minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "How much water do we use during Holi? Save water throughout the year...Why does such a message revolve around our festivals only?" Sarang asked. He said the message was aimed at distancing youth from Hindu festivals.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Congress could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat: Congress' Tewari
text: Congress leader Manish Tewari has said the party could be looking at a Congress-mukt Bharat. "We lost in 2014 and 2019...Since 2014, out of 49 Assembly elections, we have lost 39 polls. We have only won four elections...therefore we are really looking at an extremely grim situation," he added. "The situation does not call for introspection alone," he further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Nawab Malik's portfolios to be temporarily given to his colleagues: NCP
text: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) has decided to "temporarily" give charge of portfolios held by jailed Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik to his cabinet colleagues from the party in the next two to four days, NCP leader Jayant Patil said. "He'll continue to be a Minister. We're not taking his resignation," Patil added. Malik was arrested "in a wrong manner", he stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 'Our soil not fit to run bullet train,' says Nusrat; Minister calls remark 'shameful'
text: During her speech in Parliament, actress-turned-politician Nusrat Jahan said Indian soil wasn't fit to run bullet trains. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw called her claim "shameful" and said, "We should have full faith in our engineers and our capabilities." The TMC MP later tweeted, "It's the Science...not to be taken as one speech of a street corner meeting."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help Kashmiri Pandits: Tharoor
text: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday, while sharing a Facebook post about Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' on Twitter, said, "Kashmiri Pandits suffered terribly...But demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help the Pandits either." "Hatred divides and kills. Kashmiris need justice. All need to be heard, helped and healed," Tharoor added.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: AAP MLA from Punjab's Nabha cycles 80 km for swearing-in ceremony
text: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Punjab's Nabha (SC Reserve) Gurdev Singh Dev Mann cycled for 80 kilometres for his swearing-in ceremony as a legislator in Punjab Vidhan Sabha on Thursday. He travelled 80 kilometres one way from Nabha to Chandigarh on a cycle. Mann announced that he would take a token amount of ₹1 per month as an MLA.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BJP leadership will choose next Manipur CM: Thongam Biswajit Singh
text: Manipur BJP leader Thongam Biswajit Singh said on Thursday that the party leadership will decide who becomes the state’s next CM. "BJP is a democratic party...I think they will have a talk with all our legislators before a decision is made,” he added. Singh's comments come amid speculations of him being a front runner for the position.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I've taken responsibility for Cong's U'khand poll defeat: Rawat
text: Congress leader Harish Rawat on Thursday said he has taken responsibility for Congress' defeat in the Uttarakhand Assembly polls. "If I can't control mayhem in my own house (Congress), then I don't have the right to comment on BJP's CM face," Rawat said. He added that BJP coined the term 'Muslim University' and blamed him for religious polarisation.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Can't penalise parties for not fulfilling promises: Allahabad HC
text: The Allahabad High Court observed that political parties can't be penalised for being unable to fulfil the promises made in their election manifesto. The court ruled after dismissing the petition filed by Khurshidurehman S Rehman who sought a criminal case against the BJP for allegedly failing to fulfil the promises made during the Lok Sabha elections in 2014.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: BJP fields Agnimitra Paul against Shatrughan Sinha for Asansol by-poll
text: The BJP has fielded fashion designer-turned-politician Agnimitra Paul against TMC candidate Shatrughan Sinha for the Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Similarly, the party has fielded Keya Ghosh against ex-Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who has been given a ticket by the TMC, for the by-election from Ballygunge seat. The by-polls for the two seats will be held on April 12.
author: Shailesh

headlines: Madras HC rejects plea challenging O Panneerselvam's assembly win
text: The Madras High Court rejected a voter's plea which challenged AIADMK's senior leader O Panneerselvam's election from Bodinayakanur in last year's Tamil Nadu Assembly election. Petitioner alleged that Panneerselvam had "declared false income details in his election affidavit". The plea was rejected after Panneerselvam countered by stating that he had already "declared income details".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Cong names Ripun Bora, Jeby Mather as RS candidates from Assam, Kerala
text: Rajya Sabha MP Ripun Bora and Kerala Pradesh Mahila Congress President Jeby Mather have been named as the Congress candidates for the biennial elections to Rajya Sabha from Assam and Kerala respectively. Bora was first elected to the Upper House in March 2016 while Mather has never been elected yet. The candidatures were approved by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Morality is something: BJP on NCP not seeking Malik's resignation
text: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh has criticised NCP for not seeking the resignation of Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik. The BJP leader said, "Morality is something. It's a shame if a present minister... is in jail." He added that Malik's resignation should be taken for now and if the court finds him innocent then "he could be made minister again".
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Anti-BJP alliance leader can only be chosen after LS polls: Yechury
text: CPI(M) leader Sitaram Yechury has said that the leader of an anti-BJP alliance can only be chosen after 2024 Lok Sabha elections and not prior to it. The front cannot be formed pre-polls given the diversity of India, Yechury stated. His remarks come amid ongoing efforts by Opposition leaders, including TMC's Mamata Banerjee, to forge alternate national front without Congress.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: I think Kapil Sibal should be expelled: Cong leader TS Singh Deo
text: Chhattisgarh Health Minister and Congress leader TS Singh Deo on Thursday said former MP Kapil Sibal should be expelled from Congress and that he should form his own party. This comes after Sibal said that the Gandhi family should step down and let others lead Congress. "I think tolerance is the reason for the weakness of Congress party," Singh said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: AAP might pick Harbhajan, Chadha for Rajya Sabha from Punjab: Reports
text: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) is likely to nominate Harbhajan Singh, Raghav Chadha and IIT-Delhi Associate Professor Sandeep Pathak to the Rajya Sabha from Punjab, reports said. The elections to five out of the seven RS seats of Punjab will be held on March 31. "These are the three frontrunners for the three seats for now," said a source.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: SP fields doctor Kafeel Khan for UP Legislative Council polls
text: Samajwadi Party has fielded Gorakhpur paediatrician Dr Kafeel Khan for upcoming Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council polls from Deoria-Kushinagar seat. The paediatrician at Gorakhpur's Baba Raghav Das (BRD) medical college was terminated from service by UP government last year. He was among the accused in the 2017 hospital tragedy in which over 60 children died due to disruption in oxygen supply.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Films should be made on Emergency & 'firing on Ram bhakts': BJP MP
text: BJP MP Mukesh Rajput on Thursday praised 'The Kashmir Files' and stated that movies should also be made on 1975-77 Emergency and alleged firing on Ram bhakts during ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's tenure. "People should know which CM and PM committed atrocities,” he said. 'The Kashmir Files' has revealed massacre of Kashmiri Pandits which was kept hidden, Rajput added.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: AAP ended corruption in Delhi, Mann will end it in Punjab: Kejriwal
text: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that his government eradicated corruption in Delhi, adding that the new Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann will end corruption in the state as well. He also welcomed Mann's decision of releasing a WhatsApp number on March 23, for people to share recordings if government officials ask for bribes from them.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Jharkhand's mob lynching bill is not legal: BJP state President
text: Jharkhand BJP President Deepak Prakash has termed the state's 'Prevention of Mob Violence and Mob Lynching Bill, 2021' as "not legal" and a bill passed by the state assembly for "politics of appeasement". He backed the state Governor Ramesh Bais for returning the draft of the bill and also stated that the bill will "disrupt social harmony" in Jharkhand.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Decision to quit BJP prompted by politics of hatred: Babul Supriyo
text: TMC leader Babul Supriyo, who quit BJP last year, said the decision was prompted by politics of "hatred and divisiveness" practised by its members. He further said he couldn't accept BJP leadership's "refusal to acknowledge...good work of a Bengali". BJP national secretary Anupam Hazra responded saying it's "ironical he didn't discover these traits and vices" when he was a minister.
author: Shreya Das

headlines: Bhagavad Gita is for all, not only for Hindus: Karnataka Edu Min
text: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the holy book of Bhagavad Gita "is not only for Hindus, but for all". His statement comes after the Gujarat government has decided to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus for classes 6-12. He further said that "if experts say, it will definitely be introduced" in Karnataka as well.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: Will use salary for orphan girls' weddings & poor kids: U'khand MLA Umesh
text: Umesh Kumar, the newly-elected MLA from Khanpur in Uttarakhand, said on Tuesday that he will use his salary for the weddings of orphan girls and to help poor children. "Not a single rupee will be spent on personal expenses," he tweeted. Kumar, whose sting operation in 2016 against former Uttarakhand CM Harish Rawat gained attention, fought as an independent candidate.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Punjab CM announces anti-corruption helpline; complaints to be lodged via WhatsApp
text: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has announced that an anti-corruption helpline will be launched on freedom fighter Bhagat Singh's Shaheedi Diwas on March 23. People of the state will be able to lodge complaints regarding corruption via WhatsApp. Earlier in the day, Mann said, "A very big decision will be taken today in the interest of the people of Punjab."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Mann's swearing-in ceremony helps man reunite with family after 7 yrs
text: Twenty-six-year-old Jaswinder Singh who had left his house in Faridkot seven years ago was reunited with his family after he was found working with the tent contractor, hired for Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's swearing-in ceremony. Singh's details were sent to Sadiq police station as he failed to furnish identity proof. Police approached his family for verification and he returned home.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Congress' G-23 leaders meet after party's poor performance in polls
text: A group of rebel Congress leaders, also known as G-23, met at senior leader Ghulam Nabi Azad's residence, days after the party performed poorly in five Assembly elections. Those who reportedly attended the meeting were Kapil Sibal, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Mani Shankar Aiyar and Shashi Tharoor. The leaders met amid calls for a change in Congress' leadership.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: SP supporter loses bike in poll bet, Akhilesh gives him gold chain
text: An SP supporter, Awadesh, lost his bike to a BJP supporter after losing a bet over UP Assembly poll results. He said SP chief and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav gave him a gold chain and asked him not to indulge in bets. "Had I won the bet, I would have gotten his (BJP supporter's) tempo (auto rickshaw)," Awadesh said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Bhupinder Hooda meets Rahul, day after attending rebel leaders' meet
text: Former Haryana CM and senior Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Thursday met former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi, claimed reports. A day earlier, Hooda had attended the meeting of rebel leaders of Congress, to discuss the party's situation after the poor performance in polls. Reportedly, Hooda visited senior party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad after meeting Gandhi.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: AAP moves SC against postponement of Delhi civic polls, seeks orders for SEC
text: AAP has approached SC seeking directions for the state Election Commission to conduct municipal elections in Delhi in a free, fair and expeditious manner without the interference from Centre. The plea was filed after the commission deferred polls as the Centre planned to merge three municipalities of Delhi. AAP claimed Centre was attempting to buckle the state Election Commission's independence.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Man seeks ₹3 cr in bitcoins for Nawab Malik's release, case filed
text: Maharashtra minister and senior NCP leader Nawab Malik's son Aamir Malik has lodged an FIR with Mumbai Police after a man allegedly demanded ₹3 crore in bitcoins to get his father out on bail. The accused had sent an email to him. "I've lodged the FIR, but can't share more about it as it is a confidential matter," he said.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: To oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress: Rebel leaders
text: After meeting post Congress' loss in recent Assembly polls, party's G-23 leaders said in order to oppose BJP, it's necessary to strengthen Congress. The leaders demanded Congress to initiate dialogue with like-minded forces to create way for credible alternative for 2024 general elections. They added that only way forward for Congress is to adopt model of collective and inclusive leadership.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Akhilesh shares clip of convoy running into bull, says, 'Journey in UP difficult'
text: Former UP CM and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav shared a clip on Wednesday that showed his convoy running into a bull on the road. "You will meet bulls on your travels, keep going if you can. The journey is very difficult in UP, keep going if you can," Yadav wrote. His car slowed down to give way to the animal.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: BJP MLA demands separate state of North Bengal in WB Assembly
text: BJP MLA from Darjeeling's Kurseong, Bishnu Prasad Sharma, on Wednesday demanded a separate state of North Bengal in the West Bengal Assembly. "The hills have been deprived for a very long time. Various communities...such as Gorkhas, Rajbanshis, Adivasis have been deprived," Sharma added. "We want North Bengal to be a separate state so that our problems are addressed," he stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: The Kashmir Files used to divert attention from issues: Raj minister
text: Rajasthan Food and Civil Supplies Minister Pratap Khachariyawas on Wednesday said BJP is using 'The Kashmir Files' to divert people's attention from issues like inflation and unemployment.
